Reviews.Title: “Hide your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: Tim B
Reviews.Content: What a surprise I got when I checked in to this so called resort. First of all, how can you call yourself a reort when you sit next to Interstate 10? There are no good amenities available in the area. I was disappointed at the mandatory $40 a day resort fee that was revealed to me upon check-in. For that you get valet parking, usa today, internet and admission to their athletic club and water park. The water park was dirty, the room leaked water in the bathroom and the staff in the gift/concession were rude. They will not see any money from me again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxing resort - great for all the family”
Reviews.Author: JLNuk
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying at the Arizona Grand Resort three times with my family. We're from the UK and fell in love with Phoenix, and this resort really ticked all the boxes for our needs. The grounds are very well kept and lovely to spend the week or two there, and although the last time we were there the water park was closed for winter, every other time we have very much enjoyed it. The room was perfect for a grown up family of 5, with two rooms, two large beds and a sofabed. The staff were also extremely helpful and friendly. Even though we have been here a few times already, I definitely wouldn't rule out going again!

Reviews.Title: “Entertaining, relaxing; wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KJTravelling
Reviews.Content: The Resort's many pools and water attractions, specifically the water park, are fantastic. Available only to hotel guests (and presumably their guests), there was plenty to keep my partner, our friend, her two-year old and I entertained for the afternoon. With 2 steep and 1 curling water slides, wave pool, water sports pool (volleyball, water basketball, etc.) and a river to float through it all (on inflatable tubes), the 90 degree weather was perfect. Lifeguards where numerous and within sight at all times. Our clean, spacious, first floor suite allowed us to entertain in the living area (complete with a small sink area and refrigerator) and had a pleasant, semi-private patio in the back. The room afforded us easy access to one of the regular hotel swimming pools and the water park. (And this is without exploring the on-site golf course or other entertainment offerings.) With the well-priced accommodations, we certainly plan to stay here when next we're in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “September weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kerri N
Reviews.Content: I visited the resort last summer. When I arrived at the hotel the room I was assigned had not been cleaned so I was moved to an amazing suite right on the main path to the recreation pool. Movie night floating on rafts while watching the movie with my kiddos was sooo fun. Everyone was exceptionally nice and I am amazed at how affordable the whole trip was. I drove from LA and would do so again just for the low price, friendly staff, and good times.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds for a Price”
Reviews.Author: SonnyCat
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at this hotel. I brought my mother this time and she thought the grounds were just lovely. For a big resort, there are so many cute and private little places to sit and enjoy the weather and listen to the birds. It was pretty hot so we spent most of our time in the pool. Our room was nice and the beds were comfortable. I was told that they would empty the fridge/mini bar so we could store some snacks for our kids, but they said it would be $15. We did it ourselves...no big deal. I would highly recommend purchasing a few snacks at the grocery store as everything at the hotel is of course crazy high. The coffee bar/gift shop was outrageous! We ate at the lobby grille for dinner and it was okay for the price. The Rooste is pretty cool but I wouldn't say the food is to die for or anything. The water park was great as always and this time they didn't search my bag when we came in. Last year they did and confiscated my sunflower seeds! The worst thing was when we tried to watch a movie in the room. It was $16.99! I knew it would be high but that was over the top. I knew my husband would have a heart attack on that one so we went back to the pool for a late swim. We might try another hotel with similar water attractions just to see how it compares. All in all it was a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed......”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Grand for 3 nights on business in April 2012. I am in my early 30s and travel extensively. I arrived quite late from my flight - the check in process was quick but then I had to wait for a golf cart to take me to the building because he didn't want to take just me - there was NO ONE to wait for. After 5 minutes, we left. I was in the Sedona building in a very large room- no complaints, yes TVs are dated but no big deal to me. Now on to the other things: - WIreless works OK- they shouldn't market this as a big part of the $40 resort fee when it is sporadic and somewhat slow. - I had room service two mornings for breakfast. Both times it took a long time for anyone to answer and then 30-40 minutes for food to arrive- i hate to see the wait times when the resort is busy as it was empty this week. They got my order wrong the second time but I didnt' have time for them to fix it. - The hotel bar is pretty bad. - The gym is quite nice - good facilities, clean, good hours. The resort fee is a complete rip off for the corporate traveler and the waterpark does not deserve to be in the company of the other great US hotel parks (Grand Wailea, etc). I will definitely not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worried about reviews....don't....Very Nice Resort.”
Reviews.Author: arzkats
Reviews.Content: I, like many others, was worried about staying at this resort after reading so many of the reviews. While this resort is not perfect, none are 100% perfect. Put your mind at ease and if you are booked to stay here in the future, rest assured, you will enjoy your stay. The resort itself is beautiful, from the fountains to the grounds, to the golf course, the lobby, all very pretty. The rooms are clean and very spacious, bathrooms clean, my only complaint would be the TV's which are very small and very old. But again as many have said, most people are going here to sit in their rooms and watch TV. There are nice flat screens in the lobby bar to watch the big games. Golf was enjoyable although it is a difficult course with target golf being the order of the day on the back nine. Definitely worth playing a round. The waterpark was a blast, slides are fun, beware the high speed tubes will beat you up a bit from the impact at the bottom. Lazy river is great relaxing fun. Wave pool, etc etc etc. All a great time and plenty of chairs no matter what time of day you get there. I think most of those bad reviews were spring break time in which case what do you expect. It will be like that no matter where you go. All in all, very nice place and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Enjoy your stay! If you are one of those that find something to complain about or to trash a place no matter where you go, then yes you will be able to find some things to complain about so don't worry you will accomplish your goals as well. Maybe the walk will be too far from the lobby to the room or something like that. In which case why even go on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spring break!”
Reviews.Author: TaniaFortMcMurray
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 14 year old daughter and I stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort for 5 nights in April. We had a wonderful time at the resort pool in the afternoons and thoroughly enjoyed the waterpark too! Our room was quiet and spacious and was available for us at 10:30am on the day of our arrival! We ate at the Lobby Grill a few times and enjoyed the food although the service was a little lacking. Generally we ate outside of the resort, as many interesting restaurants were just down the street and really good value for money. Starbucks (by the lobby) was great for a coffee or ice cream after supper, and there was a lovely area to sit and relax. The shuttle service to the Arizona Mills Mall was very useful. I would recommend this resort to my friends and would happily visit again - maybe upgrade to a villa!

Reviews.Title: “Family and Friends”
Reviews.Author: Kyle K
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort 2 times in the last couple of years. Each time has been a great experience for me and my family. The Staff is great. Every employee was always helpful and curtious. The kids loved the resort and waterpark. The golf course is in great shape and the convienence to golf right at the resort is fantastic. The restaurants are also very convenient and we had a great time Rustler's Rooste. I would highly recommend this resort to anywone looking for a great get away!

Reviews.Title: “Good for family”
Reviews.Author: jenmines
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Grand Hotel last week with my two small children (age 7 months and 3 1/2). We stayed in two adjacent suites instead of renting a two bedroom villa, which was sooo much less expensive, and was the perfect amount of space. My girls are too small for the water park, but they really enjoyed the pool that was right outside our room. It was fairly quiet, except for the last night where a dinner was held poolside for some corporate event. Even then, it wasn't terribly noisy, but it was enough to keep me up past my normal bed time. My only other complaint is that I was hoping that they had more fridge space for snacks because the food was fairly expensive there. Most of the fridge was taken up with mini bar food, though, so we couldn't keep anything that needed refrigeration in the room. All in all a good experience, though!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: stillettoz
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand resort was wonderful. The room was clean and neat, and very nice looking with a small patio overlooking the "Paseo", a grove of Palm trees with lights. The staff was wonderful, and the waterpark a lot of fun. Wish there was more seating available at the water park, and that there were more wait staff, but loved that there were lifeguards, so my kids could enjoy without me having to be there with them at every moment. I will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: DebTravelsSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends for 3 nights during spring break. When we arrived at 2 PM we were told our rooms were not ready but they would put a rush on them since we had an early check-in and for us to call in an hour. We called every hour and they told us they are working on our rooms, however, it was not until after 6 PM when they were finally ready. The front desks response when we went to get our keys: “Well we’re busy today”. No apology, just attitude which surprised us for the type of resort this is. We were off to a bad start but we were looking forward to a great vacation. The room was large and fairly close to the water park, in fact none of the rooms are very far from the park, which is nice. The following day we got to the water park shortly after it opened ; it seemed crowded but we did not have any trouble finding five lounge chairs together. The food at the park is traditional water park food with typical pricing (expensive). The food and drink service was responsive and quick. We stayed until 6 pm when the slides and river features closed figuring we would get cleaned up and go out to dinner. When we got back to the room, it had not been cleaned. We waited another half-hour to get it cleaned; to management’s credit, they were responsive when we called this time. The following day the power went out in the building. Later the same day the water was turned off to the whole building without notice. When we called the front desk to ask when the water would be turned on we were initially told they were unaware of a problem. Subsequent calls we were told, “The water will be on within the thirty minutes”. The water finally was turned back on around 7 PM. The following morning at 8:30a.m. housekeeping was knocking on our door to clean the room. Really, they could not manage to get there on any other date before 5:00p.m., unless we called. We spoke directly with the Manager on duty, in person, regarding the hotel's promise to honor a 4p.m. check out time, due to our inability to get in our room until after 6p.m the first day and he promised to honor it. Imagine our surprise when our key failed to work at 2:00p.m.!!! Problems with the room aside, the water park is enjoyable and well kept. Food and drink service is fast and efficient. The wave pool did not appear to be on the entire time we were there and the area was constantly filled with floats from the river feature. There was not a line for the ‘big’ slide and a relatively short line for the shorter slide. Note, when you slam into the water from the big slide it hurts… I guess that is why there is not a line. Overall, with a Management shakeup and the hiring of additional housekeeping staff this could be a 4 star hotel. The water park is most suited for younger kids, 12 and 13 year olds lost interest in the park after a few hours. This is a nice ‘quick trip’ if you live close, but the Arizona Grand is certainly not a destination and we will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing family get-away.....”
Reviews.Author: cambridge101
Reviews.Content: My family came last summer and will be coming once again May 5th! We found it relaxing, enjoyable, and definetly worth the trip. *Resort- The resort itself is large and easy to get around (once inside.... parking is a little difficult) There are many attractions within. You can tell rennovations have been made in certain parts of the buildings. Be aware, since it is such a large facility, a large ammount of walking is required! *Rooms- The rooms were comfortable, and had old charm. I hadn't noticed many of the blemishes pointed out by other on this site, considering we spent most of our day at the water park and once we returned, passed out due to exhaustion! Televions needed exchanging, orand a slightly bigger bathroom would have been nice. Overall, good rooms. Bed's comfortable, pillows AMAZING. *Oasis Water Park- Fun for all ages! We came around 10:45 unaware of the need to arrive early. However, a couple under a cabana had left for breakfast and we were able to snath the shaded area. The kids ran off, and we spent the entire day there. The water is excellent, and the lazy river's exceptional. Tip: If unable to find a lounging chair due to hortage, ask a staff member! *Food- Considering we were on a budget, we did not eat at all around the resort. Instead, for dinner we drove up the hill to a fun, western restaurant called Rustler's Roost. The slide into the dining area welcomes you, and the saw dust on the floor added to the effect. Don't be afraid to try Rattlesnake... tastes like chicken!:) *Extras- If you are on a lower level or have a bad view, some portions of the buildings have stairways to the roof. At the fall of dusk we went up one of the stairways and found not only a fabulous phoenix view, but lounging chairs! We ended up laying out for a while and enjoying the night temp and the scenic view of phoenix lights. -I have fabulous memories here, so don't be scared by some of the grumpy reviewers:) Hope you enjoy this resort as much as I did-

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Small Groups”
Reviews.Author: EvanPorter
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort for four nights. The friendliness and service was quite good, and most people were very approachable. Front desk service was very good as well. The good: there was something for everyone there. There are multiple pools and hot tubs on the resort, and the adult pool offers an area away from the hustle and bustle of the water park. The spa is great for relaxation as well. The entire resort was very safe feeling and very comfortable wherever I went. The not so good: The key cards for your room REALLY need to be updated. I had nothing but trouble with mine, and ended up making 4 or 5 trips back to the front desk just to get into my room. The housekeeping staff are on the job quite early, and in some cases were knocking on doors before 9 in the morning (I found this disturbing). I also had housekeeping just walk into my room without knocking at all. The resort offers a few different choices of restaurants, but I spent the most time in the "lobby grill". The food itself was great, but I found the staff had some "weak" servers. Sometimes I would be taken care of better than ever before, and other times I would have lengthy waits for any attention at all. I found this frustrating at times, and can even single out who was good and who was slacking. In addition, the room doors and outside walls do not offer much silence. I was awoken a few times by screaming children or even the sound of a suitcase being pulled across the stone walkways. Overall: It was a good experience. The atmosphere here is perfect for families or couples, but I wouldn't recommend it to singles, as there were virtually no other people here that were like me. 90% of the time, service is fantastic but there were one or two servers in the kitchen that need to be helped. Room quality was good, but the key cards desperately need to be updated to something a little more reliable. If you are going somewhere with the kids or your significant other, I highly recommend it. If you are shooting off on a solo adventure, you might want to pick something in a different direction.

Reviews.Title: “Not for adults only anywhere, except maybe at the bar”
Reviews.Author: KAL2311
Reviews.Content: It was packed with families and that's great unless you forgot to have children. The place is huge and has big pools, a big lazy river and water slides, stage and constant music on one side of the property. However, when a friend and I were in town on business, we decided to go to a small pool in a enclave near our room, and we were there no more than 15 minutes when a family of 4 kids jumped in the tiny pool splashing us and using water guns like they thought is was the water park area. There was another "older" couple there (like in their 30's) and the four of us couldn't believe the parents would allow this, being that we were there first. I think, even in Disneyland, adults (anyone over 30) needs a small haven, other than the hotel bar where we had to go after that incident. Why should we be holed up in the tiny, but nice ok enough room? After a few drinks, poured by one great bartender, we went down both of the 8-story drop water slides. If ya can't beat 'em join 'em! But management, please rope off one little pool for adults in the middle of this huge complex. Yes there is a lap pool for old folks near the gym...right next to the screamers going down the slides. I screamed my hear off!

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the pictures on their website fool you!”
Reviews.Author: mama34
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort for one night. My kids really enjoyed the Oasis Water Park. The rooms at this resort was another story. Our room had a nice view of the golf course. Once we walked into the room, it was dark and had a smell to it. They still had the small tube t.v's. The food at the water park was over-priced, but I expected that, so I was not surprised there. My kids aged 8, 10, and 11 had a great time at the water park, but called it quits after a few hours. Overall they had a good time. Rooms at this resort needs to be brightened a bit and updated.

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Shannon W
Reviews.Content: I am an event planner and brought a group of 150 people to the Arizona Grand for our annual convention. The resort staff was the best I have ever worked with. The food was absolutely delicious and the facilities were beautiful, functional and clean. The property is absolutely gorgeous and we were treated like royalty. I plan on returning for a leisure trip so that I can enjoy more time at the water park and spa. We had several golfers in our group that raved about the golf course. I highly recommend the AZ Grand Resort for a conference or for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, kid friendly, comfortable, safe, crowded, tired, relaxing....available!”
Reviews.Author: Boymomsrock
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews for this resort. They describe the resort to a tea. Clearly you see the place is a popular resort. But it's available! And massive! Who wants to stay @ a chain hotel for Spring Break. We booked late so were happy to find this comfortable resort for our week. It fit the bill. We reserved the Biltmore but thought it would not be as enjoyable for our 8 y.o. son. We were attending an NCAA collegiate golf tournament nearby. We found the beds and linens comfy, bathroom small, furnishings fine and clean. Lots of families everywhere...and happy. I was a little teste when I looked for chairs. They should change the policy allowing folks to hold chairs unused for hours. Lazy river deightful, hot tub awesome, room service for breakfast was good and staff always warm and friendly. The resort is tired and knowing golf like I do, I'm sure the golf course is $$$ to maintain thus the resort buildings are last on the list. We spent a lovely week at the Grand. And I hope it gets an update.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break was a success”
Reviews.Author: julesbergjones
Reviews.Content: I was immediately drawn to the AGR because of the waterpark. After I booked a non-refundable reservation two months in advance, several negative reviews started popping up and I was beginning to panic. I figured there's no way out of it, so I may as well make the best of the situation. The moment we arrived, we were greeted at our car by the concierge who welcomed us and pointed us to the check-in desk. After our check-in, the concierge drove a golf cart leading us to a parking spot close to our room. He took in our bags and helped us get oriented to everything offered at the resort, so customer service was extraordinary upon check-in. Perhaps we were there during a slow week, but we had no trouble finding chairs after the waterpark had opened. Eating at the Oasis Restaurant was way expensive though - I paid $44 for a cheeseburger, hot dog, chicken wrap, fries, and three small drinks. Ouch. My kids enjoyed the dive-in movie, although it was the same movie each night we went. The food overall at the resort was pricy. We ate off the property for the majority of our meals. There's a Waffle House just on the other side of I-10 and an In 'n' Out Burger south of the resort on the Ray Road exit in Chandler just a short drive away. We stocked up on breakfast items and snacks from a grocery store to help save money. Our room was in the Sedona building, room 255. It had a king size bed and a pull out sofa bed which my son used. He had no complaints about it. The bathroom was very big. Housekeeping did a great job of tidying up and changing our towels each day. Our stay was overall very quiet with the exception of several people congregating in front of our door late one night. As a single mom, I felt safe at the resort and my kids felt that there was plenty to do and hold their attention (ages 13 and 9.) We enjoyed walking around the beautiful grounds and exploring the area. As many have mentioned in their reviews, the tv's are dated but my kids never once complained. We weren't on vacation to watch tv, but I understand that a flat screen is a nice touch. The $40/day resort fee was a tough pill to swallow when you don't use the services each day. I was disheartened to read another reviewer say that locals got in by claiming they lost their wrist bands. There definitely needs to be better attention to detail with that because the rest of us staying there paid our dues to take advantage of the facilities. Lastly, I would like to see more cleaning throughout the day at the waterpark. By late afternoon there was garbage scattered around and the wind would blow dead tree leaves and blossoms into the pools and lazy river making it yucky. And the stairwell where you had to wait to go down the waterslide pooled up with murky yellow/brown water that you had to stand in because there wasn't a drain. Gross. I wouldn't mind returning again as overall we had a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Room size great, but everything else poor”
Reviews.Author: freeze5
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 visited during spring break for 5 days. Each meal the service was horrific especially during breakfast. The buffet was in constant need of replenishment and you had to beg for coffee. Tried to order off the menu, but food came wrong and slow. To use the water park you had to wait in a 30+ minute line so you could scramble for a lounge chair. Instead tried to use the pool by the room and they had only 13 lounge chairs. The housekeepers were pleasant, but room each day was not cleaned until after 3:00PM. One day the water was turned off for the afternoon and still off when we left for dinner at 7:00 meaning no toilet flushing, no shower after a hot day in the sun and on the same day they lost electricity and could not supply towels at the water park. The positive's: room size was great and weather was awesome. We would not go back and would highly recommend looking for an alternate property to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Week getaway”
Reviews.Author: pcoop2244
Reviews.Content: Grandchildren had two good days in the water park, but that was enough. Over all they were dissapointed in the waterpark as it quickly became boreing. Need to take along additional friends. Room accomidations were good, beds comfortable, clean, employees friendly. Price was right with their special promotion. Glad we went. I was dissapointed that such a large facility does not recycle. We took our cans and bottles home to recycle. But not much evidence of others doing the same. Not planing on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our visit”
Reviews.Author: JayATC
Reviews.Content: Recently had the opportunity to stay at the Arizona Grand Resort for a business conference. I found the staff to be exceptional and very friendly. The pricing wasn't horrible for a resort of this scope and caliber. The resort and aminities were clean and nicely appointed. Our room was nice and clean. We enjoyed our visit very much and would highly recomment the resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Arizona Grand Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Maria B
Reviews.Content: We went to the Arizona Grand Resort for a 3 day Spring Break vacation with my 10 year old daughter, a girlfriend, and her 9 year old. The kids had a blast, the moms had a nice relaxing time, with drinks by the pool, workouts, and spa treatments. Came back refreshed and wanting to return!

Reviews.Title: “Quick Easter Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: AR98
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited the Arizona Grand Resort for Easter weekend. We travelled with our 3 kids (ages 11,11 and 13). The reason we picked this hotel was because of the Oasis Waterpark. The resort is nicely located, easy access to restraunts and shopping. When we arrived the employee at the check-in desk wasn't as friendly as we expected and was not clear to where our room was located. We ended up finding it on our own. We booked the Resort Queen Suite which was big enough for our family. The only down side about the room is that the bathroom sink is located on the outside of the bathroom that is adjoined to the bedroom. The bathroom itself was a bit small but our family of 5 managed pretty well. Housekeeping did a pretty good job cleaning the room everyday. Now one thing I have to point out is that some room are actually adjoined by a door. When we arrived the door that adjoined our room with the one next door was actually unlocked. Thankfully the next door room was empty and we locked the door. For some families this may be a safety concern so if you stay at this hotel double check that the door that adjoins your room with the room next door is locked. Overall our stay was pleasent the concierge staff were espescially friendly and the waterpark is a nice addition. If you're family is looking for a cheap affordable place to stay in Phoenix this in not the hotel for you. For our stay of 4 nights we ended up spending about $1000 just to book this hotel not including meals. There are lots of other hotels that offer a great rate plus breakfast. But if you're looking for a nice resort aimed at a family vacation and are willing to spend a little more then the Arizona Grand is the right choice. Overall we enjoyed our stay and hope to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “4 Diamond? AAA missed the mark on this one...”
Reviews.Author: wendypel
Reviews.Content: In a continual quest for the resort that can meet our 11 twin boys' expectation of fun and our need for comfort with a splash of luxury, we selected the Arizona Grand Resort because of it's water park and 4 diamond rating. It turned out to be a disappointment for all. Here are my few pros and many cons: The Room: Pro: We stayed in a Deluxe Queen Suite and had paid to be in a building near the waterpark. The room was large enough for the 4 of us. The beds were comfortable and the amenities were nice. Con: The carpet was wet...we are hoping it was just cleaned? I guess we can take comfort in the fact that they do clean the carpets, but it gave the room a really musty smell and a general sense of unease. The bathroom door was warped and required a contortionist move to close it. The bathroom was extremely small and dark. The TVs were from last century and very small. The sofa bed could hardly be called a bed - the mattress was so thin - and squeaked all night. The Water Park & Pools: Pro: They have a water park and they have lots of pools. Cons: Our boys were bored with the waterpark in under an hour - and my kids love water parks. Maybe if you have younger kids - and/or less adventurous kids - it might work for you? You have to wear a bracelet to get into the park...it's a little annoying as an adult. All the reviews are right that there are not enough chairs. And we found that was more the case at the pools away from the park. For a 4 diamond resort, the pool towels are small, thin and simply awful. Food & Beverage: Pros: N/A Cons: Other than an order of fries, we never ate at the hotel...not for lack of trying. The wait staff at the park walked by us no less than a dozen times and never once asked if we wanted anything. The ice cream machine at the park was broken. The restaurants at the hotel were so far away from our room (and 4 Diamond expensive) that we would have needed to take our car anyway, so we went out for dinner. We did attempt to catch lunch before our flight at the Lobby Grill - at 11:00 when they said they were open for lunch - but were told we had to wait until all the breakfast guests had finished before she could even seat us. We left. Other annoyances: 1) The hotel staff uses loud gas-powered golf carts to get around. They beep when in reverse. The staff drives them on the paths in front of the guest rooms - until late at night. 2) A plus for some, but an annoyance for us, they have a kiddie DJ in the waterpark that goes from 6 - 8 and the volume is loud. If you have pre-tween or tween girls, this is probably a big hit, but it was a primary reason we fled the hotel for several hours. 3) The whole place just seemed tired. My husband commented that the place needs a good pressure wash. 4) There always seemed to be housekeeping staff in the halls (who had a fabulous knack for leaving their carts blocking passage), but there also seemed to always be dirty dishes and linens in the halls. 5) It is right off the freeway - which is convenient, I guess, but it really doesn't give you the sense that you are "getting away from it all." So, our quest for the ideal vacation resort continues. I guess I am most baffled by how this place has a 4 diamond rating. I have stayed in Ritz Carltons, Four Seasons and other luxury hotels and there is no way this hotel even comes close.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spring break with family”
Reviews.Author: Dave L
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Arizona Grand Resort. With five I our party, our room with double queen beds and a living room area with a sleeper sofa was perfect. We all loved the water park. Sure, it would get a little crowded but that is what happens at a large resort. With a little patience, we found room for the five of us together. We were surprised that the package only came with four water park bracelets and that there would be an additional charge for the fifth bracelet. Thankfully, one of the front desk staff took care of us and simply gave us the fifth bracelet for the water park. I think that if the resort allows you took book rooms with five, you should expect the same number of bracelets for the water park. Our room could have used a tv upgrade. Vacationing with sd tv does seem dated, but we were not there to watch television. Staff did a good job and took care of us.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Resort? NOT”
Reviews.Author: Tammy B
Reviews.Content: I travel many times each month on business and the accomodations here were NOT 4 star anything. Very dirty room (our feet were black within minutes of taking our shoes off), fridge didn't work (drinks stayed warm the whole time) the tub didn't drain (after 5 minute shower you were standing in 4 inches of water) and we found a couple of bugs. :( Very disappointed with the room. The water park was good. The onsite restaurants were TERRIBLE. Never would recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: iopscusa
Reviews.Content: Although the resort itself is beautiful, there were a couple things that really ruined the experience. The biggest thing that everyone going here should be aware of is that if you are not in line at least one hour before the waterpark opens, you are not getting a chair at all until around 3:30. The park opens at 10:00 and by 10:15 there is not a single chair available. People begin lining up at 8:30 am. After 10:15 you will have to find a patch of grass and even concrete in the corner to set up camp for the day. Also, they search your bag everytime you enter the park. You are not allowed to bring ANY outside food or drink in. I was forced to throw away my water that was 2/3 gone. After being searched several times at the airport on the way there (normal procedure) it was offensive to have to then get searched daily at my "relaxing" resort. Then there were SEVERAL little things that just added up eventually. For example, had to call everyday for coffee in my room, one day my room wasn't cleaned at all and when I called at 3:00 to inquire I was treated like I was asking for a million dollars. Finally, the staff, including management, never wanted to hear about any complaints. Just an overall feeling that they really did not care one way or another. We have stayed at several resorts and this one was definately a disappointment. There are way too many beautiful resorts in the Phoenix area to waste your money on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two young kids (3 and 5). The water park is amazing. The kids loved it. It was very crowded the first day but not too crowded the second day. The lazy river is very relaxing and fun for the kids. The water slides are very steep and the kids must be 48 inches to ride so they couldn't go. Still, the hot tub, kiddy pool, wave pool and lazy river were all we needed. We stayed in the Grand Suite which was huge. We upgraded a living social deal and I'm glad we did. It wasn't that much more money and it was great to have all the space. The onsite restaurants were fine. The Lobby Grill had a decent breakfast but like everything else at the resort was quite expensive for what you get. The Rustlers Roost dinner restaurant was really fun for the kids (or would have been if they weren't so exhausted from all the swimming).

Reviews.Title: “Great Family/Friend Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany S
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Arizona Grand and it was just as wonderful as the first. The staff is friendly and made you feel welcome! Room was very clean and the view was great! My kids loved the pool and slides, and our friends were impressed by the Resort. The spa was relaxing and my husband loves to golf the course. The only disappointment was when I talked to a woman in the pool she stated that her and her family live in Phoenix and come every weekend to the pool at the resort. She said they just walk in and say they lost their bracelets and they get new ones from the staff and they are in for the weekend. She also pointed out that other families in the pool were not staying there and did the same. thing. But overall...we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Jeff F
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Arizona Grand for the last 6 years on the first week of April. I can say that we keep coming back because of the Arizona weather and the fabulous staff and grounds of the Arizona Grand. We love the water park and of couse the golf course. I would also like the thank the director of rooms Darrell Collins. He always goes out of his way to make your stay an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings....almost get it right.”
Reviews.Author: fitmama26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have real mixed feeling about this resort. They almost get it right, but not quite. Pros: *Location is great. Right by the highway they will get you anywhere pretty quick. *Love being by the South Mountains. I enjoyed running there each morning *The Fitness facilities are awesome, even though the weekend attendant wasn't the nicest person there *The resort lobby and atmosphere is well kept up and lovely * Most staff was very friendly * Lots of activities for the kids, but very crowded. Cons: *House keeping was aweful. Things were never wiped down or vacuumed. Coffee never replaced, nor any sundries * Our room had one coffee cup and one garbage can * We had to run for our own toilette paper three times * Never enough chairs at either the over crowded water park, nor the pools. * Carpets worn and dirty * Pull out sofa worn and uncomfortable * Really overpriced for the room * Refrigerator never kept anything cold

Reviews.Title: “Probably better resorts to pick from.”
Reviews.Author: SueSammamish
Reviews.Content: We had a lot of issues with this resort. They lost our reservation (I booked with AAA and had a confirmation #). Verify your reservation! They did upgrade our room, but had it been a day later they would not have had room as they were full. As we were trying to check in, a guest was complaining about bugs in his room after being moved from another room with bugs. We did not see any in our room. They also double charged me when we checked out. Again, reservation departments mistake. A lot of wasted time trying to fix these issues. If you do not wait in the long line at least half an hour before the water park opens, you will not get a chair. We went in right at 10:00am the first day and there were no chairs to be had. We ended up sitting on the bar chairs until something cleared up. We asked for more chairs and they said they did not have any. The water park is fun, although the wave pool had very weak waves in it. Fun lazy river, could use better cleaning as there was a lot of debris from the trees in it. The room was spacious. They had the only old school TV's left in the country and ours kept turning itself off. Not to mention they are small. The beds were comfortable, but the pillows were the worst I have slept on. They fold over on themselves. The phone keys looked like they had not been cleaned for a couple years, yuck. Despite all that, the kids did have fun. I don't think we'd go back. We'll try the Hilton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Getaway”
Reviews.Author: l0vedthesun
Reviews.Content: Our family of three and two other families visited this property during Spring Break. We had children ranging in age 18 - 7 in our group and six adults - there was something for every one of us to do! The resort offers a fantastic health club facility, hiking nearby, bike rentals, the beautiful golf course and driving range and of course, the water park! We highly recommend this property to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “good clean resort -poor service”
Reviews.Author: tim s
Reviews.Content: nice resort, clean, golf marginal., waterpark is fun good slides and lazy river. Stay away from aunt chiladas on site mexican restaurant..... we love mexican and this place is terrible. overall great family resort, there restaurants are Lacking service and quality, and the overall staff service of the resort is POOR....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely holiday in the desert”
Reviews.Author: petersenmj
Reviews.Content: We took our 2 year old here for a 5 night stay in early April. Admittedly we didn't realize it was still Spring Break, and the resort was busy, but we still enjoyed our stay. It's a good location, only a 15 minute taxi ride ($20) from the airport, and you can easily walk to the Mountain Reserve trails next door. And there is a large grocery store just around the corner ( we took a cab but you could walk), so you can stock up on essentials if you want. We also took a taxi to the Phoenix Zoo which is about 20 minutes away (so you dont necessarily need to rent a car). The restaurants are a little overpriced, but that's to be expected. Some reviews have complained about the older rooms, but I quite liked the character of the older buildings, and our room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Its a great place for families with lots to do to keep everyone happy. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Resort at the Most!”
Reviews.Author: Rosepebble
Reviews.Content: I was sorely disappointed in my two night stay at the Arizona Grand Hotel. The first room we were shown had been left open, smelled like cigarette smoke and the living room light bulb way on the counter. The hotel quickly accommodated us in a second room that smelled vaguely like vomit. Ugh. Neither remote worked for the television, there was no channel guide, the extra pillow didn't have a pillow case and the bathroom garbage can was dirty. And that was just the first hour! The second day we were very disappointed to find the water park over run and no available seating to be found within an hour of opening. Disheartening when that is part of the reason for the trip. This was my third stay at the resort and will be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: cwal
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed for three nights in a poolside suite in the Camelback building in early April, 2012. The suite was very tastefully decorated in a modern, fresh taupe and cream palette with wicker accents. It was very clean with the exception of a couple grease marks on the carpet from a previous occupant's wheeled suitcase. The suite contained a bedroom with two queen beds, a built-in closet, a TV, and the bathroom. The bathroom was TINY (the door barely cleared the toilet) with the sink and granite make-up counter/mirror out in the bedroom area. I personally dislike this design due to lack of privacy for the person getting ready. Plus, turning on the lights above the make-up counter to see wakes up anyone still sleeping. The beds were comfy with pretty white linens encasing a feather comforter. We had four pillows per bed although they were tiny (about 1/2 the size of a normal bed pillow). The bath towels were thick and fluffy. There is a french door in the bedroom, with very nice "black out" drapes, leading out to a small balcony that is handy for hanging wet swimsuits to dry. The bedroom was separated with a door from a living room that contained a sleeper sofa desk/table with chairs, another TV, and a mirrored wet bar area with a second small sink and refrigerator (no microwave). The set-up was perfect for our two kids to stay up watching TV without disturbing us while we slept. There was a game controller with the TV, but renting the GameCube and the games were extra $$$. The suite was very quiet -- we didn't hear any other hotel guests during our stay. Without fail, the maid service came to spread up the beds and replace the towels no later than 4:00pm each day (remember to leave them a tip when you check out!) Our suite overlooked one of the two "family" pools with a jacuzzi that were open from 10-10. These pools were rarely full/loud since The Oasis water park was only a 2 minute walk through the building. Guests enter water park through the gift shop, instead of the large iron gates, which I found kind of odd. The gift shop is also where you switch out your broken wrist band from the day before for a new one (unless you can tolerate leaving it on from one day to the next). As other reviewers mentioned, there is a long line that starts queing outside the gift shop a good half hour before the park opens. The Oasis contains a lazy river and the two 8-story water slides plus a large sun-bathing lounge area (plus two canopies for shade lovers). This area is called the "island" and is open from 10-6. The rest of the waterpark contained the zero-depth entry wave pool, jacuzzi, a kid pool (with basketball hoop), a toddler pool, a splash pad, the DJ stage, the food service station, and a large "tiki" style bar plus plenty of loungers. This area is open from 10-8. The DJ begins his kid-oriented schtick each night at 6:00. I understand there are movies shown at dusk, although we didn't participate. During our visit to The Oasis, we were always able to get enough pool towels and lounge chairs, although the loungers were due to be pressure-washed. The roving servers for food/drink orders and people to bus the cups/plates get stretched a bit thin at certain times of day depending on the size of the crowd. We ate at the pool-side buffet (near the wave pool) for dinner one night. The food was plentiful and good ($17 adult; $10 per child), although the one-trip rule bothered a few guests in our party. Tips: 1) The resort lobby is the third exit around the traffic circle; the signage needs improving. The resort also has Villas (privately owned condos), a conference center, and a golf course, so it's easy to get lost when trying to find where to check in. 2) The Marketplace off the hotel lobby serves Starbucks and pastries for breakfast if you don't want to go to the hotel restaurant. 3) The lobby is gorgeous with outdoor seating around firepits -- perfect for an evening glass of wine. 4) The front door staff are happy to drive guests to various parts of the resort, including to the Rustler's Roost restaurant (a must see). Also consider visiting Aunt Chilupa's for margarita's -- it's a short walk on a lighted path from the hotel. 5) The Tempe Mills mall is about 5 minutes away -- kind of teen place with GameWorks (huge video arcade) and stores that appeal to the younger set, but it also is where the Sea Life Aquarium is located. Our family would not hesitate to stay at the Arizona Grand Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property; quiet and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: AlyMcK
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 5-night stay at the Arizona Grand. We left on the on the first day of Spring Break and it was getting very crowded and it would have been less relaxing, had we stayed longer. The negatives: the $40/night resort fee which I thought was really high; the room carpet stains (which weren't really that bad) and the mini fridge could have been a little cleaner. There were many more positives: the spacious rooms with the separate bedroom; good restaurants on-site; friendly, helpful staff and beautiful grounds and pools. I especially enjoyed my happy-hour wine with a good book in the lobby bar overlooking the golf course. Since we had a later flight, after check out at 11am, it was really appreciated to have the use of the pool and the spa to freshen up before leaving for the airport. Having the use of the business center was really helpful too. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Trip”
Reviews.Author: dprell
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time! Family of 4 with a 9 and 11 year old had a blast. The nightly DJ / Dance party around the pool from 6 to 7:30 was great fun and provided lots of laughs. Followed by a kids movie around the pool was brilliant. The pool service and food / beverage set up was perfect. Food was good with lots of variety. Spent a couple nites at their competitors resort and this stacked up way better for our family. Very impressed in all aspects. Only downfall was the water park was so full we had to sit in the grass. Apparently they are open to public which did make for crowded seating conditions. I feel that every hotel guest should be able to have a seat to sit in!!!!! The park was large enough that the lines were not long, the pool was not over crowded. The lazy river did get congested but was still very relaxing. There are lifeguards which makes for some relaxation for parents. The water was heated and comfortable. The rooms were perfect with a bedroom to close the kids off. Small refridgerator but no microwave............... darn it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Trip- Handicap Accessible!”
Reviews.Author: Sue W
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a terrific stay at The Arizona Grand Resort in Phoenix. We visited during their very busy Spring Break, and found the staff to not only be helpful and friendly, but very plentiful! We are a family of five, and we were traveling with a son in a wheelchair as well as two other families. The grounds are beautiful, and everything was very accessible for us. We found the staff went out of their way to accommodate all of us, and our entire group of 14 people had nothing but positive experiences from start to finish! The waterpark was wonderful and our kids enjoyed playing basketball in the water, as well as the slides. They also enjoyed the ice cream as well as the "alcohol free" version of the pina coloda frosty drink! Those were popular with the kids, while the adults enjoyed the real deal! And I can honestly say I was pleasantly surprised at check out when I paid the final bill! Very reasonable. Be sure to visit Rustler's Roost restaurant, which was a really fun night out with great food and lively music and atmosphere! Also, the lobby restaurant, The Grille, had great food and service. Our group enjoyed a great casual dinner in the lobby bar while watching NCAA March Madness on big screen tv's! The fire pits set throughout the resort lend to a very cozy feel and we spent a few nights gathered around with our group! And you can not beat having a Starbuck's on property! Great times... Choose The Arizona Grand and you will not be sorry! And take advantage of the beautiful property by going on a hike-- Magnificent views of Camelback Mountain!

Reviews.Title: “Place needs some more help and some updates to rooms.”
Reviews.Author: LauraS1125
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a good stay here. We were here over spring break week and the facility was crowded. Common areas had leftover cups plates etc for long periods of time. Called for extra pillows and were told there were none left. Went to get dessert at the Marketplace last night. They were sold out of all 12 flavors of ice cream. Food is fair quality and resort prices, $17 for a hot dog, fries and drink plus a tip. Rooms need updating. Old TV with very poor reception Many stains on carpet. Room was very clean otherwise. My son loved the water park.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking quality, cleanliness and upkeep”
Reviews.Author: Marcia M
Reviews.Content: This resort has the potential to be nice, but fell short in many areas. We were here this week during busy spring break, and I will try to avoid that in the future. First, you had to get in line to enter the pool area about 45 minutes before it opened. Any later than that and you would not get a chair anywhere. Then once the oasis pool opened, people literally RAN to get seats. If you didn't wait in line, well you were out of luck...no seat anywhere all day. Top it off with ragged tiny towels and absolutely dirty, brown chairs...well best to just spend your time standing in the wave pool. Kids enjoyed the lazy river, but your were tube to tube with hundreds of other people floating! Room was big and adequate, but smelled musty and old. Property overall was dingy and unkempt. Needs a major $$ upgrade and all staff should make a trip to a nice resort a la disney or something to understand what quality, cleanliness and service are all about. Staff ALL are a bunch of college kids and under 21s. Food was totally mediocre and expensive by the pool. Better to pay the extra money and go to Biltmore or another quality resort unless you just have a big batch of young kids/toddlers who just want to sit in the wave pool all day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed & Misleading website. poor management”
Reviews.Author: D J
Reviews.Content: Beware of this Resort. Booked 2 rooms "poolside Deluxe" according to website. Rooms were 120 yards from pool, overlooking stairwell and delivery lot. Sedona Block third floor. This was "within guidleines of 5 minute or less walk to pool" accoring to manager. Why didn't they tell me that when I booked instead of "they will be a nice poolside room". Rooms had overwhelming odor of cigarettes and wet animal. Floors very damp in one. Awoken first morning at 6:30 am to diesel truck engine idling for one hour, (manager says "sorry but this is a place of business"). I contacted front desk four times the first day asking for a new room but never received. Rooms are very tired. OLD CRT tube 1990's TV. despite four phone calls throughout first day was not given room change option. Manager offered cash compensation but I refused. I wanted what I paid for and what was promised. How can they advertise this as a "poolside room". What a joke. I wouldn't stay here again for $50/night nevermind the $300 plus $20/person/Day resort fee. Speaking of which, the water park is huge BUT, with advice of another resort guest we got in line to enter at 9:20AM before park opening at 10AM in order to get chair. Lucky for us as we managed to grab last ones. By 11AM even all of the grass areas were crammed full of people sitting on towels. Waited over 1 hour for poolside drink service to be delivered and never saw the attendant for over 2 1/2 hours despite leaving a $10 tip the first time. Stay away from this place unless you have very low standards. Kids enjoyed the waterpark slides and lazy river though. Don't be fooled by the nice lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Water Park for Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: drdfsdaz
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at AZ Grand Resort to take my grandson, who was visiting from Colorado for a week. The main reason I looked at this hotel was the Oasis Water Park. Had heard good reviews. I booked several weeks ahead and was confirmed for a room with 2 queens beds (1 bed rm, 1 bath, with living rm area). At check-in I was told we were to be up-graded to a suite at no extra cost, but there was only 1 king bed, but also a fold out couch in the living room. This was because they were full and had run out of the type of room I had reserved. I took the up-grade and it worked, but I really booked this for the 2 queen beds, and was not too happy about the condition of the fold out couch. Felt bad for my grandson sleeping on the thin excuse for a mattress, and moving furniture and folding out the couch each night was not what I wanted. The hotel also has an extra fee for wifi and use of the water park, which is $40 a day on top of the room cost, and then taxes on top of it all. The wifi, at least in our room was very poor, with the connection fading in and out every few minutes (or seconds). The water park was filled with people and it was a race to just get a chair to sit in, much less two chairs together. The water temp was colder then I would have liked, but it is a fun park for kids. The hotel is pretty, with well keep grounds and the rooms are nice. King bed was soft, bathroom was modern and huge. All the employees were super nice and helpful and they get an A++. The hotel is in an busy part of SE Phoenix, but the property is large which helps make it feel less busy. Restaurants are expensive and 2 of the 3 are quite a distance from the main hotel and rooms. All in all things were OK, but would have been much better to get to type of room I had been promised. I will look elsewhere next time, as the Phoenix area is full of resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spring Training Destination”
Reviews.Author: ChrisYuck
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the resort for our yearly spring training trip. This was the first time we decided to stay at a resort. I have to say, it was the best decision of the whole to trip. When we arrived we were greeted with a warm welcome from Tim at the front desk, he was extremely helpful, made sure we didn't need any additional services and had someone show us to room and assist in unloading the luggage. I knew from that moment, we had made the right decision. The whole resort embodied Tim's warm friendly attitude. Whether we we're floating the lazy river in the Oasis water park or enjoying cocktail looking out over the beautiful golf course. The staff was always extremely helpful and made us feel right at home, we couldn't have expected more!

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, noisy "resort"”
Reviews.Author: GRLTRAV
Reviews.Content: I traveled as part of a business group of 200 during this stay. I had some preconceived expectations based on previous business trips and was surprised that this property was not in the same category. It made me reflect that perhaps this resort was chosen due to the current economic situation. I checked in early (11am) and had no problems with lines or getting a key to my room. The rooms were outdated, but not unclean. However I had issues with general room maintenance. E.g. Toilet handle was broken. A call to front desk resolved that. Shower did not drain. A call to front desk did not resolve it day one but a second call day two did finally fix it. TV's/remotes were old. Couches in suite area were saggy. While the suite had the makings of a good room it was in need of a makeover. Wireless was provided free in the room as part of the business package. Note that the walls/doors are thin. I could hear the family next door perfectly (like they were my own). And, there were many meal events held direcly outside of my bedroom and setup began at 6am or earlier and you could hear them rolling the tables, heat lamps/etc in the morning and tearing down after 11pm at night. The resort didn't offer the type of serenity I was expecting. At 12pm I met colleagues in the lobby and we sat on the patio and had lunch. The service was slow but the food good. We split a Cobb salad and a pizza. The portions were large. From there we went to the spa. I thought they did wonderful job with the gym setup. While the spa waiting room wasn't luxurious, they did serve fresh fruit and tea/water. My massage was fantastic - probably the best I ever had given by an Italian named M. I did not use the water park or the golf course. We did try other restaurants and the service was pretty much the same - slow and uneventful. As far as the conference space, it was not top notch. There were issues with audio quality throughout all the rooms. The worst was the general sessions. There was lots of back noise making it difficult to hear the presenters. Additionally there was not enough space/rooms to accommodate all the breakouts, but that is not the resort's fault. This resort would not be on my list of places to return to, but I could see why families would find it to be a good, economical choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for kids, food quality needs a major make-over!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MLM5150
Reviews.Content: I had read so many bad reviews about this place after booking my stay that I thought oh no where am I taking my family!!!! BUT, this place upon arrival looks great , clean and our room was good. It's our first time staying at a resort and we booked with living social which I believe was worth the money we paid for. The waterpark is awesome my kids loved being there and they have many pools & even a ping pong table. The only downside to this place is their food, it is very expensive and very discusting. We had the BBQ buffet at the oasis and It was all fat, we tried the oasis snack bar and our buffalo chicken wings where black inside like this chicken was beyond dirty!!! Their food is pricey and not good at all. I'd stick to the fast food outside the hotel instead of buying anything there. I don't think I'd return only because id like to explore other resorts , overall the kids had a blast and didn't complain about anything :)

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected (the good and the bad)”
Reviews.Author: Sara B
Reviews.Content: I struggled about what to rate this property since it was exactly what I expected. The Resort: the property is lovely and well laid out. It's right next to the highway, but (at least where we were staying), you would never know it. It's in Tempe, but we found easy 20-minute access to everywhere we wanted to go (restaurants, baseball, etc.). The Rooms: we had a Deluxe Suite in the Camelback building. The room was fine. As reported by others, the TVs are old, but ours worked fine. It was clean. The pullout couch bed was incredibly uncomfortable. The regular beds were comfortable. We removed the mini-bar items and used the refrigerator to keep drinks, etc. that we bought cold. Our coffee supplies were never refilled after used the first time. There were never enough towels or bath amenities, but we just took towels from the pool area and found a housekeeping cart to get more shampoo, etc. We did want an extra blanket one night and were told they were out of blankets. Housekeeping came one day after 5, one day at 9 am and late afternoon the other days. That's unacceptably erratic in my mind, but didn't cause us any problems. The Waterpark - We used the waterpark almost everyday, although we only went for chairs there once. As reported, a line forms about an hour before the park opens for people to get chairs. We lined up the first day about 30 minutes prior to opening and were able to get chairs. After the first day though we decided we preferred it at the pool at our building (which is near the waterpark). So we would get chairs there and run over to the waterpark when we wanted to slide or ride the river or grab some food. The waterpark was crowded (of course), but nothing unexpected. I was always able to get a tube when I wanted one and the wait staff is nice. The food: we only grabbed muffins and coffee in the morning at the marketplace and lunch at the waterpark (we got dinner elsewhere based on prior reviews here). The coffee is Starbuck's. The marketplace cafe does not seem to have a good system, but the coffee and muffins were fine. The lunches in the waterpark were good, but expensive. About what you would expect for resort pricing (lunch for five, including one alcholic drink and 4 Icees) was around $75. I don't find it obscene, but it's not cheap. For those of you from states not graced with In-N-Out Burgers, there is one on Ray Rd. a couple of exits down. The staff: all around we found the staff pleasant and helpful. I went in with reasonable expectations. The rooms are basic motel quality, with nice grounds, pools and the waterpark. We wanted to relax, lay in the sun and were able to do just that. We knew about the resort fee going in and factored it into our pricing so there were no surprises there.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a little tweeking”
Reviews.Author: 4okay
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort especially if you have young children who love water parks. The water park is fabulous!! On our visit, however, we didn't get to enjoy it because it rained and the temperature was in the 50's--very cold for Arizona. The hotel should give a small compensation to guests when the temperature is in the 50's, and when it rains. Maybe give you back a portion of the cost of lodging, or at a minimum the $40 resort fee that they charge you. It was really a shame. We wouldn't have stayed here if we knew it was going to rain and be cold. I peeked in over the fence, and noticed a concession stand and saw hot dogs and french fries going for $7 each. they don't allow outside food in the water park. We had a suite. It consisted of 2 rooms, one with 2 queens, and a sitting area, both with tvs. (Be aware that you got tax charged twice--once for getting a suite, which we weren't told about and only found out when we got our bill emailed to us. In an effort to be green, they don't give you a hard copy of your bill.) the room had a broken knob, hair on the bathroom floor that wasn't vacumed, and a dirty coffee cup that wasn't replaced. The breakfast offered was not gourmet. When staying at a resort, I like stuffed french toast, and other offerings, but nothing gourmet was offered. The waitress who took my order only offered me green or black tea, and never showed up with it until I was half way done with my meal, and after I had flagged down another worker who showed me a variety of teas, and immediately got me a cup. The exercise facility was huge, but the individual ellipticals and bikes did not have their own tv. There were three huge tv's that you could watch--old fashion style. There was no where to plug in your head phones. You had to bring your own portable ipod or radio or something. The resort sent me a list of activities so I could plan my visit prior to arrival. I showed up for a 6am Total Body workout only to find out that they didn't offer that class anymore. Why was it on the schedule sent to me? The person at the front desk of the exercise facility treated me as if I were imagining having received something about a class. Finally another worker told us both that a class used to exist at that time, but not in a long, long time. No one apologized to me. A nice little extra that they offer is free rides over to the outlet mall that is close by. It's nice for people who don't have cars. (We had a car.) Please understand, I'm not a complainer. I liked the place, it was very pretty, but the price was steep compared to other places I have stayed. You really get charged for the waterpark whether you use it or not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quick Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: We checked in and the personnel at the front desk were very quick and friendly! We had someone shuttle us to our room and completely explain the amenities and directions for everything. When we went to check out they again were quick and professional and pulled our car up front so we could load our luggage. Great trip and the hotel was looking great and the pool area was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Bombs away”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: Service excellent, very friendly. Food prices ok for buffet 17$ and 9 for kids for breakfast. Slides are great although the two high ones can be very painful as the water sprays hurt your behind! Pool and lazy river were fun. Golf practice area ok for short game. Driving range has cracked whiffle balls - poor, and course is ok. Beware the resort fee which adds 40$ per room and is charged to all. Good for kids 5-10 especially. Well staffed plenty of life guards. Gym excellent. No tennis courts. Overall great.

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend ever”
Reviews.Author: Sameigen
Reviews.Content: Great stay during Spring Trainings final weekend, so it must be one of the busiest. Awesome service - Tim at the front desk is a great guy. He totally set us up after a long travel day. Perfect location to go almost anywhere in the valley - cant say enough about this place. Big fan

Reviews.Title: “I paid HOW MUCH for this place?!?”
Reviews.Author: Llhorn
Reviews.Content: The entire place felt old and tired. The room towels were shabby, the carpet was dirty and they did not have the regular nice amenities you would expect at a resort. Our room was only restocked at our request. Watch that you don't get a room near the ping pong table. Ca-ping ca-ping ca-ping from 8 am to 10 pm. The water park was FILTHY. The lounge chairs were disgusting. Just about everyone had towels draping every part of them - and they came at a price! You had to wait in line to get in to secure a chair and a place to sit. Not the relaxing scene I had imagined. Very disappointing that you can not bring in your own food and drink when their's is way too expensive for a family. The birds seem to have the run of the restaurant mainly because it took so long to clear tables. The food (while delicious breakfast food) took forever to arrive as did the check (4 days in a row). The centerpieces looked as if they had spent an eternity there. I saw one tucked away in a potted plant nearby. Guess the diners didn't want that dirty thing on their table either..

Reviews.Title: “Fun trip, worth the price? Not sure.”
Reviews.Author: 2SportsMom
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 elementary-aged kids) just returned from a 5-day Spring Break vacation at the Arizona Grand. The water park was the primary reason we chose the resort. Overall, we very much enjoyed the trip, but I'm not sure that we'd stay here again the next time we are in Phoenix. The Good: It was nice to have a little extra room with a suite. My kids enjoyed the small pool and hot tub near our room. The food options were acceptable & convenient. Grounds were well maintained and pretty. Housekeeping was very helpful in bringing us a lot of extra towels one day when my son had the flu. Our room seemed clean and fairly well maintained. Plenty of pool towels available. The Not so Good: The rooms were dated. The TVs were not only old, but the reception was terrible. We watched part of a basketball one evening and couldn't see the score from the beds. The water park was nice, but small and very crowded. The lazy river often became wall to wall intertubes. My kids thought the wave pool was lame compared to Disney and Great Wolf Lodge. My youngest son was upset because he was an inch too short for the waterslides. Also, the park didn't open until 10AM, so my early-riser kids spent more time at the small pool area near our room since we were attending baseball games most afternoons. The food and drink is very expensive and there is no refrigerator or microwave in the room to bring your own. There is only one espresso machine in the coffee shop, so lines for coffee in the morning were crazy long. I think it is deceptive to not include large mandatory resort fee in the room rate. The amount wasn't the problem as much as the principle of it. Lastly, most of the staff were cordial, but not friendly. I would expect a short hello when walking by, but was largely ignored. Staff in the restaurants & coffee shop seemed overwhelmed and put out.

Reviews.Title: “The nickel and dime and allergies be damned resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sayler74
Reviews.Content: So, we are in the middle of a stay at the Arizona Grand and I feel compelled to draft this review now rather than waiting until get home. We arrived on 3/29 and knowing check-in was at 4, we contacted the front des and asked what accommodations could be made. The accommodation worked okay, not great, but fine. We were sent to one end of the resort to change, we then had to move our car t another area to access the water park. Again okay. Check-in is to be no later than 4 but alas it was 5:15 and still no room. Nothing they could do was what we were told, they were full. I called the reservation line from the lobby and was told they were not full. I went back to the desk and said they were not full, i wanted a room. None was provided. Kid in melt down mode, no room and no idea of when a room would be available. The concession offered was $50 in gift card to the Oasis bar. Interesting. Once you figure mark-up, the value provided was probably $15-20. Pathetic. We finally got a room around 5:30 the staff gave us terrible directions and we didn't find the room until nearly 6. It amazes me how hospitality mises the mark on the sole purpose. What would they do if their attorney or doctor showed up 2 hours late to a hearing or surgery? Would all be okay? The second, and bigger, issue we had related to allergies. This place is NOT going to work with you. My wife and daughter have Celiacs (gluten allergy). Nothing on the pool menu was something they could eat yet our snacks were confiscated when we came in. We had to then leave the pool area to eat which would not be a big deal if there were sufficient chairs. So we leave, lose our seats and by the time we return, there is no place to sit. We end up back in our room not being able to enjoy what we have paid for because of discrimination based on America condition. Thought we would bake it better for my daughter by getting her a nice bowl of ice cream for dessert. Nope. Only have sundaes and they wil not serve only ice cream. They could however charge $9 plus a $3 delivery charge plus a 23% gratuity for a scope of vanilla. I was told Paul Gray, the GM (his form responses to complaints are readily accessible) set the policy on allergies and the resort's decision on not accommodating same. Seems to be a problem that I will be happy to research once I get back home. Finally (well at least 1.5 days into a 5 days stay), I would warn families about what appears to be an reasonably priced resort. The actual cost is fine, the way you arrive there via the nickel and dime route is not. I would have rather paid more up front for another resort and been more confident in the product offered and the accomodations extended. A great example was breakfast. We ordered breakfast to our room. 2 omelette, 2 eggs scrambled, side of bacon and fruit was $74. I would invite Mr. Gray to directly address the specific issues raised in this review rather than offering one of his canned responses.

Reviews.Title: “This Time Was Even Better Than The Last!”
Reviews.Author: mom2maddie
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS RESORT! I've stayed here for biz many times, about 15 years ago. In 2007, we came as a family and had THE BEST vacation! But, last week, we returned and the resort is completely renovated! Our suite was SWEET! VERY spacious! Every suite is in a great location! The pools are easily accessible from each building. And, speaking of pools, they are SO CLEAN (& I'm very picky:)! We had a riot on the slides! Families join each other for fun games of water volleyball! And, the "Dive-In" movies at night are so much fun! My 15 year old daughter and I were just exploring the resort after dinner and ended up at the pool for the evening. Great bonding time! Moving on to the golf course, our daughter and my husband LOVED playing it! Reasonably priced and beautifully maintained (our daughter beat her dad:) I'm a fitness fanatic. I was VERY impressed with the health club! Equipment, classes, spa...it's all there! Again, our daughter and my husband LOVED playing basketball on the indoor court! You can rent bikes and bike South Mountain or you can just lace up your shoes and hike it. We did (right from the hotel) and the view was magnificent! But, lots of resorts have beautiful suites and great amenities. What sets the Arizona Grand apart from the others for me (and I've traveled extensively) are the people. The staff is welcoming, accommodating, friendly, funny, problem solvers and make you feel right at home! From the front desk (Tim, Ryan, Royce, Ginger and so many others) to the bell men, to housekeeping to the concierge, EVERYONE was there to assure our vacation was everything we wanted it to be...wait...they made it MORE than we ever expected:)! It was our 18 wedding anniversary and our daughter's 16th birthday (almost:). THANK YOU ARIZONA GRAND! We're already planning our return for late March 2013, with our nephew, his wife and their 3 children:)! Any villas available:)!?

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as we hoped”
Reviews.Author: Chgotraveler4
Reviews.Content: To be fair, we (my husband, two girls (7 & 3) and inlaws) booked this trip in early February. We decided that wanted to get away a little late in the game. Last year we did an all inclusive in Cancun and it was perfect for what we needed in a vacation. I began searching Cabo & Cancun and I just couldn't get good flight times at a reasonable rate, as well as Florida. We just about pitched the idea of Spring break when I received and email from a family vacation website listing their top 10 family resorts. Arizona Grand made the list. I was intrigued by the one bedroom suites and the water park. I checked Southwest vacations and the Grand was available with great flight times, I knew these flights weren't going to last so I checked a couple of reviews and booked it. Had it been December and I had more time to do my homework, I probably would have ended up at the Hyatt Scottsdale (they were not available during our dates, March 20-27) or more likely, Mexico. Upon arrival to the Grand (which is only about 10 minutes from the airport), the drive looks lovely. You approach a huge fountain that is in the middle of round-about and proceed down a orange tree lined street, in full bloom. The lobby is nice enough, as well as the outdoor lobby area with fire pits and seating to overlook the golf course. I was hopeful. The bellman escorted us to our room, showed us were to park. Parking is sparse. We were in the Camelback section and our room was an "upgrade" bc my husband signed up for the preferred guest program to get free wifi. We were told the rooms were newly renovated and that we were close to the water park for easy access. The rooms are small. We like suites bc the kids sleep in the pull out sofa and we can sleep in a king bed. At first I thought the size of the room was going to be a problem but it ended up working out. The decor was fine, nothing special and the TVs old. My main concern were the halls - they were so dark and old feeling. I didn't like the feeling. Since we had two suites, we compared notes with my inlaws and there were a lot of inconsistency. That drove me crazy - especially since they are charging a $40 resort fee per day. You had to request robes (I think at a 4 star resort that should be standard practice). I also found housekeeping service to be terrible. Amenities & towels weren't getting replenished - and when I call they never answered. I always got bounced back to the operator. It was annoying. Again not to harp, but get your largest department together, especially when charging such a hefty resort fee. It was a long a day and the girls we were fried, so we sucked it up and ordered room service pizza. Not good but we expected that. The food in general, was bad except for the club sandwich I had a the lobby restaurant. The food at pool park was not edible. Rustlers Roost on the top of the hill is a tourist trap but does have good views. I have to say my kids enjoyed themselves but I found it chaotic. They have a real bull, live music, balloon guy, slide for the kids and "free" cotton candy for the kids. I guess its hard not to try it, but the food was not good. Aunt Chilada's is horrible - stay away. Both myself and my father inlaw got sick that night and we think it was from there. The pool park occupied my 7 year old.
