Reviews.Content: I traveled to Phoenix on business a brought the family. We really enjoyed the water park. The rooms were nice and clean and reasonably priced. We didn't have a chance to use the athletic club on this visit, but I have been up there before and it was excellent. If you have the kiddos with you, request a room near the water park. Also, there are lots of good rates available in the summer since it is hot and off season in Phoenix. Food and drink is typically expensive in the water park and you can't bring your own.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing "grand" or "resort-y" about it!”
Reviews.Author: truthbetold_10
Reviews.Content: This place is tired! the rooms were like Embassy Suites - exactly - which is fine if you want to stay at Embassy Suites! I fail to see the "resort" in this place. Carpet is worn, tub is teeny-tiny and the view of the parking lot was uninspiring. And come on, it's 2011 - no flat screen TV? Instead there was this 22" portable dinosaur that I could hardly make out from my bed! The pool area looked really nice - the fountain was a nice touch - but i was only there one night on business and could not enjoy. The staff were friendly and tried to be helpful. After a long day, I was hoping to have a glass of wine in some outside Arizona venue, but the bar I was in could have been in Cleveland (no disrespect)! Oh yeah - and paying $15 for Wi-Fi is out of bounds! I think they may be spending too much time and energy on selling the time share villas. Maybe that's the "grand" part...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: Joe J
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days with our 2 young children and we loved every second. The rooms were great and the water park was also great. You get what you pay for in this place. We only ate breakfast on site and it was a little pricey but that is what you expect. We were not here to save money, we were here to have fun. The lazy river and water park was great but please know that your children MUST be 48 inches tall to ride the slides. Our little girl was very disappointred that she could not ride. My only gripe would be this, the TV's are from 1985. For such a pricey hotel I would hope to have an HDMI hook up for my computer but this and only this was my only gripe. This is a must stay place in Arizona due to the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for the value.”
Reviews.Author: stevemech
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely showing its age. For the price you can get much more for the dollar staying elsewhere. No wi-fi included, business center closes at 5pm, no breakfast or happy hour included. Our room was not very clean, dirty carpet, smudged up windows, dirty bathroom floor. Wife kept her socks on the whole time. The gym was very large but free weight equipment aging. If you have to have a large sprawling resort to walk around the grounds are nice but you can get better value staying other places.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star service”
Reviews.Author: KamaainaFromKona
Reviews.Content: This resort is an amazing deal! Beautiful suites with incredibly low prices! Up there with the best of the best. I was extremely impressed with the level of service this hotel offers. From the front desk, to the drivers, to the restaurant servers, to the gift shop/deli. Sherry, in the deli, even went to the kitchen at 7:30 a.m. to get gelato for my daughter who had a fever & sore throat! (Gelato doesn't come out until around 11:00) I was very high maintenance on this trip for some reason, but it did not seem to phase any of the staff. Tip: there is a mall less than a mile away and the resort has a shuttle (on a schedule) to take you there and pick you up! Only drawback was there is no resort airport service, so it costs about $25 for a taxi each way. But, it is totally worth it! One more thing. I completely disagree with other reviews on the restaurant. I had the best fish tacos I've had in years and the bruschetta trio was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Older but well-maintained resort, spacious suites, ample conference facilities, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: TomSwain
Reviews.Content: Traveled to this resort for a business conference of roughly 120. We will come again. All food and all services were excellent. The rooms are suites - well-maintained, spacious, with work tables and couches for reading and work offsite. There is a great Mexican restaurant on the property called Aunt Chiladas. Do not miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: Deb-Sky92011
Reviews.Content: So conveniently located. Everything you could want is on-site or very close. I have been here twice in the last 6 months. Once with my SO for rest and relaxation. We played golf, ate at all three restaurants on-site, enjoyed the pool and were never bothered by the kids at the waterpark. Most recent trip was with my 16 year old son and we too played golf and enjoyed the pool. Rates are excellent for a full-service resort. Rooms are nicely updated and spacious. Customer service throughout the resort is outstanding. I will stay here everytime I visit this area.

Reviews.Title: “ARIZONA GRAND RESORT FAMILY VACATION”
Reviews.Author: katrina_dituri
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the AGR in June. The Resort is an oasis in the dessert. The surrounding area is less than desireable. The resort it self is amazing. The rooms are spacious. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. We were with our two both (12 and 11). They slept on the pull out couch. The water park is great. Kept the boys busy. The other smaller resort pools are great as well. The only complaint is the prices of the food in the park. There are no discount offered to Resort Visitors. We ordered 4 hotdogs with 4 soda drinks and it around $40. Also, the park is open to the public. This wasn't a prob. We never had an over crowded day. My husband ended up going to the grocery store buying lunches, snacks and drinks. There is a frig in the room (small) that we kept the sodas cool. Out of 5 star I give this Resort a 4!

Reviews.Title: “A typical upscale resort. Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: AragornTheStrider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during early summer for 5 nights. This is a beautiful resort. The grounds are very well kept. Rooms are clean and spacious. Loved the typical desert architecture of the hotel rooms. There are some water rides as well which unfortunately we could not check out. There is a fabulous Mexican restaurant on the property grounds that is a must visit for real Mexican taste. Over all great place

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get Away”
Reviews.Author: 266schultz
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all without leaving... We got a Villa which had a Full kitchen,living room and 2 bedrooms. Great for families. Ate breakfast in the AM had sandwiches at lunch and out to dinner in the PM or order a pizza for delivery.. Water slides and lazy river were great. All very kid/teenager friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool area but avoid the pancakes!”
Reviews.Author: jdkd319
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with family and friends. Great deal for a suite although we were in a room/building adjacent to the freeway (noise was not bad) and walk to the pool area was long (it was 112 degrees outside). The pool area is the reason people stay here in the summer: 2 super tall water slides, lazy river, wave pool. Get there early in the day for prime lounging chairs (preferably in the shade) as later in the day it is packed and hard to find even chairs in the sun! Only negative: ordered room service and the pancakes could have been used as land mines or frisbee's, they were that rock hard!

Reviews.Title: “Water Park with a great hotel room and poolside service”
Reviews.Author: Chodo
Reviews.Content: Staycation! We live here in HOT Phoenix and escaped for 24 hours with 2 other families to enjoy the water park. It was crowded but not overwhelming for us. The water park consists of a lazy river, wave pool and 3 big slides and has a large seating area, some of which is well shaded. The food served poolside is quite good and not total bust the bank prices. We stayed in a villa room with Queen bed and pull out sofa. Small but very nice and fantastic location by the entrance to the water park.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMomma
Reviews.Content: The hotels service was great from the valet parking to the shuttling golf carts. I didn't have to walk anywhere. The suites had plenty of room to accommodate our family of 5. We had a balcony that over looked the golf course which was beautiful. Our front doors looked over a gorgeous courtyard with fountains, a pool and jacuzzi. They have several so they aren't crowded. Our suite included a trip to the spa, which had wonderful service and a variety of options. The package also included tickets for everyone for the water park. The kids loved the water slides and lazy river. We didn't try the golf course, but it looked beautiful. They have several restaurants on the grounds you can choose from. We ate at the lobby grill, which over looks the golf course. Since the walls are all windows we could enjoy the view without being in the heat. Although there is a patio option. The food is delicious! The value is HIGH if you use a living social deal. It is the difference between $500s in the peak season, to high $100s.

Reviews.Title: “In NO hurry to go back!”
Reviews.Author: 411Beach_Bum
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to try a “staycation” over Labor Day weekend. We have 3 children, 2 of which are under 3. We thought the water park would be great Entertainment. We arrived at 4pm to check-in to find that the hotel was behind and it would be at least an hour before our room was ready. They sent us to the Water park and told us to try back later. We drove to the water park to find there are no changing rooms at the park so we drug our kids back up the hill with all Our bags to change at the fitness center. Beautiful building but not family friendly. Had to explain to my 3 year old why we were changing with other naked women Walking around and trying to keep my one year old out of lockers! So we store all our belongings in several small lockers and head back down the hill to the water Park. An hour goes by and our room still isn’t ready. At 6:00pm my children are getting hungry. We had a $50 resort credit and wanted to use it towards the dinner Buffet being served poolside. However we are informed that’s not possible because we still are not checked into the hotel and our room STILL isn’t ready at 6:00pm An night. The girls working at the pool were very kind and spoke to someone who said to go ahead and go through the buffet and they would make sure the charges Were applied to our room folio. Buffet was great for adults however, not very kid friendly. Hard as a rock chicken tenders and tatter tots were the only option for Children. No drink options other than soda. 7pm we have the pool attendees call again and our room is finally ready. I had to leave my husband and kids at the pool and Go to the other side of the property to check-in, but first go to the fitness center to get my credit card and ID out of the fitness center. After checking in and getting keys the Valet gives instructions to get to our room. It’s now dark and there are no numbers on the buildings. The directions he gave were completely wrong. He told us we were on The first floor but we were on the second. The building had elevators that didn’t go to the first floor and room numbers that do go in order!! It’s crazy. Pay the valet to take you To your room! It’s worth it. Get to the room and the tub is wet and has many black hairs on the side and bottom of it. Coffee cups are dirty and stained with lipstick. How can this room not be completely clean after waiting so long? At this point I’m ready to go home and ask for a refund. Next day was much better. Restaurant breakfast was a little pricy but very good and the pool activities kept the kids entertained. Upon check-out there are additional charges to my bill. Front desk attendee tells me he had no access to the charges, doesn’t even know what they are for and that I have to call the accounting department the next business day. 3 days later, the accounting department still can’t figure it out but hasn’t credited my credit card either. All in all, the hotel is beautiful and perfect for adults. I’ve traveled a lot with my kids but have never had such a challenging trip. I’m in no hurry to go back to the Arizona Grand and wouldn’t recommend it to anyone on a holiday weekend or anyone with smaller children.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time . . . no major complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: rocsmom0304
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the AZ Grand Resort over Labor Day - probably the busiest weekend all summer according to a couple water park employees, but we didn't expect to be there alone . . . and overall, well worth the stay - my daughters (8 and 7), hubby and I had a wonderful time! We stayed on the 5th floor in the Sedona Bldg. Yes, it is true, the property is older . . . there seems to be several areas/rooms, etc. that aren't being used as intended, but that didn't bother us much. The hallways and exterior is where most of the wear n tear shows, but again, not a biggy. The rooms were nicely kept, painted, and CLEAN (which matters most to me) and I do think our tub was also newer and slightly oversized. The TV on the other hand, was an old 19" TV from the 90's and THAT could indeed use an update! We weren't there to watch TV, but it would've been nice to have a bigger, clearer television to watch as we laid in bed at the end of the day. The property seems to have a lot of smaller pools throughout the property where its easy to escape the crowds and wind down at the end of the day -- or in the AM before Oasis opens. We liked that. The fitness center was great -- nice and spacious! The spa was amazing -- had a wonderful 50 minute massage by Francine!! The tea and fresh fruit was a nice, added extra as well! The water park was a ton of fun -- yes, crowded, but it was Labor Day Weekend. There were lines for the lazy river, but we did find tubes in the wave pool that we brought over with us and skipped the lines doing so. You must be holding on or in a tube (at least on 2 of 3 days we were there) which did reduce some of the bobbing heads in the river which was nice (and a tad safer)! There was also a line for the slides, but it moved fairly well, maybe a 15 minute wait for the tallest slide. Service was excellent both at the bar (where we ordered our lunch (food) and skipped the snack shack line) and poolside, despite the crowds and the HEAT! There was a lot of water coolers on in the park with COLD water which I thought was a nice added touch. The bartenders were very generous with large cups of ice that we used at the water coolers as well. My girls LOVED the kids activities throughout the day, maybe more than the water park itself! They participated in balloon tosses, whipped cream games, lots of arts n crafts, guessing contests, etc. They loved floating in a tube and watching the movie on Sunday night as well. And the AZ Grand Dancers were great too! We didn't do the buffets at the water park -- but the breakfast buffet was pretty good. Great fresh fruit and a made-to-order omelet bar which we all enjoyed!! Fruit loops and bacon kept my 7-year old beyond happy . . . afterall it is vacation! :) A great time overall, at a great rate too! We will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “So bad, I had to write my first ever review”
Reviews.Author: Ben S
Reviews.Content: To be frank, this was one of the worst "deals" we've ever had vacationing. For a resort that lauds itself on being one of America's finest, there were many issues that made this trip a disappointment for our family. Here's the list: no free wi-fi, water park overcrowded and the water is a tinge more yellow by 4:00 p.m. than earlier in the day, our room was not ready for check-in until well after 5:00 p.m. (check-in is at 4:00 p.m.), the rooms are spacious but aging poorly, no flat screen TVs, there was a large puddle of water in the middle of our room upon check-in, you can't take any food into the water park (not even kid's food that they don't sell anyway), the staff was rather rude, esp. at the water park, the mini-bar was luke warm, the interior pools were out of towels by noon, parking was insane, and the mattress on the pullout sofa bed was old and actually hurt to lay on. One more comment about the staff: for a high-end resort, it was apparent to me that the staff was more interested in their own needs than their guests. For example, as I was escorting my 4 year old to the bathroom at the water park, a staff member squeezed between the door and the wall to get past rather than wait patiently for the door to close. We certainly did not feel like welcome guests. I guess that is the downside of paying minimum wage to teenagers who don't really care anyway. All in all, we'll never go back and never recommend it. To the manager: take a clue from Nordstrom's. Nordstom's is excessively expensive but people keep going back to shop there. Why? The customer service is legendary. Hire yourself some customer service trainers and create your own legend. Us customers will see past a slightly yellow pool if we feel like we own the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired, dirty, and over-crowded.”
Reviews.Author: 2vacation35
Reviews.Content: Nasty. Was probably very nice 20 years ago. Rooms need major over haul. Pool Oasis was cool, but it was over populated by 200+ people. Felt like we were ona dirty, low budget cruise or summer camp. So many nicer places to stay, like Camelback Inn, Intercontinental, Marriott Desert Ridge, hyatt Gainey ranch, etc. Will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Oasis Water Park & Arts/Crafts for the kids!”
Reviews.Author: cristyn l
Reviews.Content: Water park doesn't open till 9:30am so arrive a little early to get a good seat in the shade during a Holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun!”
Reviews.Author: AZLaurie
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here on two different weekends with a livingsocial deal. The water-park is great, but be advised that you have to be 48" to ride the slides, and they are strict on that! The wave pool and lazy river and lots of fun. Get in early to get a chair; they go fast, especially if you want some shade. You can't take any food or drink into Oasis water-park, and they do check your bags. Though the beds are wicked comfy, but the pillows are small and very squishy (glad we brought our own!) Also, we were glad we brought DVD players since the rooms don't have them (at least not the resort rooms don't). Also, don't plan for a popcorn snack because there are no microwaves, either, which I think have become pretty standard in most places... We ate the buffet breakfast, and it was pretty good each time; not great. The omelet station had lots of choices, and were very good. Overall, we would recommend and visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Arizona Grand Resort"”
Reviews.Author: MassMom94
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on both the first and last nights of vacation (flew in and out of Phoenix, visited Sedona and Grand Canyon for the rest of our trip). For our first night, we arrived late on Saturday afternoon and the water park was very crowded, but that was to be expected. For the second night, we arrived late on Friday afternoon and it was much less crowded. I think there were a lot of local families there for a weekend staycation, many who probably booked the Living Social deal. (Wish I had known about that!) The grounds were beautiful and the rooms were fine, but as others have mentioned I don't understand why they didn't upgrade the TVs when they renovated. We were in the Mountainside section the first night,, which is not as convenient to the water park but is across from the golf course. Each section has its own pool (I think there are seven total on site, in addition to the water park) and we had it to ourselves to enjoy on Sunday morning. We were upgraded (no charge) to the Sedona section for our second night, which was a more convenient location, but the room was exactly the same. Check -in is at 4:00 PM, but we saw someone checking in early and they were told they could use the water park before their room was ready. Check-out is at 12 PM (noon), and the water park opened at 9:30 AM during our stay, so we got in a nice amount of time there before we had to leave. Your one-night stay is good for water park admission on both your arrival and departure days. Make sure you read the fine print about taxes and the mandatory $30 resort fee so there are no surprises when you get the final bill. Also, internet access is not included in the resort fee and runs another $14.95/day. Self-parking can be a challenge but we managed ok. 13 yo son loved the water park and college-age daughter loved the outlet mall (Arizona Mills) that was right down the street. Convenient to the airport, too. We'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Jenn R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with the voucher we got with a Living Social deal, and our stay exceeded my expectations. We had a deluxe suite in the Sedona building which was really nice and roomy for the four of us. Room was clean, bright and cheerful. We were right next to the waterpark. The staff was really nice and friendly, every time I saw someone who worked for the resort walking around or on the golf carts they always said hello to us. The waterpark was so much fun. My 11 year old had a blast on the slides and the lazy river. The food was good and the prices to us were reasonable considering it's a resort. I am looking forward to going back next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Fun waterpark, nice breakfasts, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celestialtravels
Reviews.Content: We spent nearly all our time at the waterpark (three nights). We loved it! My daughter was endlessly entertained. Two of the waterslides are extremely steep, scary and thrilling, but safe, though you do get your swimsuit wedged up. The resort is made up of hotel blocks throughout the property. We had an upgraded room with tiny (but cute) balcony that faced south toward the waterpark, which was nice. In our building we were on the second to top floor, but the floor numbering is off by one, so you are really one lower than you think you will be - originally we were put on the second floor, but it was really the 1st floor (at least on this half), so we moved rooms as we prefer to be higher up. Each building has additional standard pools and hot tubs in the courtyard, much like pools at traditional hotels, which stay open later than the water park. Our room was comfortable, with a good bed and it was nice to have a separate room (living room) for our daughter. We had vouchers for breakfast every morning in the main restaurant- service was very good, food was much better than average and the ambiance was wonderful. I really enjoyed the dining! The grounds are expansive and they do a good job of maintaining them, even in the scorching hot weather. The dust storm had passed through the day we arrived so it was still a little dusty, as to be expected. I didn't try the fitness center, but I peaked in and it looked nice. There is another all-adult lap pool adjacent to the fitness center. This is a great place and lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch accommodations and service”
Reviews.Author: bottlebass57
Reviews.Content: I went there for a conference, and the resort did an excellent job of meeting all of our needs during the conference. As planned, my wife flew out after the conference, and we stayed for three more nights. The accommodations were excellent and the service was top notch. We spent one day at the on-site water park which was still open on weekends and had a blast. They have water slides, a wave pool, and a tube river. The staff was always on the spot when you needed a drink or something to eat. I would definitely recommend the Grand Resort as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy clean rooms, beautiful grounds, FUN waterpark”
Reviews.Author: AngelaNM
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, the loby, and the water park. We stayed in a standard room. Two adults, two children (ages 7 & 8), and one baby. Plenty of room. Decor was nice. Looks just like the pictures. Wish I had taken my own but the hotel photos do it justice. Food is expensive. We ate all of our meals out of the Resort. Wendys for dinner because the kids were too exhausted to eat at a real restaurant. My husband went to the grocery store down the street in the a.m. and got us some goodies for breakfast. We didn't mind the walk to the water park. It was pleasant. There is also a golf cart that you can call to pick you up. We all stayed nice and cool in the 110 degree weather. There were lots of trees and the water was refreshing. The baby took his naps on the lazy river. We were there with relatives. Two of the kids were not swimmers. They played at the kiddy pool and the lazy river. Two were great swimmers so they went on the water slides and wave pool. One was intermediate and did it all. Fantastic time. Will go again. Got the summer rate of $139 which really means $191. Totally worth it for our family. You can stay at the water park after you check out. Cozy clean rooms, beautiful grounds, and FUN waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great escape and we loved the water park”
Reviews.Author: photogurrl
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at this resort. The suite was clean, roomy, and perfect for a family. The beds and linens were comfy. The food on site was excellent. My kids and I loved the wave pool, the lazy river, and the slides. Most of the employees were super friendly and helpful. I did encounter one person who left me with the feeling that she really shouldn't be working in customer service, as she was quite snappy. But then again, I encountered a wonderful person who was extremely helpful when one of the kids got stung by a bee in the pool. And I would say 99% of the staff was wonderful. It's too bad that one bad apple can leave a sour taste. The steakhouse at this resort was super fun. They have a slide that the kids can ride down to the table, and a real steer outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great water park... not so great sleep”
Reviews.Author: myniyer
Reviews.Content: Water park: Our family lives in Phoenix and I'd heard a lot about the water park from friends here. They weren't wrong; between the wave pool, lazy river and 3 water slides, everyone had lots to do. I do wish they'd had misters going as I couldn't sit on a pool chair in the shade for more than about 15 minutes even in a wet swimsuit without getting uncomfortable (and I'm used to the heat, I live here). Also be advised the water is highly chlorinated - so much so that my 5-year-old complained of blurry vision after an hour in the wave pool! Room: Older but comfortable, with the exception of the flat and lumpy pillows. Honestly, a half-filled bag of cotton candy would have provided more sleeping comfort. My partner and I tossed and turned most of the night trying to get comfortable, and our older daughter kept waking up as well. Restaurant: We tried to get in for breakfast and were told there was an hour wait! We chose to eat off property and come back. The front desk was accommodating and assured me I could use our meal credit later in the day. Food at the Lobby Grill was tasty and arrived in timely fashion. As with most restaurants, the kids menu could use some work; my daughters, dissatisfied with the selections, ordered off the adult menu and were happy with what they received. Dinner prices were reasonable for a resort restaurant (much more so than breakfast, actually). The one glaring down side was that the restaurant was full of flies. We were initially seated at a table near the view doors but, after being dive-bombed by at least 25 flies, requested to move. Our server apologized; he said they have not found a way to control the flies that come in off the golf course in the morning when they open the doors at breakfast. Fees: I booked this hotel using a LivingSocial deal ($99 a night including resort fees and a breakfast credit to the Lobby Grill). I have been told the hotel has a $30 resort fee plus an additional charge for the Internet (which we did not use during our stay). All in all we enjoyed our stay and got excellent value for the money. But next time we'll bring our own pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular in every way -- I can't wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Neeraj P
Reviews.Content: I travel on business relatively often to Phoenix, but stayed at the Arizona Grand for the first time last week on a recommendation by a colleague. I'll now be recommending the resort to other travelers -- both business and pleasure. The Villa Suites were fantastic -- large, roomy, soft beds, and equipped for business and/or pleasure. The staff was courteous, friendly, and very helpful, and the maids in particular did a great job of cleaning my room. The on-site restaurants offered great food and a terrific atmosphere for fun (my colleagues and I really enjoyed our visit to Rustler's Rooste). For fitness, the resort featured a top-flight gym with all the amenities, as well as a gorgeous lap pool. The water slide and lazy river were a refreshing way to get away during the few spare minutes I had on my last day, and I can only imagine how much fun my family will have when I bring them on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the water park for kids!”
Reviews.Author: loric1969
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this as a place to stay for a concert in Tempe. I wish we'd brought the kids and stayed longer! This is a very nice resort and our one bedroom suite was very comfortable. The water park looked fabulous! And the spa is far enough removed from it to be tranquil. I don't play golf but the course was beautiful and the views from the hotel restaurant were very peaceful. My husband and I had breakfast on the patio overlooking the golf course and the food was excellent and creative. The atmosphere was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Just an okay trip and stay at the grand.....”
Reviews.Author: Jdelcampillo
Reviews.Content: Great grounds but rooms are needing to be updated.... Very old TVs and furniture.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience . . .”
Reviews.Author: Linda V
Reviews.Content: From the moment that you drive onto the property, it is clear that the Arizona Grand Resort is a resort in every sense of the word. The grounds are beautiful, not to mention very well kept. The responsive staff takes care of your bags immediately, as you are directed to very pleasant front desk representatives for check-in. The amenities in my villa were fabulous and immaculate, including a very large bathroom and shower, a walk-in closet, and full kitchen, all of which were done in very good taste. It’s not often that I stay in a hotel in which I find some aspects more enjoyable than those in my own, nice home, but that was certainly the case at this resort villa. My review would be remiss if I did not mention the friendly, accommodating staff in the restaurant adjacent to the hotel lobby. We enjoyed eating breakfast three times in that lovely restaurant, and each time we were very pleased with the food and service. I would also recommend the water park, which is on the resort premises. The impressive water slides in particular are not just popular with kids, but also with adults. I’d recommend the slide on the right (between the two highest slides that are adjacent to each other)! In summary, staying at the Arizona Grand Resort in Phoenix, Arizona was certainly a positive experience, and I am already looking forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place. Cannot wait to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: pastorkyle
Reviews.Content: Our room was located on the fourth floor, but was easily accessible due to multiple elevators nearby. Service from the staff was excellent. The entire grounds were both beautiful and immaculate. My wife is an avid photographer, and was provided with limitless options for photos of the family. Room service was incredibly fast as well as delicious. The Oasis water park was a very nice addition to our stay. The kids did not want to leave...the parents enjoyed it also! My opinion in a word: Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Arizona Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: Az_Family_of_4-1234
Reviews.Content: There were many problems with our stay at the Arizona Grand Resort in August of 2011. We had 3 rooms and were looking forward to a relaxing 3-day stay at what was billed as Phoenix's best family water park. When we arrived, we were greeted and checked in quickly. Then the problems started. We went to the Lobby restaurant for lunch and order things like chicken sandwiches and hamburgers. The service was so poor that a smaller group that came in after us had gotten their food, finished it and left before our food was served. One of our party ordred a well-done hamburger. The one they brought was burned, so they brought a second one, which was so undercooked we had to send it back and finally, we got what was originally ordered. When I contacted the manager about the slow service, I was told that since we ordered chicken sandwiches, our ordered was delayed by 25 minutes. When we finally got out of the restaurant, we went to our rooms, changed for the water park and went there. Unfortunately, the temperature of the water was so warm that it was simply not possible to enjoy any of the water attractions. It was as if we were in a hot tub at each of the 4 different water attractions we tried. We went back to the rooms and found that one of the rooms was missing a remote control for the television. I had to call 3 times to get someone to come (each time I was told that someone would be right over) and finally, after an hour, they brought us a control that simply didn't work at all. Needless to say, we checked out after one night, cancelling our 3 rooms for 2 additional nights. When I told the desk clerk at checkout about why we were leaving early, I got nothing but empty apologies. My family and I will not be returning to the Arizona Grand Resort and I strongly recommend that you don't take your family there either.

Reviews.Title: “The most awesome weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Brandi O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the end of July as a "staycation" and had an awesome time. The resort is beautiful. The rooms are spacious and gorgeous. The pool and Water Oasis were phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: “R and R - rest and recreation”
Reviews.Author: azpsm
Reviews.Content: The most relaxing resort for my friend and family with a yearly tradition to venture back for more fun each season.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith H
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand is truly a first class and exceptional property. From the moment you enter the hotel to when you leave, you are treated with a degree of royalty unlike no other hotel. The grounds, dining facilities are all equally exceptional and cared for with the utmost care and no detail is left behind. The staff is friendly, professional and willing and genuinely interested in ensuring your stay is pleasant. The security is like no other hotel I have encountered; the bottom line is you are safe at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ASeasonedTraveler54
Reviews.Content: I stayed this past weekend and found the “resort” very lacking. For the quality it was overpriced. The resort was poorly run and based on what the employees said, the management doesn’t care or is incompetent. It’s really too bad as all of the employees I interacted with were friendly, polite, and apologetic for the condition of the hotel. I have never heard “I’m sorry” so much in a hotel. First, when getting out of the shower, I noticed a dirty towel handing on the back of the door. There were hairs on the shower curtain. There was no Do Not Disturb sign in my room. My room was not cleaned until after 4:30pm. In a resort you expect relaxation but if you spend the day waiting for your room to be cleaned it’s not relaxing. There is a $30.00 resort fee which basically is for a small water park that was overcrowded. The wave pool had no waves, just wall to wall people floating on rafts. The pool bar had no fans or misters. Come on, it was 109 degrees. I’ve been to resorts in Las Vegas and Hawaii and guess what; they have fans and often misters. There was a $14.95 per day fee for the internet. I felt this was inappropriate due to the $30.00 resort fee. So in addition to an overpriced room rate, the daily fees were an additional $49.95. What a rip-off! At a resort, I would expect multiple restaurants and bars including some upscale dining. They advertise 3 restaurants but two of them are not run by the hotel or within walking distance. We ate at the steak restaurant and were told it is their best restaurant. The restaurant is about 2 steps below an Outback. It was not part of the hotel, as you needed to drive to it and you could not charge to your room. Breakfast in the Grill was lacking. They had a breakfast buffet for $16.00 that would not make it at Bob’s Big Boy. The bacon was burnt, the eggs dried out as well where the croissants. There was one omelet station with a 10 minute wait. The buffet was set-up in the server area of the kitchen. The floor was greasy. I don’t mean to disparage Outback or Bob’s Big Boy as they deliver value, something this resort fails to do. As for the mini-bar; what a joke, it had a very small selection. It had 2 Snickers bars, 2 bags of M&Ms, and 2 small cans of Pringles. For alcohol it had some beer and 2 mini bottles of vodka along with a few sodas and waters. Not much of a choice. Unless your rate is very low, spend your money at a quality hotel. For what I paid, I should have chosen a Westin, Hyatt or Marriott, it would probably been a much better experience and based on the internet, less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A “Grand” Affair”
Reviews.Author: Whitzs
Reviews.Content: Wonderful. Terrific. Relaxing. Words can not express the wonderful experience I had at this resort. A trip to the Arizona Grand was my Mom’s Christmas present last year and it was better than expected (and the expectations were high!) The room was a suite style with one bedroom, a kitchenette and living area with a pull out sofa. It also overlooked the Oasis water park. We spent the majority of our time at the water park floating around the lazy river, watching the kids and adults zoom down the giant water slides and soaking up the Arizona sun. The suite we stayed in allowed 4 wrist bands for daily access to the water park. The hotel had great proximity to the hiking of South Mountain and Piestwa Peak was only a 15 minute drive. Furthermore all of the great Phoenix shopping (Chandler Mall, Biltmore, Fashion Square) were all within a 20 minute drive. If you are a golfer (which I am not) there is a beautiful golf course attached to the resort. This is a beautiful resort with wonderful amenities that nestles up against the scenic Arizona landscape. This is a great destination for families, friends and couples.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: DesertDweller32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arizona Grand through an offer with Living Social. For one price, the resort stay plus resort fees were included, with other discounts on dining and spa. I preface my review with this information because I'm uncertain if the Grand was prepared for the response to this offer. We checked in Saturday and departed Sunday. We arrived early and were able to enjoy the waterpark. The waterslides were lots of fun, especially the Serpentine (twisty) slide. The only challenge is, if you sit up the entire way down, there is a branch to a pine tree about half way that you have to duck, or risk hitting your head (I'm 5'9"). The lazy river was crowded, yet we were able to get a tube without too much of a wait. I qualify this statement with the following: if lifeguards were present, then getting a tube was orderly. If no lifeguard was available, it was a bit chaotic, with the guests jockeying for position, and snatching tubes from other guests. We kept calling in, as advised, to check on the status of our room. The four o'clock check-in time came and went . . . our room wasn't ready 'til 5:15!!!!! That was inconvenient, and a hassle to say the least. The front desk person said the resort was "overbooked". Not my problem, and should not be shared with guests as an "excuse". Once we did get to the room, it was comfortable for our group of four. It was disappointing to see an empty, discarded water bottle on our balcony and hair that wasn't ours on the mini-bar sink. Waiting an extra hour and fifteen minutes, the room should have been spotless!!! Regarding room layout, the bathroom is in the bedroom section of the "suites" which is a tad inconvenient. I used the spa services and was disappointed with one of the spa technicians talking about custody arrangements with another employee. I'm sorry for the situation, but a spa visit should be a relaxing treat for those enjoying the services. We much prefer the scale and setting of the Pointe Squaw Peak in Phoenix to this property. (The Grand is the former Pointe South Mountain.) The rooms are practically identical, but the Pointe Squaw Peak is simply a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “It was...okay”
Reviews.Author: jmw6
Reviews.Content: I took the kids here just for a change of pace. A friend told me that the Oasis Pool was a great place to lounge and let our kids run around. She was right. The pool was nice. Small, but nice. The boys loved the water slides, I liked the lazy river. Plenty of floats, plenty of towels. Pricey food and drinks by the pool though, so be prepared to overspend on lunch and snacks for hungry children. Also, bring cheap flops for the pool. The deck/pavement is way too hot to walk (or run, yelling "hot feet, hot feet") without shoes. You can leave them wherever you jump into the water, but be prepared to have others use them or take them. My friend's son kept finding his flops in different spots all over the pool. A woman sunning near me said that hers had been stolen the previous day. Now, for the hotel part of this review.... Eh...it was okay. The room was clean and it wasn't too outdated. Its the outside of the place that needs some attention. The lobby is beautiful, but beyond the lobby, the place just reminds me of an aging movie star, like you can tell it used to be attractive, but now its just tired and old, and maybe staying in business beyond its prime, and the little cosmetic improvements they've done just don't hide that fact. Our rooms were on sort of an alley, a long walk from the pool. It looked like the stucco on the buildings needed to be power sprayed to get the dirt out or maybe just repainted. The building across from ours had a big gathering of pigeons on a few of the balconies, like maybe the place isn't being used. On the whole, the hotel is okay, not great. The restaurant off the lobby was good. We went there for breakfast. Again, I thought it was pricey for a has-been hotel, but the kids were happy. Now, Aunt Chilada's on the other hand, I'd heard great things about, and was looking forward to trying. Ummm... we thought the kitchen closed at 10PM on a week night, but I learned that they closed up at 9PM. We walked in at 8:57. I know this because the hostess told us that. Before "hello". Before "Welcome to Aunt Chilada's". The first thing she said was "The kitchen closes at 9. Its 8:57." We asked if we should go elsewhere. She had to ask the kitchen if we could be seated, and then she begrudgingly sat us and told us that we'd have to order quickly". Wow. Talk about uncomfortable. The food was good. Our server was great. I probably will never go back though, after that. Rustler's Roost... You will spend some money on mediocre food. The kids enjoyed ordering the rattlesnake appetizer though and it'll be something they'll remember. But, with the amount of money we spent there, that was one expensive rattlesnake memory. So, it sounds like I'm tearing up the "resort" in this review, and I sort of am. I'm disappointed that it really felt more like an apartment complex than a resort. I almost feel silly calling such a place a resort. I'm feeling a bit gouged by the food prices. I guess I'd be less resentful if we were treated like welcome guests and not irritating wallets. So, my advice: bring cheap flops for the pool, order pizza to eat in the room or go out beyond the resort for meals, make sure you room isn't all the way across the "resort" from the pool if that's where you'll be running back and forth from, bring a cooler if you need to keep things cold because the room refrigerator is stuffed with things you can purchase.

Reviews.Title: “HIghs and Lows”
Reviews.Author: treetattoo
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying the exceptionally hot weather made everything seem a little more difficult on our recent road trip. Thank goodness for A/C! We had a pretty good 4 night stay here. The suite we had was a little snug for 2 adults and 2 kids but was quiet and close to the family pool and Oasis waterpark. A fridge was not available upon request but an ice machine was nearby. Very late cleaning staff (children taking 4pm naps) meant our room was not 'freshened up' 2 out of the 4 days - but I received towels and trash removal when I asked. We found the breakfast from the Lobby Grill to be very good. We also ordered from room service and the food came quickly and as hot as if we were in the restaurant. Very generous portions - no complaints about the food here at all. Most staff were friendly and helpful - I received a free shuttle ride with my kids over to the Mall when we were just too hot to be outside but needed to walk around somewhere (they have a Rain Forest Cafe in the Mall). The waterpark was a lot of fun. We had no trouble getting a shady spot and lounge chairs. My 6 year old had a blast on the slides and river - he made friends and hung out in the wave pool all day! I felt safe letting him explore, as I tried to keep my 9 month old cool, due to the quantity of lifeguards and the overall safety of the park. The food we ordered was very good, not too pricey considering, (if you want cheap, leave the resort and go to McD's) and nobody seemed to mind that I had brought a few snacks in. Cold water was freely available at no cost and the bathrooms were kept very clean. Overall, a good stay, however, I think we may stay downtown next time for easier access to the museums and cafe's, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Our best vacation ever, ended up being a staycation”
Reviews.Author: highandlow2007
Reviews.Content: We have staycationed at the Arizona Grand for the Past 5 years. Each year our stay gets better and even more enjoyable. We keep wanting to go to California for vacation, but the enjoyment at the Arizona Grand keeps us planted right here in Phoenix. This year they upgraded us into one of the Villa Suites. These are the ones that can be purchaced as a home away from home, but the ones that aren't owned, are rented out. So We felt like we were royalty. The room was beautiful and very quiet and cozy with a seperate room that is home to a very very comfortable king sized bed. The three day stay was the best we have had on any vacation, and the hotel staff was very helpful and the bellman even had a golf cart pick us up and bring us to the room. I would highly recomment this resort to anyone traveling through Phoenix, and even Local residence like us. It was very difficult to have to go back to my house after that Grand weekend. Thank you Arizona Grand for making our 2011 vacation one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic Summer Vacation"”
Reviews.Author: susan0467
Reviews.Content: We had the best time at The Arizona Grand. Everyone was so friendly upon our arrival. We really felt like we were appreciated by everyone. Our room was so clean and the bed was very very comfortable. We were able to get good rest. The Oasis water park is very close to all of the rooms on the property. The short walk that we took to get there was beautiful with all of the fountains and gardens. The water park was great. I have three small children rangeing in ages 10-3 years old and there was something for each of them to enjoy. The other part that we enjoyed about our stay was that we had a mall and many other activities just minutes away from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: mattgswimguy
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay in Phoenix and came across this place. Mainly because they were offering 199 dollars a night, plus 100 dollars credit every day at the hotel. We thought it was a scam, but it was true! The hotel is laid out like a vacation club, where all the buildings are separate. They are mostly square shaped and have a quiet pool in the middle. The rooms were very clean and pretty big. The restaurant was great for breakfast, and while it had an awesome buffet, the french toast was to die for. The water park was an awesome place to escape the heat. It was very clean, very pretty, and not TOO crowded. There is a great place to just grab a lunch in the water park too. The hotel in our opinion was one of the best hotels we ever stayed in, also because of it's proximity to mountain hiking, a giant mall, and downtown Scottsdale and Phoenix. If we could, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful alternative to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Arizona_Don
Reviews.Content: Our children (ages 15, 16, 18 & 21) and I stayed at the Arizona Grand on 7/27 and 7/28. This was our third or fourth trip in as many years, so I do have a basis for comparison. My verdict? The Arizona Grand just keeps getting better and better. The rooms are spacious, e.g. two queen beds and a pull out couch that sleeps two; very clean and very well appointed. I would compare them, favorably, to a Doubletree. The real draw, however, is the Water Park, which comprises the Lazy River, a wave pool and the not-to-be-missed water slide. Even though this was our third or fourth trip, my children never got bored. If you were to get bored, the Arizona Mills Mall is about 3 minutes away. Customer service was world class. During our second to last stay, we ran into some minor problems with housekeeping, problems which I relayed to Paul Gray, the General Manager. Mr. Gray floored me with his timely and warm response. He took complete ownership of the problem and made things right, and without hesitation. Major kudos to Mr. Gray. In summary, very nice, spacious rooms; world-class customer service; an outrageously fun water park; eye candy for the teens and a great location with lots of shopping nearby make this a wonderful alternative to Disney, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Just as I expected”
Reviews.Author: floorman726
Reviews.Content: After reading many many reviews about this resort, I booked a room for 3 nights at the Arizona Grand Resort. I have to say most reviews were dead on. The waterpark is fine. Not very big, but didnt think it was anyway. The lazy river was decent in length with many extra water sprayers to get you wet. At times there were too many empty rafts in the river and other times it was fine. We only went on the curvy slide. My 10 year old liked it. As I get older (44) I like slides less and less. The other 2 slides were straight down pretty much. the wave pool was small but sufficient and they had a larger area to swim in with volleyball and basketball in the water. Overall the water experience was good! Of course the food prices were outrageous. Dont get the icecream. It is ice milk and too expensive. I think where this review turns bad is the room. I was warned that the rooms were older and outdated. The hallways seemed dirty, like a good power washing was needed. The carpet was not good at all. Stains and all. I made sure we all had socks on walking around the room. The bathroom was really really small. Like it was an afterthought or something. I dont understand how they could make it that small. The building name we stayed in was the Camelback. Overall, if you ask me if I would stay again, which i believe is a good way to measure, I would have to say no. This stay is very fresh in my mind because we are still here and checking out tomorrow morning. Oh yea, we did golf today, $19 unlimited golf is good, but who wants to play golf in 105 degree weather, more than 18 holes. It did cost $30 to rent clubs which is terrible. The course is nice. The first 5 holes is open and close to the interstate. The next 4-5 is threaded thru condos and such. It was nice. The back nine is all desert golf. I liked it the most. Seemed like we got away from everyone. So I hope this helps someone decide one way or another.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and have decided to meet with our family every year”
Reviews.Author: Quepos2
Reviews.Content: Familes should love the hotel with all the pools, restauants close to the outlet malls. My sisters and I met July 13 and stayed to the 16th we had two children ages 8 and 10 they had so much fun as did we. The pools were cooling in the hot sun, had fabulous service in the restauants and poolside. We had such a great time we want to meet there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, great web designer!!!”
Reviews.Author: bcsc5
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Sedona Suites. Room was completely filthy. Carpet heavily soiled. We forced everyone to wear shoes at all times. No sitting/playing on floor. Counter tops with rings left from drinks. They easily wiped away with wet wash cloth (proof that no attempt to clean) Worst of all were the numerous hairs in the bathroom, mostly in the shower! A pair of shoes left under one of the beds and a coconut bra in a drawer. We stay approx 30 nights in hotels/etc per year. This was the second dirtiest room we have ever been assigned. Arrived a little late and the parking lot was teaming with unsavory characters. Had a 7 week old and two other children ready to get out of the car (drive from Dana Point, CA) so did not feel worth looking for other accomodations. Also 8 year old turned 9 during stay and was excited about water park. To be fair, water park was clean and grounds were well maintained. Rustler's rooste provided a nice birthday dinner. Birthday cake made on site was also very nice. Overall a terrible room with a few nice amenities but safety was also sketchy. (Left early to avoid heat and would never pack vehicle the night before!) Would NEVER stay here again, look at 2 area Hilton's. Kudos to web designer for the 'resort'. Made it look great, don't be fooled! Did not complain while on site, only spent about 36 hours in the filth and both Hilton's were booked.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as I expected”
Reviews.Author: ohio4163buckeye
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this resort. However, upon checking in and getting to our room, I was very disappointed. The room was tiny, though it said that it sleeps five. My husband called the front desk to see if we could switch rooms or upgrade and was told no since we booked through a third party (travelocity). The desk clerk mentioned third party numerous times...to the point of upsetting my husband. He offered no solutions or resolutions to our sleeping arrangements. The whole hotel was not very clean, it seemed a bit outdated, and the staff not very friendly. The waterpark area was nice though, and enjoyed by our three kids. I would not be in a hurry to return to his hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of children but it was fun”
Reviews.Author: Royh1965
Reviews.Content: We are a same sex couple and we had our 16 year old daughter with us so we booked a resort room that had a seperate bedroom with a door and a small living room with a pull out sofa bed. This was our 4th visit to the Arizona Grand and the changes they have made are nice. Although the outside of the property is dated and faded the new lobby was awesome. When we arrived the room location we booked was not available so we were upgraded to a room that faced the water park. From our patio we could see the entrance to the park with a great view of the entire resort. The only complaint I would have about the room is why would the owners would spend millions of dollars on renovating the rooms to modern standards but forget the TV? The room had two televisions but they were old 19" tube type. The room would have been perfect if it had modern flat screens. Yeah I didn't go to this resort to watch TV but do it right or don't do it at all. The water park: The park opens at 9:30 and a line of over 100 people started to form around 8:30 because shade near water is hard to find. There are lots of shaded places but they are in the center of the water park and not near the water. It would be great for a person wanting to read and relax in peace. We did not get the best spot but we made it work and we had a great time. The food/beverage service was great, fast and good. I did hear a group of people complain about the prices but the portions are huge and enough food to share. We had a few taco salads and a chicken sandwich and that was more than enough food for the 3 of us. As the day progressed the park was very crowded with tons of families with very young children. There were only a few teen/tweens so our daughter was bored and ended up going back to the room to talk on her cell phone. Things sure have changed since our daughters were small and I'm shocked how parents just let their children wander without supervision in a water park of all places. I lost count of the number of time I got hit in the head with a football or water tube while in the pool. I know it was a Saturday but I have never seen it that packed. Rustler's Roost: We went here for dinner and the place is a bit loud but we had a great view of the valley. We were told that the food here was the bomb and I assumed it was because it was so crowded and there was at least an hour wait for a table (we had reservations). The food was not all that, we tried the fried rattle snake and all we tasted was old cooking oil. I ordered the rib eye with the bone medium rare. It looked great but was tough and hard to eat. It was the worst steak I have every had so I just ate my green beans. Our daughter had the fried shrimp which she loved but the sides were gross. Our friends had the burger, the mixed grill and the chicken. My partner had the prime rib and he liked it. It was a fun experience but on my next visit to this resort I will not be going to the Roost to eat. All in all this is a great family resort that still needs a little work but I didn't stay here to watch TV and I know kids will be kids I just raised my daughters differently. One last word: At 6:00 pm on Friday and Saturday they have a dance show with young girls and one young boy from local schools to get the crowd into a party mood. It seemed like a good idea but putting teens in adult type costumes and makeup was creepy. There was a group of guys that spent all day in the pool drinking but once the show started they got out of the water and just started acting like they were in a strip club. A few said a few in appropriate comments on what they would do if they could tap that. As a father I that is was gross and we ended up leavinng. I felt bad for the dancers because they were good but the old guys just made it pervey.

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Friendly atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: dela
Reviews.Content: Tired of the heat in the city and decided to get away to a local resort. The receptionist at the front desk was so friendly and accomodating when we checked in two hours early. We couldn't wait to experience the refreshing water at the Oasis water park. We were not disappointed. Loved the long lazy river! The two-room suite was well-appointed with a sofa, chairs, table, wet bar, mini-fridg, TV in the front room. The bedroom had a very comfortable king bed, lots of dresser and wardrobe space. We were on the 4th floor overlooking a swimming pool and hot tub area that opened at 6:00am. Next morning we took our brought breakfast down to an umbrella table and enjoyed breakfast and a swim in a lovely area. We were impressed with the cleanliness of the entire resort. This is an older resort and age shows in some places. However, it appears that everything is being done to make the resort a great place to stay. We will definitely consider a mini-vacation here again so close to home. We did dine at the highly-touted Rustler's Rooste up the hill from the resort. Great atmosphere and view. Lots of food, but not as good as we expected from the raves and reviews.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE LOVE IT !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brenda_118
Reviews.Content: My family and I had an amazing time. The water park was clean, fresh, and all pools and slides were up and ready. The lazy river was sooo peaceful and relaxing. We also stayed over night and our room was exceptional! Our room was clean and perfect. I really am looking forward to staying again! My boys were sooo happy.

Reviews.Title: “It will be our new vacation destination. Loved all the amenties and people!”
Reviews.Author: Jdawg39
Reviews.Content: the resort is centrally located to nearby shops (Fry's market, Fry's electronics, 5 and Diner...." There is plenty of things to do and see on and off the resort. I didn't bring my clubs this time and I am regretted it. Take advantage of the multiple pools if you do not do the water park.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: broccuj7
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Arizona Grand was exactly what we needed. From the time we checked in till our departure the staff at the Arizona Grand made us feel like we were at home. The food at the restaurant was amazing, but the highlight of our stay was the day we spent at the waterpark. The staff there were friendlly, fast, and really took care of us. You could tell that the people in the waterpark really took pride in their work, and made their guests feel like they were kept happy. I will definitely be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great 'staycation'"”
Reviews.Author: bravo_al
Reviews.Content: Staying right after the big dust storm in the area, we saw no sign of problems. The water park was in great shape and the rooms were impeccable. We had friends come stay one day with us and they loved it as well!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonTravels
Reviews.Content: We were so thrilled with our stay at the Arizona Grand - we said to each other over and over we didn't think the staff could do a better job taking care of us. We were shuttled to our room, to the Rustler's Roost restaurant at the top of the hill (highly recommend by the way) and our luggage was shuttled back to the lobby when we checked out. They really try to take care of every detail. Our room was spacious and clean. Yes, they have old style tv's but with so much to do outside - why sit there and watch tv? The only complaint about the room is the pullout bed was uncomfortable. Also, they only gave us one pillow and a sheet for it when they knew we had two children. I didn't realize they didn't have a blanket until the next morning when they complained about how cold they got. Not good. We found the entire resort easy to navigate and signs everywhere telling you which was to go. The waterpark was so much fun - there is no way anyone got "bored after 45 minutes." We saw people lined up an hour before it even opened so they could claim a good seat - that's how much fun it is. There are people who take the rafts and they think they own them for the day - there aren't enough for everyone to do this and it leads to lines at the lazy river and the wave pool as people are hoping to score on a raft. Meanwhile, there are rafts all over the park laying beside people's chairs as they claim them for the day (and then don't use them - running off to go down a slide,etc.). We just took those rafts off the empty chairs and used them and then left them in the water for others and I would like to see the park staff implement rules about that kind of thing. Just annoying and I shouldn't have to risk confrontation to get a park raft. There was an incident between two guests with one threatening the other. She was crazed and using profane language and the staff was quick to respond. She took off to hide but somehow they found her and as I was walking to my spa appointment - I saw her being evicted from the park. Good to know they take security seriously - especially with so many children there. The spa staff were professional and my massage appointment was on time and sooo relaxing. My husband played golf and also had a great time - said the course was perfect! We ate at the Vista buffet on Sunday and oh - was it ever good! Even the kids had so much fun ordering omelettes and trying new food. There's lots of food and something to keep everyone happy. This was our first visit to the Arizona Grand and on the drive home we talked about how much fun we had and how we plan to make this a yearly adventure. Counting the days til next year! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: csands33
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a good experience at this hotel. I read a lot of reviews before booking our room. Some of the negative things were indeed true others were not really a big deal. If you are staying for the amenities like the water park and pools then you will likely be fine. The room had adequate space for our 4 person family. The bathroom is small but sufficient. The televisions are definitely dated and the fridge is small. The room was not completely clean when we checked in. There was a razor on a table from a previous guest and the drawer space near the fridge was dirty. The bath tub had a very slow drain leaving us standing in water for our first showers. This issue was resolved quickly and the gentleman who helped was very friendly. The food is pricey. Breakfast was definitely expensive. We did choose room service twice. Once for a late dinner strictly out of convenience and the other for a family pizza deal that was at what we considered a reasonable price. The staff was friendly and courteous. I wish they would have been more straight forward with parking details. I felt I was led to believe I had to choose or at least should choose the valet. We chose to park ourselves after the first day and it was never a bad walk. The outside of the resort is very pretty and well kept. The water park was fun and the pool was great. The pool was especially nice during the day when I assume others were visiting the water park. I called to request a ground floor room and was guaranteed one near the pool. At check-in, the room I was assigned was not ready so they gave us another ground floor room near the pool - they were very accommodating. The $30 a day resort fee is fine but should include internet service. It does not seem customer friendly to charge that and a $14.99 daily fee for internet. It is 2011, internet service should be included. The resort was in a great location for us...near the airport, interstate, restaurants and friends we were visiting. We never had to drive more than 15-20 minutes. Overall a good trip and we will consider staying here on our next trip to Phoenix. However, I will look around first. I am a very loyal customer but I am not 100% sold on this resort yet.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for the whole family to enjoy each other and their surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: heather212
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Extremely clean rooms. Excellent service and accommodations. Excellent place for families.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: marcumman
Reviews.Content: What a cool place to stay, even in July. Our room was really nice. The view from our room looked over the water park with a mountain range behind it. The water park is a fabulous place to take the family. The service was great. The bar tenders and waiters were prompt and friendly. The whole park was clean and well maintained. The restaurant had great food with nice atmosphere. The service was excellent. I played golf at a top notch course that wound thru the mountain. The last hole looked over the entire city. The service was nice on the course but the golf pro wasn't. I don't like when management disciplines is employees in front of its customers. Overall the room was. Great! The water park was amazing! The restaurant was excellent. I will be back when we visit. That you Arizona Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Katheye
Reviews.Content: This place is great! We spent the entire weekend at the Oasis water park. The park was very clean. Service staff was great and lifeguards were very attentive. Literally, every 20 feet.....another lifeguard. Rooms were pretty nice. Overall, the service was outstanding! Even though it was crowded, we enjoyed this property immensely. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come Back!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcmurphy633
Reviews.Content: Each year my family does a staycation at the AZ Grand and each year we have a great time! This year was no exception. Our over all stay was great! We have two young children so finding a place to go and relax is not always easy. We, of course go to the Grand because of the water park. It is always clean and well kept...even the bathrooms! The service was excellent! We ordered lunch and stayed for the dive in movie....our sever was amazing. She was there every time we needed anything...and again with two young kids we can be a demanding family.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: Mommacita6
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time with our family and friends!! We stayed two nights and were treated great. The rooms are amazing with soft beds and a very clean facility. My daughter LOVED the water park! We will for SURE make this a summer hot spot!!! Thanks for being a part of our amazing SUMMER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best group party ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: cnl513
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to thank not only our friend for inviting us to this resort but the managment and staff as well for one of the funnest trips we have had in a long time! We were invited along with 4 other rooms of friends to celebrate a birthday at the AZ Grand Resort. I was skeptical that this would be fun and relaxing but the staff at this resort was amazing along with the property itself. The grounds, pools and rooms were magnificent, clean and well appointed. The husbands were set up with golfing one day and all the kids and Mom's had a blast as well. The cake that was made for the birthday girl by the on site bakery was to die for! This hotel earns 5 stars from our family. We travel a lot and have stayed in many types of hotels but this one is the tops! Thanks so much! Can't wait to come back again. Think I'll have MY birthday party there!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best trip EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: tnclowe10
Reviews.Content: I just had to write and about what a wonderful time we had at your hotel. We come up every year to celebrate my daughters birthday and this year was no exception. We had the largest group yet and every detail was taken care of and catered too. The front desk manager and all his staff were SO kind, friendly and managed everything for us and all our friends perfectly. We had 5 rooms booked so I'm sure it was no easy task but AZ Grand staff pulled it off for us. The grounds were beautifu, clean and well taken care of as were the rooms. We didn't drive far to get there but once we arrived, it felt like being a million miles from home and in the lap of luxery! This was our 4th year in a row and we look forward to spending many more! Thanks AZ Grand and staff... you are the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some things very good, many things not so great”
Reviews.Author: netcorrupter
Reviews.Content: PROS: Modern, spacious rooms, a nice separate suite w/ t.v. & sleep sofa. They give each room 4 waterpark bracelets which was great having x-tra for a family member in town. We were charged $18 for bar food we never ordered, but the staff was very nice to promptly remove it from our bill. The best part of our stay was the night we had dinner at the 'Ruster's Roost' up on top of the hill of this resort. The hotel provides a shuttle. Dont miss it!! It's a fun country & western themed restaurant w/ free live music & even a live 'pet' bull at the entrance. Best of all they served HUGE portions ( 4 of us barely finished the onion ring basket ) & both men said the steaks were the best they'd ever eaten! Oh, and the entire wall that faced the city was all glass, & provided magnificent views of Phoenix! CONS: The layout of this hotel & its 'villa's is the worst I've ever encountered. It was a very confusing maze everywhere we went. Three adults with college degrees stayed lost most of our 4 days there lol. For instance on the map the waterpark was right behind our villas, so you'd think we could just find a path that leads straight to it. But nooooo! We walked in circles & dead end paths leading to nowhere etc. for 20 mins. before we finally found the entrance. They REALLY REALLY need to put up some directional signs!!! They had happy hour prices at the INSIDE bar only where NOBODY was during the day, yet didnt honor the same happy hour prices outside at the bar in the waterpark. One beer was around $6.50. Ouch! I read this was a huge waterpark. In reality to others I've been to it was tiny! All they had was three slides side by side, a very tiny wave pool shoulder to shoulder with people & their rafts, a tiny pool, a big hot tub, and a small lazy river which was crowded with a ton of empty rafts in our way. We'd planned on spending the whole day there, but after about 45 mins the (teen) kids were ready to leave. We went shopping instead. Also, it was a shock that a hotel of this caliber still had small, old style t.v.s

Reviews.Title: “We most likely won't return...check your beds.”
Reviews.Author: AZ501
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel one night. We bought the deal on LivingSocial.com...and I think everyone else in town did also. We did go on a weekend (Saturday) and the waterpark was VERY crowded. There was no organization at the lazy river. You had to fight to get a tube, and some of these people (mostly adults) held 5-6 tubes together and would continuously go round and round. You would think with people waiting, you would only be able to go around once, then give the next person a turn. I didn't understand that. We wound up going to one of the swimming pools that were less crowded and enjoyed ourselves there. Check you beds! I believe my daughter got bit my bed bugs. She woke up with two areas of small red welts, three to four of them right in a row, under her armpit. The positives...the french toast at the lobby grill was the best I ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids and parents, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cr8zykittens
Reviews.Content: Brought my 12 year old daughter and a couple of her friends to the Az Grand for a sleepover/birthday party last weekend. Had heard the water park at this hotel was best in Phoenix. They did not disappoint. Check-in was a breeze, valets and bell staff very accommodating to all our bags, snacks, and paraphernalia. Room was beautiful and was located in wing with other family staycationer families. Was a fun atmosphere and the kids had a blast. Oasis Water Park was great, the lazy river loops around, very relaxing. There are little lounge areas all around park where you can relax and get away from the water park mayhem. I did not ride slides but kids liked them, said they were fast and fun. Lobby marketplace was a great place to get morning coffee and sit and enjoy cool post-monsoon morning. Did not eat at Bar/Restaurant in Lobby but it smelled wonderful. Highly recommend for a Summer retreat!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed..much better options in Phoenix metro area”
Reviews.Author: colesloough
Reviews.Content: Stayed at AGR July 1-5. Had suite directly over entrance to waterpark. Staff was nice, but follow thru on any service was absymal. Waterpark OK but very overcrowded. Rooms dated. Some of the equipment in fitness center crummy(but they had the hottest looking blonde personal trainer n the west!) Noise in suite above us at 1am not taken care of after call to front desk. Light bulb that burned out NEVER replaced all 5 days. Wrong room service order after re-confirming 3 times. May be decne t place to stay with samll kids, but for couples or older kids, there are far better resorts......Westin Kierland; Doubletree Paradise Valley , etc.

Reviews.Title: “BAD OMEN”
Reviews.Author: deckerpuntafinal
Reviews.Content: As a 1st Assistant Director in the Hollywood film business, first impression are very important in evaluating locations such as what hotels to stay in, where to eat and so on. I am schedule to stay at the Arizona Grand Resort July 19-23 and I had a simple question that I needed answer. I call the front desk that was told someone would be right with me 12 and half minutes later after listening to the music I hung up. This happened again for 8 minutes. I this is going to be the level of performance and I haven't even got there...what is it going to be like when i check in. amhaving serious thoughts about finding different hotel. Thank you Bill Decker

Reviews.Title: “Not quite the "resort" we expected”
Reviews.Author: twinmom8
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed over the July 4th weekend. Photos of the hotel looked great until we arrived. Photos online are the exteriors of the villas, not the suites. We stayed in the "deluxe" suites as opposed to the "resort" suites. The only difference was that we were located next to the water park. The buildings looked dated and needed a thorough cleaning on the exteriors. There were bird droppings on most of the railings & walkway in front of our room. We did call the front desk and asked that they clean it, they did send people up. Good: Interior of rooms were large & roomy, looked remodeled. Camelback suites were located right next to fun waterpark. The spa was excellent & very tranquil. Lobby grill had great food, service was spotty. One morning they did forget to bring my daughter her breakfast since the rest of us had the buffet, but they deleted the charge off of our bill. The Rustlers Rooste had great atmosphere and food. Kids loved the slide in restaurant. Waterpark was the best part of hotel, they have entertainment in the afternoons and show family movies in the evenings in the wave pool. Bad: The toilet tank leaked and kept refilling every 8 minutes. The pullout bed mattress was more like springs in your back. We pulled the cushions off the sofa and had the kids sleep on that. Refrigerator in room could be a little larger or less stocked with hotel items to purchase. We brought our own water since it was record temps in Phoenix. You pay a resort fee but you have to pay for internet service also? Ended up going to the business center for internet access. Overall it was an okay stay but definitely will not be back, we will probablly try another "resort" with a waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort to come to with family.”
Reviews.Author: gatorbait75
Reviews.Content: I am not sure where some of the scathing reports come from. I am used to Disney resorts, where if you sneeze, some one pops out from behind some secret wall to say ‘Bless you”.
