My husband enjoyed the fact that they let you use the driving range for free. We loved that, except for the price of the food, we never felt nickeled and dimed. There were no hidden charges at the water park, the inner tubes are there for anyone to use and there are plenty of them. The number of lifeguards around is astonishing. They are located about every 20 feet along the length of the lazy river and they switch stations every 30 minutes so they can stay attentive. They all seemed very nice as well. Gently correcting kids who were doing the wrong thing rather than yelling. We felt completely safe letting the 9 year old go around the lazy river by himself. We also loved that the Grand is only about 15 minutes from the airport, so you don't spend all day getting thereafter you land.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time (was had by all)”
Reviews.Author: jasmd530
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 spent a pleasant 6 days at the Arizona Grand while I participated in an annual golf outing in Phoenix . The AGR exceeded our expectations in many ways despite the overlap with the expected Spring Break traffic. As with any hotel, there are strengths and weaknesses however, there were several aspects that are undeniably EXCEPTIONAL for a resort of this size, quality, and price point. Located within a short drive to Sky Harbor airport, the resort is off the beaten path of the typical Scottsdale 'name' resorts. What you get for that is a lack of pretentiousness, more attention to the guest, and very good value for your dollar. A car is necessary to explore Phoenix and the vicinity. The hotel staff was all so very helpful, polite, and willing to go out their way to assist guests. Having stayed at the Arizona Biltmore, just 3 weeks earlier, I said that the level of attention between the two was equivalent but without the "white glove" service. In fact, I was pleasantly surprised at the prompt nightly turn-down service with towel exchange that was M.I.A. at the Biltmore where I paid twice the nightly rate (do you hear that Biltmore?) Also, reasonable room rates plus the Grand Experience which gives you $100 per room per night credit toward virtually any expense on property. How's that for a deal. The water park was a welcomed haven for the kids, with attentive lifeguards at the wave pool, lazy river, and 3 waterslides. Can't say that I didn't catch just a few adults indulging themselves at the water park. After several strenuous laps in the Lazy River, I was ready for poolside service from the friendly waitstaff. The traditional pools adjacent to the rooms were more than adequate, quieter, and offered a nice change of pace from the water park. Admission to the park is included in the price of the room and is not open to the public ...another plus. So if the food and drinks are a little pricier...it still doesn't come close to Disney prices. The 18 hole golf course was very playable and well maintained. The hole design was varied with sweeping changes in the mountainside terrain making it very scenic and challenging. Rates were very reasonable especially with the additional 20% discount offered to hotel guests. My 9 year old son loved it and begged for more playing time. The driving range was adequate and free to use with lots of kids taking advantage of the kid friendly range. And best yet, children 12 and under play golf for free! Yet another pleasant surprise! We signed up for a twilight round at 3:26pm and were given the green light to go off at 2:30pm for the same price. The rooms are typical suite design with a bedroom with king or 2 queen plus a living area with a pull out queen. This was a former Hilton property. A mini bar refrigerator and wet bar was useful. The rooms are nice and more than adequate, but who comes to Phoenix to stay indoors? The mattresses on the sofa beds could use an update. TV's are not flat screen but with 2 per suite, they do the job. Finally, as a self-proclaimed foodie I was pleasantly surprised by the menu items at the resort restaurants. During our trip they offered not only children's menu items but had priced fixed specials such as Prime Rib Night. Honestly, possibly the BEST, tastiest, and enjoyable prime rib I have ever eaten. Though the portions are not huge like one would find at an upscale steak house, they were more than enough for my hungry appetite (come on America do we really need to super-size?). Dinner included a buffet of iceberg lettuce wedge, creamed spinach, potatoes, vegggies and dessert all for $ 21.95 . Outdoor dining and coctails by 2 fire pits and with beautiful views of the golf course. Food service during the Spring break holiday was slow but the maitre d' informed all the guests up front that the kitchen was swamped and that they would not be seated until the kitchen caught up. Although the hunger was upset I appreciated the honest candor up front. Bravo again ! The spa and gym were very modern in a beautiful building and the parking was free all over the resort. This resort is a virtual 'diamond in the rough'. And believe me, I spent 5 days in the rough during my golf tournament... I know rough :-) ! Apparently with the new management making renovations like the new central lobby, restaurant, Starbuck's and golf shop I'm sure that as the economy improves, so will the updated amenities. If my three world travelers ages 9, 9 , and 7 give the AGR a big thumbs up for a return trip and momma reluctantly left the resort to go home with a big smile on her face, you know that they are doing alot of things right . We will certainly consider a return visit. Although a paradise for children, the Arizona Grand Resort has plenty for adults without children too! Jeff Denver, CO

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel with water park”
Reviews.Author: Scubashark0822
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a two year old. Huge pool and waterpark with dive in kids movies. Location far from stuff but why leave resort?

Reviews.Title: “bring your own food”
Reviews.Author: tallt080
Reviews.Content: the hotel is nice but bring your own food. I was just waiting in an hour wait for the 1 and only place that serves breakfast. I only wanted a breakfast sandwich. There's nothing quick. The staff said that it took them by surprise that people came between 9 and 9:45am for breakfast. When do they think people are coming? 10am? 6am? come on. Terrible. Turned a nice vacation into a poor one. Their alternative is to have a place to get muffins and doughnuts and gelato. Not one thing that's worthwhile for breakfast or that's healthy for you.

Reviews.Title: “Won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Mom2Grlz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was overpriced. The restaurants were expensive (which we expected), the minibar was insane ($3 for a can of soda--again, expected), and the water park that is such a big selling point for them is an additional $30 per day. The waterpark wasn't even that great. We spent more time at the little pool outside the room than we did at the Oasis. It was very clean, and housekeeping was great. Also, you are very close to the airport and highway access. We had a patio on our ground floor room, but there was no furniture to sit out there so all we used it for was to dry our swimsuits. Also, they advertised having horse riding trails, but they had gotten rid of their riding stables so we had to find somewhere else to take the kids riding. Also, Wifi was an additional $15 per day. I was very disappointed with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is great except the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jkinsit
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 including two teenagers and a ten year old booked a week at the Arizona Grand. Overall everything is wonderful, food, service, the watermark- all excellent. We stayed in a deluxe two queen suite which also includes a pull out queen sofa bed. We've stayed in many hotels previously and had our teens sleep on the sofa beds but this one was particularly uncomfortable. So much so that we ended up taking turns on it just to make sure every one got a chance at a good night sleep. Basically I spent two nights sleeping on a couch during what was supposed to be a relaxing vacation. Twice I asked management for a solution but was told we would have to pay an additional $300 per night for an additional room. All I can say is that the "suites" do not comfortably accommodate 5 people as advertised. Not getting a good night sleep put a huge damper on the whole trip for all of is.

Reviews.Title: “Great water park, ok golf and way below average service”
Reviews.Author: bill_swackhamer
Reviews.Content: The resort is an ok destination for families, especially with younger children (ages 5-17) due to the water park. Service is poor, which is evidenced by the slow service, but also the number of employees in 'training", which shouldn't occur during the peak season. Appears to be the result of lots of turnover likey driven by lower than market wages (my opinion). The problems could be the result of the documented problems the ownership has with the resort's lender (not that unusual today). Golf course is just ok, lots of blind shots and very tight but a beautiful back nine (nice desert atmosphere) Rooms are suites but are smaller and the bathrooms are very small (sinks are actually in the bedrooms)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but needs some updates and service....”
Reviews.Author: Stevedenver033
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my 14 and 15 year old. Nice hotel. We stayed in a villa and could use some updating for $300 a night. Tv's were 1990's box tv's 19" in living room and bedroom. Bed was awesome but the pull out was terrible. Housekeeping and maintnenace were very slow to respond. Had issues with both and had to beg to get service. Water park is terrific, much better than expected. Resteraunts okay. Locaiton of hotel is right on sketchy side of town but hotel is isolated. Love the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Resort With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TamraG
Reviews.Content: I travel with my family and extended family every March to the Phoenix area for Spring Training baseball. We have stayed at many resorts in the Phoenix/Scottsdale/Tempe area over the years and are delighted to finally have found a place that we want to come back to year after year. We love this resort for many reasons! All rooms are at least a 1 bedroom suite (great if you have kids with you!) with a small refrigerator (no charge to use) and a pull out sofa bed in the living area. There are also other larger rooms types available and they are happy to accommodate requests for connecting rooms. The grounds are beautiful and the resort has it's own WaterPark with a lazy river, waterslides, and giant wave pool that is popular with adults and children alike. Although it can get very busy, there are many, many lifeguards around to keep a close eye on things, and the wait stuff does a fantastic job of making sure your requests are met in a timely and friendly fashion. While we were there, kid friendly movies were shown in the evenings out by the pool for some handy free family entertainment. We've eaten at the main hotel restaurant several times and the food has been quite good. Prices are fairly typical for this caliber of a resort. Do yourself a favor on a hot day and stop in the marketplace for their homemade gelato...delicious! The resort also has a fitness center, golf course, and additional pools and hot tubs spread throughout the resort property in addition to the Water Park. Despite the upscale nature of the hotel, our family feels completely comfortable here. The staff is extremely gracious and will go out of their way to help you with any request. At some higher end resorts, I have run into attitudes from staff members, but never here! It is a very family friendly and delightfully accommodating place to stay. If you are going to be in the Phoenix area and need a place to stay (especially if you have kids), do yourself a favor and stay here! The location is great, you can get to most of the main attractions in under 20 minutes....or just stay at the resort and enjoy all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Best. Trip. Ever.”
Reviews.Author: srich6421
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Arizona Grand on Saturday, March 12 and left on Wednesday, March 16th with our 2 children who are 9 and 6 years old. We had a blast!! The people who worked the front desk were so sweet and explained everything to us and we were shuttled to our room in the Sedona building by a very nice man who gave us a tour of the property. Our children played at the water park all day, every day. Both of them were thankfully tall enough to ride the water slides that were so much fun. My husband and I enjoyed the lazy river and the wave pool. The service was excellent out by the wave pool. We just raised our flags and we had whatever we wanted! We did have a $100 credit to spend each day, but our's was gone right after lunch. (Don't judge---we were on vacation!!). I will say that the drinks were a little expensive at $9 a pop, but it didn't seem to matter to us. We ate at the Lobby Grill, Aunt Chileada's and Rustler's Rooste. All were great. The kids liked the slide at the Rustler's Rooste the most. Also, there were tons of hummingbirds everywhere so the kids thought that was great. We will definitley save up to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lbdesigns
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand was delightful though it was shortened by a family emergency. But in our brief stay, we quickly came to love the beautiful, well-maintained grounds, the plentiful accomodations and most impressive, the warm & friendly staff. In particular, Conierge Tim Watkins went above and beyond to help make our stay as pleasant as possible. His service alone was reason enough to bring us back another time in the future and to recommend this resort to others. Thank you Tim!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pool & Standard Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BeckyPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I planned a stay-cation here with my husband and 4-year old son. We only stayed 1 night in March and spent most of the day at the pool. The pool had just opened, but it was heated. The pool area is a full waterpark. There is a wave pool, giant slides, a sports area with pool volleyball and basketball, and a little splash park for small kids. There is also a lazy river. There are lots of lifeguards on duty. Beware: The staff will full-blown rummage through your pool bag to be sure you are ABSOLUTELY not bringing in any snacks or drinks of your own. They even took my son's snack back of Teddy Grahams away from him. They have pool service for food or drink. Beers are $5.50 a piece and mixed drinks are $9-$11. Food is like bar food (Hotdogs, Corndogs, Chicken Tenders, Wraps) and there is no kids menu. We stayed in the Resort Room (I think the lowest rate one). It's a nice layout to have a small living room and bedroom. The TV's in these rooms have to be from the 1990's. They are 19" TVs and have no hook-up for DVD players or any electronics. Bathrooms are like motel room bathrooms. Nothing fancy about the rooms. Lobby Restaurant was good. Wide range of pizza, steaks, burgers, and a kids menu. Eating on the restaurant deck overlooking the golf course looked amazing. My husband hit the driving range. Said it was nice and hitting buckets of balls were included in our room rate. Overall, a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Beavscabin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine nights in March 2011 to get away from the Midwest winter. The staff was excellent at all times. The rooms were two room suites and were clean. However the bathroom was very small especially for a suite. The insure watermark is fine to visit for one or two days. The food was very good, but limited for a 9 day stay. We had the deal for $35 extra per day we had $100 per day towards food. Room service was very good and prompt. Note the room service kitchen is separate from the restaurant! For the two egg breakfast I received 4 slices of bacon at the restaurant and 2 pieces for room service? Prices are typical resort prices. Great view of the golf course from the restaurant was excellent. The resort is next to the south mountain park which has some very good rugged hiking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Wedding at the Arizona Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: WCH20693
Reviews.Content: We just hosted our daughter's wedding at the Arizona Grand Resort in Phoenix, AZ. Since we live a long way from Arizona, we depended on the resort coordinator and hotel staff a great deal and they did a truly remarkable job preparing for the event. During the wedding and reception, the staff was great--very professional while also being very personable. The resort grounds were beautiful and provided an amazing backdrop for the wedding ceremony on the island green. The rooms were large and comfortable with many handy amenities. The front desk staff was responsive to our every need and the team of valets were always accommodating and helpful. We enjoyed an absolutely fantastic celebration--and that was due directly to a wonderful team of extremely competent and considerate staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced,Overated,not up to a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scgFortCollinsCO
Reviews.Content: We have traveled extensively across the US and I can defintiely say this place was mediocre at best. We stayed 3 nights, the first night we could not get in,but got a last minute cancellation for $320, about 100 more than the other 2 nights. I thought it must of been an upgraded room,but no, we were in the same room all 3 nights, just our Wed. stay was 100 more and no package deal. Even Jacquelynn at the front desk thought it was odd to be paying so much more for the one night,she tried to get us a deal,but the manager would not budge. At least she waived the resort fee of 30 dollars. She was excellent. Be aware that the 30 dollar resort fee is tacked on to every room so our room on Wed. ended up being $369 total and the other 2 nights were around $290,this is after the $100 resort credit. It is definitely not worth it, you have to pay extra for the WiFi, which you don't expect after paying so much.We found a Barbie leg in our room and the TV's didn't work half the time. The resort itself is beautiful and the resaurant o.k. The water park is nothing spectacular, we stayed at a hotel in Wis. which had a water park and it was far superior to this one. My kids laughed at the wave pool,they kept waiting for the waves. They have 3 slides, one good for everyone, the other 2 are so steep that it ripped my husband's suit to shreds. If their lazy river was anymore slower it would be laughable. Nice hot tub though. The staff was helpful and friendly, but not worth the money. For a huge city like Phoenix, you think they could do so much better. They are only 7 miles from the airport,but they do not have a shuttle, of course you have to pay for a towncar if you want to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for multiage reunions- something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaC48
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights with four rooms (two suites and a villa with adjoining extra bedroom) for two 60 year olds, four 30 somethings, 2 twenty somethings, and a 7 year old, 4 year old, and 2 year old. Having the villa gave us a place to gather and was beautiful. The suites met the needs for young families so the kids had a separate space. The suites are not fancy but adequate and for the price, reasonable. The villa was pricey but worth it. We all loved the water park. We had a warm spell and the water was even warm. Several in the group had massages and enjoyed them (price similar to most places). Others used the gym for racketball and pilates (all inlcuded with resort fee). Two of the group enjoyed golfing (typical costs for resort golf). Four days was about right to have enough to do without going off the property (Grandma took the two older granddaughters to the mall on the shuttle for an hour and a half!). All the restaurants were fine: a little on the pricey side, but what you expect at a resort and food was adequate. Rustler's Rooste has a great view: reserve in advance and ask to sit on the balcony (much quieter too). All staff was friendly and helpful. Only 15 minutes from Phoenix airport makes it easily accessible and though right off the freeway, you would never know it. All in all, a perfect fit for our group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall but some issues...”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugs53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the first time about 5 years ago for 2 nights and really enjoyed it so we booked it again when we visited Phoenix this year. We were told the hotel was renovated about 2 years ago, but the rooms still looked a little dated to me (carpeting and bathroom wallpaper showing signs of wear). While the suites are a decent size with a separate living room, there is a major problem with the layout. The vanity area (which is outside of the bathroom) is right at the foot of the bed in the bedroom with no divider. Therefore if one person wants to get ready without waking the others, it would be darn near impossible. The vanity lights shine right on the bed, never mind the sound of running water right in the bedroom. I've never seen this layout in a hotel before. Also, the bathroom was very small. You had to open the door all the way, walk in, and then get out of the way (due to toilet placement) before you could close it. Yes, the televisions were also small and older, but I didn't really care about tv when I’m on vacation. The grounds are scenic with the mountains in the background. There are lots of gas firepits burning around the property. The staff was very responsive. You can request a golf cart ride (response time was great) to any part of the property you wish to visit, although it’s easily manageable on foot as well. The waterpark was very clean and the perfect size. It is certainly a nice amenity to have with children and teens. However they forbid you to bring "any snacks" into the water park and check your bags. I had to leave a bag of pretzels at the desk. I felt like a criminal. We intended to have lunch there and I just wanted something to tide the kids over until then. We did have lunch from the Oasis Grill and the food was good. The waitresses were very responsive. Put the flag up on your chair and they are there. The next day they must have had my name "tagged" in their book and asked me if I remembered their outside food policy? Again, I felt like a scofflaw. My husband used the golf course and said it was nice but he said the golf cart and clubs he rented were aged. The nail technician at the spa was great. However, the spa itself looks like its in need of updating. My husband enjoyed the fitness center. Since we had the Grand Experience package which allowed us a $100/night credit to use at the resort, we ate at Aunt Chilada's one night. The food was mediocre at best and the service was a little slow. The ambience indoors was lacking, so I would sit at the nice outdoor seating area (weather-permitting) if you decide to eat there at all. I would recommend this resort only if you get a good deal for the reasons mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Grand does a fine job with our 12 families”
Reviews.Author: mekinger
Reviews.Content: For over 6 months our group planned a Spring Training Baseball trip to Arizona. We came to both watch the Big Leaguers and play in a Travel Ball event for 12 year olds. We chose the Arizona Grand Resort because it looked like it had everything our group would need. Restaurants on property, a golf course, Water Park, and central to everywhere we wanted and needed to go. The question was.....Would they be able to deliver? I can sum it all up in one short sentence: "WE ARE TRYING TO DECIDE WHAT DATES TO RETURN IN 2012" Traveling with a group of families to both watch baseball and play baseball we were very impressed by the size of the rooms and the multitude of amenities. The reservations department accommodated our group by putting all of us in the same building and close to the water park. I didn't even request this, but they made it happen. The Spa was perfect and fitness center was perfect for our needs and though we at off property on most occasions we were more than satisfied with the restaurants on property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic girls trip!”
Reviews.Author: mwinco
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fun pool atmosphere and nice spa services.

Reviews.Title: “The service was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Ldarnold
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at the AZ grand resort November 2010 and it was absolutely wonderful. Our guests could not get over how beautiful the view was and our wedding planner Melanie really kept things together making our wedding a night to remember! Our guests are still talking about it. The rooms were a bit pricey and they did charge us for more guests than we had which was a complete misunderstanding, but the overall atmosphere was so fun. Thank you AZ grand for making our wedding the best!

Reviews.Title: “Ryan and his staff were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jxmeiss
Reviews.Content: Ryan and all the staff at the Arizona Grand really went out of their way to make our stay the best it could be! The villa we stayed in was absolutely gorgeous, the pools were quiet and relaxing, the food and beverages were fantastic! The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience”
Reviews.Author: kimschmidt
Reviews.Content: We traveled for a girls weekend and were upgraded to the villas which were fabulous. We had multiple spa treatments, lounged by the pool and loved spending time together at such a relaxing resort. Thank you Arizona Grand for making our stay so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.....”
Reviews.Author: mamaduckgirlstrip
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? The staff and front office Manager Ryan, the pools, the Villa, the spa, the service, Room Service Food, the Cocktails served at the pool, the vibe, the firepits, the surroundings, the whole resort is amazing! Look into the Villas. They are BEAUTIFUL!!! I loved it so much, I am already going back! I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Arizona. The way we were taken care of truly AMAZING!!! Ryan made our stay unforgettable with his guest service. We were so happy!!! The Villas are large,have a kitchen, spotless clean, bathrooms have it all, and the beds.....YOU WILL SLEEP LIKE A BABY. I truly can't say enough. I have been back to Colorado for 2 days and I can't stop smiling and thinking about it. See you next year Arizona Grand!!!! Same time, Same place, same AMAZING experience I am sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best Girls Trip Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: roxblair
Reviews.Content: Annual girls trip to the Arizona Grand Resort and each year it keeps getting better and better. We all had a great time and was very well taken care of by Ryan. He went out of his way to make our stay perfect and we will keep coming back year after year because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, will be back...”
Reviews.Author: RockiesFans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Arizona Grand for the weekend. First trip to Phoenix with the family and was impressed with this resort. Went to Phoenix for spring training game at the new Rockies/Diamondbacks facility (Salt River Fields at Talking Stick) which was only a 20 min drive away. GO ROCKIES!!! Easy access to the highways, restaurants, shopping, gas stations, etc... Also close to Sky Harbor airport (10 min drive). Check in was a breeze, stayed in the Mountain Side units, king size suite with a 2nd bedroom with pullout queen bed for our 2 young boys. Room was decent size, very clean. Only negative thing I have to say about the rooms is the small, tube TVs. Very outdated and TV reception was bad. The resort has the Oasis water park for the kids (I have to admit, I had fun too.....those slides were CRAZY!!!). The resort charges $30 a day resort fee which covers your fee into the water park. Ate breakfast at the resort Lobby Grill one morning. Breakfast buffet style available, think that bill came to approx. $75 for 2 adults, 2 kids. Nothing special about the food. All in all, we'll probably stay here again next time we're in town for a game.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ClarkWaupun_WI
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last week for a business conference and everything was excellent! The room was in great condition, spacious and comfy. The bed was perfect with lots of pillows, and I slept great. The staff was very accomodating - everyone from the concerige to the housekeeping staff was very helpful and friendly. The food was excellent - pricey, but very good. We visited the bar on all three nights, and it was always fun. I also loved the waterpark, as I visited in between meetings. The outside hot tub was spacious and very warm. The outdoor pools were heated and the wait staff was always there if you needed food or drink. I would definitely recommend this to families wanting to spend time outdoors. The golf course looked great, and the hotel also has a path to the hiking trail in the mountains. It was an amazing trip to Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but too many rules!”
Reviews.Author: SonnyCat
Reviews.Content: We come down here every year around this time for a long weekend. All in all we would probably stay at this resort again mostly because of the water park. We have young children and they loved the lazy river, wave pool, etc. The rooms were a good size and clean. We expected the resort fee but didn't always receive what was included like the daily newspaper and coffee. Normally we stay in Scottsdale and this area is definitely not as nice as there but if you stay on the grounds you wouldn't notice. We like to venture out for dinner and purchase snacks, etc. because the resort prices are outrageous. Our biggest issue was all of the rules. The main one being that no outside food/bev is allowed in the water park. They actually checked my bag upon entering and confiscated my sunflower seeds. I could understand if I were bringing in a picnic lunch, but that was ridiculous. Drinks were $9 at least and the food was high priced with small servings. All of the lifeguards were constantly harping about stuff in the water. I understand the liability and safety but it was too much. I didn't really feel like a guest, more like a child being watched. Again, we would probably go back just because of the water park for our kids. Also, the Roost Restaurant (western theme) was very cool and the food was great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: AlliDParker
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a fun girls weekend, this with out a doubt is the place to go. The resort is amazing and the service was top notch. The package includes a lot of perks including spa treatments. My friends and I have made it a tradition (4+ years) and plan to keep going year after year. No need to look elsewhere as it would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “4 years and better each time!!!”
Reviews.Author: girlstrip2011
Reviews.Content: Looking for a fabulous girls trip? A Romantic Place? A family get a way? This place is amazing!!! We go back year after year and it only gets better! In our case we go with 8-12 women for a Girls Get Away. It is wonderful! Spa treatments, coffee by the fire in the morning, drinks all day by the pool, restaurants, and the most comfy beds and accomodations at night!! We LOVE it and every year return! It has everything we want and need. The Service is fantastic...5 star! They treat you like a VIP. You feel like you are the only guest at the resort. We always say we will bring our families and or just our husbands someday. Someday....but for now it is our girls get away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Golf, OK lodging”
Reviews.Author: MadMax3D
Reviews.Content: Had a foursome on a golf weekend in February. First impressions of this hotel well quite good. We arrived at night so the huge fountain at the entrance, all lit up, was a welcoming site. It definitely reminded you you were on vacation. Check-in was pretty smooth (thankfully, since we arrived at 1am and were rather beat). Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Two Tv's in the room (the one in the bedroom didn't work, however). The next morning, in the daylight, we thought that the resort was showing its age a bit. We also noticed a chicken bone on a ledge outside our room. We had a good laugh about it. Four days later, upon departure, that chicken bone was still there. So we wondered if there were and maintenance/grounds keepers around. (well there must have been, since the grounds around the hotel were beautiful, just not immediately outside the rooms) Housekeeping was as expected. Golf course was definitely challenging, but fun. Nice views. Practice/Putting greens were adequate. Not sure what's up with the driving range though. Don't know how expensive range balls are for golf courses, but those puff balls we hit seemed pretty useless. Didn't feel like golf balls and I split three of them. Never used the range again. Lots of amenities off the resort, but nearby. We would probably play their golf course again on our next visit to Arizona, but whether on not we'd stay in their hotel is a toss up.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay:)”
Reviews.Author: Bjbbowers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Camelback building which overlooks the water park. It was very close to swimming pools, waterpark and lobby and resturants. The Resort is at the base of South Mountain, We enjoyed hiking the trails daily. Highly Recommend eating at Rustlers Roost (With-in the Resort) The Fitness Center was Amazing! Ask for Dan if you have a massage...He is wonderful. Never have to leave the resort. We enjoyed the waterpark with the Lazy River. The beds were very comfortable. Most rooms have a patio. The Golf course was very beautiful and fun to play. My 21 year old daughter and her friend came along and loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “This resort makes you feel like your in a fairy tale!”
Reviews.Author: mitchy282
Reviews.Content: Me and my Fiancee just stayed 3 amazing nights at your hotel and I gotta say this place is amazing!! We have never been anywhere where they treat you like pure royalty than this place, The staff is amazing they make you feel like your at home especially the people in the Market place in the Lobby. We just loved our stay all around the property is beautiful! We enjoyed margaritas from the lobby sports bar and brought them outside by the fire pit at night which was great! The Bartender in the lobby sports bar made the best margaritas I think I have ever had in my life with fresh fruit and everything! Our room was spacious and beautiful the beds were so comfy I didn't wanna get out of bed in the morning. We dined in every restaurant on the property and I gotta say they were all delicious!!! Rustlers Rooste was a true treat we had a window seat watching the sunset eating dinner it was really priceless! Aunt Chilada's was also amazing!! The bellman are fantastic they will golf cart you anywhere on the property and treat you like you are everything. We also went to the Oasis water park where we had a blasttt!! Enjoyed the Staley Performance Institute on the resort in the fitness center and worked out also in the fitness center which is awesome especially the locker rooms with everything you need and more like the eucalyptus steam room and a whirlpool tub right in the locker room wow! We also had massages at the spa on the resort the people were so....nice and we had lunch at the spa after we had our massages. Also the spa gives you free fruit and water or tea when you are waiting to go into the massage rooms. We cannot wait to go back to this place I have never ever stayed anywhere truly this amazing I must of said to my Fiancee 100 times I really cannot believe how beautiful this place is it really is a true GEM. Thanks Arizona Grand Resort we will never ever forget our stay in Phoenix for the rest of our lives and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Return; But Waterpark Slides Not as Great as Hoped”
Reviews.Author: KarriLaB
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 6 day stay and I'd highly recommend the Arizona Grand. We were on a package that provided a $100/resort credit a day which was really convenient; especially because the food and beverage at the water park were a bit overpriced (about $15 for a burger and fries) and they won't let you bring your own food/drink into the park. The rooms were very comfortable, clean and modern. We really appreciated having 2 queens in a bedroom with the sofa sleeper in the living room. Worked great for my 10 and 7 year olds because they didn't have to share a bed and we could close off part of the unit for anyone that was sleeping late. The mini bar was nice since we had a refrig. but it would be a great addition to include a microwave in the room. We enjoyed some lazy days by the resort pool outside or room and also enjoyed lots of time at the waterpark. The pool outside our room was nice because we coulde easily access our room for food or beverage that we bought at the grocery store about 1/2 mile away (it is walk-able). As a bonus, since we went in Feb, the pools and waterparks were empty! Although it was cool outside, the pools were heated nicely and the hot tub was a life saver! I only have a few complaints about the water park. First, I'm told the 2 big slides hurt! I love water parks but not once did I go on the big slides because in watching people go down, rarely did anyone go a second time. My kids usually live on water slides but they only enjoyed the 2 big ones a handful during the whole week. They loved the lazy river and wave pool. My second complaint is the lifeguards are so strict. If my son even goofed around at all in the lazy river, he was in trouble. You couldn't take a beverage in the tube and couldn't "slip in" just anywhere, even if a tube was floating by. Plus, you had to be in a tube at all times. Desipte this, we had an outstanding time and we'd definitely return. We loved the pizza in the lobby bar and had fun at the Roost cowboy bar/restaurant. The fitness center was also very nice. I also loved that the facility backed up to the Pima National Reserve. After breakfast each day, I could take a run in the reserve to burn off my meal and enjoy the outdoors. Great place; would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Could Hope For!”
Reviews.Author: jooody
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Arizona Grand Resort Feb. 22-26. It is a quick 15 min trip from the PHX Airport. The property is beautiful with fabulous fountains and lush greens. The staff was top notch. Everyone was on their game. We had a great check in experience with Tim. The valets helped us figure out how to get the top down on our convertible. Our room overlooked the private waterpark for hotel guests. I was really impressed with the guards and staff in the water park. It had just opened for the season and everyone working there seemed like they knew what they were doing. It was very clean and seemed very safe. My kids had an unbelievable adventure. The restaurant at the hotel served a great buffet. The beds were great. The housekeepers did a great job. I really enjoyed myself and would highly recommend this hotel. It was a perfectly lovely getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Grand Resort is a must for a family vacation or staycation!”
Reviews.Author: lyssalous
Reviews.Content: Its has become a family tradition to go the AZ Grand Resort each summer. Great water park and family friendly atmosphere. Clean rooms and amazing resort packages.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every way!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoeInvest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel the the night before my wedding and my bride and I the next two nights. The staff was wonderful to us and far exceeded our expectations. The Villa Suite in which we stayed was unreal...the thing must have been 700-800 square feet. Absolutely beautiful! I had a view of the first hole of the golf course and it was stunning. We also held our rehersal dinner in one of their resturants and the staff there bent over backward to insure our experience was nothing short of outstanding. I highly recommend this hotel and the ammenities that come with it! Great job everyone associated with the Arizona Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Brody Bunch annually trip to Arizona Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: Brody2011
Reviews.Content: We started visiting the Arizona Grand Resort when it was called Pointe South Mountain Resort in 2003. We are planning our trip this year which will be the 9th Anniversary of our Arizona trips. Each year just gets better and better. The water park is the best that we have ever been to in the United States and we love the staff. Our children grew up seeing the same ASU students every year at the Oasis and we still keep in touch with some who have graduated. This is a wonderful family resort and we recommend it to all of our friends with children or teens that are traveling to the Phoenix area. We love to call this our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Something for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: milesx5
Reviews.Content: My family first visited this resort when it was known as the Pointe South Mountain Resort back in April of 2006 for a wedding reception. When we saw the grounds and Oasis Water Park, we made a commitment to stay here as a family at a future time. Sure enough, we came the next year during spring break. We had a blast! Our 3 kids were in heaven at the water park. I enjoyed the adjacent South Mountain Park for my trail running. The fitness center had great equipment. My wife had a great time too, basking in the sun and reading books. A great selection of restaurants were on the property too. All the rooms are suites, so plenty of room for a family of 5 in one room. Service was excellent from the time we arrived and everything was clean. With the great experience we had, we were destined to return. The Arizona Grand Resort has now become a "must do" for our family. We have returned in spring and summer every year since 2006. Our kids are now 15/12/10 years of age and enjoy it just as much as the first time. Lazy river, here I come!

Reviews.Title: “The night we arrived I cried myself to sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Janetm53
Reviews.Content: We had planned our trip to Phoenix for months - prepaying for hotel and car on expedia.ca so that the only bills we would come back to were for food, golf and the daily resort fee of $30. We picked a beautiful looking resort, located in southern Phoenix, close to golf courses and restaurants. It looked great in the pictures and the room descriptions promised bright, sunny rooms over looking pools and the resort golf course. We arrived late at night for an 8 night stay - not the longest stay they've had, I'm sure, but not a quick weekend, either. We were led by golf cart to our building - Camelback- and we were pleased with the 2 room aspect of the suite, but then I opened the curtains! We were level with ( and could have reached out and touched from the tiny, unusable balcony) a car in the carpark and our view was a huge back door and garbage cans. I had spent weeks dreaming of sitting out on the balcony enjoying our morning cup of tea and soaking in sunshine and the surrounding vista. Not from this room! I did cry myself to sleep that night, I was so disappointed. The next morning I went to the front desk and told them this room was not at all as expected. They replied that they could give me a room higher up in the same building that overlooked the water park -for an additional $20 per day. This on top of the $30 resort fee plus extra taxes on both meant the hotel cost us more than $400 over what we had already prepaid expedia. The room was nice and clean but when families started arriving the next weekend to use the water park the noise was incredible. The televisions were old and small and there was just nothing special about the room at all. I guess after staying at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in San Diego, the Bellagio in Las Vegas and even the Peppermill in Reno - this resort just didn't impress us. I really resent being held for ransom to receive what should have been provided in the first place! We will try this area again because the golf courses are many and cheap but we will never stay at the Arizona Grand Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “A Rare Gem Tucked away in Arizona”
Reviews.Author: ggmsmolly2
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful, serene and comfortable places that we have had the good fortune to fine.

Reviews.Title: “Definately will return! Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: annette79h
Reviews.Content: We stayed labor day wknd last yr, it was our first time. We were going for a fam. vacation so the waterpark was our reason choosing AGR and we were so glad we did! The pics and description were exactly what we got. We have 3 boys (11,6 &4) and we all had a blast! The check in line was huge but it moved very quickly, and they served us samples of ice cream while we waited. Staff was friendly, informative & helpful. The room was enormous to us. The dining table had 8 chairs! Had a small kitchen, so we brought coolers of food which made it much more affordable for us to be able to go. One good TIP: run water only thru coffee pot & pour into Cup'O Noodles for a quick/cheap lunch with sandwhiches! We got an amazing deal from being a fan on Facebook!! The lazy river was our absolute favorite, only thing was alot of people took the tubes with them when they got out so there were tubes stacked up all over the park not being used, yet many had to stand in line to wait for a tube to get in the river.... Our kids still talk about how much fun it was and we will definately be going back this summer! I'll be watching for great deals on Facebook to make our reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Grand Resort - Not grand and not a resort”
Reviews.Author: bcmike1
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because Expedia recommended it. It is not a resort in the winter - its just a dated hotel with a $30 parking fee. The biggest disappointment was that there is no mention that the resort ammenities are closed in January and even at check-in, we were told that the fee included the water park! There are many excellent hotels with excellent staff in the Phoenix area. Please don't get fooled like me into thinking this is one of them. The staff had no interest in my issues, nor did they reply to my emails.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn with a Golf Course”
Reviews.Author: DisatisfiedwithGA
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended by a colleague. Maybe the building I was in is a bit outdated but the room layout is like the rooms found in the Holiday Inn with weak mattresses, the bathroom sinks outside the bathrooms, and AC units turned off (possibly to conserve energy?) with the outside temperatures in the high 70's allowing the stale air in the room to smell like the carpet is drenched in urine. The room was not as cleaned as I expected for this "Grand" resort for the nightly cost. I would not buy into this place as a timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful tropical desert oasis with quiet rooms, shielded from loud outside freeway noise.”
Reviews.Author: sabrinagant
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful tropical oasis in the desert of South Mountain with hiking trails, as well as paths to a very unique steak restaurant with extraordinary views and a fun south-of- the-border style restaurant Ideally located near US-60 and the I-10 freeway, however the busy freeway traffic gives bad air quality and noise pollution to the visual tranquility of the hotel grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't meet up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: jo28352
Reviews.Content: Having visited many resorts solo, with family and with friends, I was very disappointed with the Arizona Grand Resort. The resort doesn't live up to it's hype. Room service food was very poor quality. Rooms were merely average. Waterpark/pool area was small for the large number of guests. Despite waiting hours for a chair, I had to sit near the pool bar while my daughter played, as there were no chairs availalble. The bulk of them were being "held" by guests via pool towels, with guests no where to be found. As my family enjoys being outside near the water and visited Arizona specifically for the sunshine, not being able to enjoy the pool area was a deal breaker for me. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “This place isn't right”
Reviews.Author: sfimporter
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Phoenix on business and the Arizona Grand was one of the corporate choices. Now don't get me wrong. The place is clean, the people are friendly, and the rate is good. But the buildings are just set up strangely. The entrances to the rooms are a bit motel like - but the front doors to the rooms all face courtyards with pools or fountains - and the balconies at the other end all face out on parking lots and freeways (for the most part). It will literally drive you insane trying to navigate the resort as the footpaths tend to dead end at the various complexes, while the roads for cars seem to get you where you need to go quicker. The standard rooms are billed as suites, which they are - but only at the sacrifice of any room in the bathrooms (which are so small, the sinks are placed in the bedroom area). Beware of your room rate, there is a resort fee added on top (which is completely acceptable, but it doesn't include internet, which is an additional $15/day per device. So you can't use the same wifi access with your phone as the one you are using for your laptop.). I think this resort probably works best for families (as I'm sitting in my room listening to a monster session of Marco Polo in the pool). Parents probably like the resort feel, while the kids can probably spend all day at the attached mini-water park when it's open in-season). The mini-bar is stocked with beer, soda and Pringle's, but little else. Good for some, just not the right demographic for myself. On the bright side, the gym is awesome and the golf course looks nice.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive with no extras”
Reviews.Author: lavau610
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice but you could hear everything in the courtyard and parking lot. Everything additional to the accomodations cost a fee.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing lacking, great views and great service.”
Reviews.Author: TexasKatdaddy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at the Resort. I am confused about the review right before mine which mentions that the water park is too crowded because the water park is not even open right now. It reopens in February per the signs posted. Anyway, it is close to the airport, you can take their suggested car service, a sedan, for $25 each way which if you have more than 1 person it is not a bad deal. The check in was very easy, they will take you to your room in a golf cart and set you up, of course tipping is expected. I stayed in the Camelback suites, with a king bed. The room was nice, I would've liked to see flat screens in the rooms but everything else was nice. The property is a little older and not pristine but I paid $138/night and got free wifi and parking as part of our conference deal. The food was good, they serve Starbucks coffee with pastries and great Gelato in the gift shop/pro shop which is right off the lobby. The staff in the restaurant are very friendly, and brought out my desert to the fire pit at night which I thought was great. There are areas for groups to congregate out by the fire pits which is nice. I didn't play golf but the course looked nice. There is a large outlet type mall across the road and they will shuttle you there for free throughout the day. There are some nice hiking/biking trails right off the resort, not too tough but do remember to wear your hiking shoes/tennis shoes. All in all, a very nice place, I would like to return with my son and husband and enjoy the water park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms in the Camelback”
Reviews.Author: Up_North09
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Phoenix our family stayed at the Arizona Grand Resort. We knew that the water park was closed so that was not a surprise and it was too cold out anyway. We had two rooms in the Camelback building. Each was a suite which was a nice surprise and gave us plenty of room. Check in was easy and the staff escorts you to your room. The staff member who brought us to our room, answered many questions and brought us information from the concierge desk. He did a great job welcoming us to the hotel. I wish I could remember his name, but all I remember was that he was originally from Wisconsin. We had booked this resort through an airline package so I was not sure if we would have to pay the extra $30.00 per room for the resort fee, but on check out we had to. This was quite disappointing. The two pools and hot tubs in the Camelback building were wonderful. My only complaint with the pool is the patrons who save a chair and come back 2 hours later. A family of 4 did this and all of the people at the pool were struggling to find a chair with sun and here are 4 chairs with no one around. Another plus are the hiking trails around the property.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven for families.”
Reviews.Author: Justagirlvisiting
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort this holiday seaon and had a blast. The weather was beautiful and the resort had everything you could ever want. The spa was great for the girls and the golf was perfect for the boys. Service was very kind, remembered our names daily and always offered assistance. Overall, a great value and highly recommend this place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience combined with great golf.”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoastgolf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this resort to golf at this property as well as others in the area. Great location near tons of courses and easily accessible highways. Fun course and the service was perfect all the way from the proshop to the front desk. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular service with great views.”
Reviews.Author: Neverstopgolf
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently visited this hotel for a reunion and were so impressed with the high end service, wonderful amenities and perfect room. It made our trip so enjoyable and the employees were so friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Luxuriously-Affordable”
Reviews.Author: caacbry
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the resort and each time we are extremely impressed. The most spectacular treatment begins the moment that you arrive at this impeccably clean and beautiful resort with the most wonderful, friendly and courteous service that you could imagine. We were here because of the Nike Championship Basketball Tournament, but we may as well have been the Phoenix Suns basketball team because they seemed to know our names wherever we went throughout the resort. Attendants were eager to help carry the smallest bag or give you rides on the mobile carts, and ask if you have visited all of their amenities or offer their suggestions for fun near the resort. They genuinely were interested in our having a great time. The business center was an excellent experience this year thanks to the superb customer service of the attendant I was able to get some time sensitive documents for work. Our basketball team was so impressed with the conference center and water fountain that appeared to be out of a movie set. Finally I travel about 70% of the time in my professional career. This would be my favorite place. I look forward to coming here in the summer to really check out all of their fantastic amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if they can only put you in the "M" units.”
Reviews.Author: littlemama3
Reviews.Content: This is my third consecutive year staying at this hotel for an area Girls Basketball Tournament. Thank god I won't have to attend next year, or anytime ever again. As part of the $52 million dollar renovation, units were built right up against the freeway. Why on earth they did this is beyond me. All other buildings look out over pools, the golf course, mountains, etc., but this building looks out at the freeway, and is so close that I can visually identify the type of cars driving by. AND, while sitting in the living room of my unit, with the blinds/door closed, I can tell the difference between a truck, motorcylce, car, etc. driving by, just by the sound which is ever so clear ALL NIGHT LONG. I cannot believe they have the audacity to place paying guests in these units. Of course, when I requested a room change, that was impossible because the "hotel is completely sold out due to the tournament." Which takes me back to my original point.......Why even build these units this close to the freeway in the first place? If you have to stay at the Arizona Grand Resort, don't let them place you all the way out in a "M" unit.......you will never, ever sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference center”
Reviews.Author: kvealg8r
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Arizona Grand Resort while on a business trip. While arranging my travel accommodations, the reservation department was very helpful in giving me the contact information for a car service, AAA Sedan, from the airport to the hotel (cost of $25 one way). However, when I booked the car through the resort website, the car service never received my reservation. Fortunately it was not a problem and the car was at the airport to pick me up within 15 minutes. Upon arrival, check in was easy, and a bellman drove me in a golf cart to my room in the Camelback Suites. The room was comfortable, with a separate living room area with a desk, great for working on a business trip. The decor and fixtures in the room were a bit dated though. I was also disappointed that I was denied a cart ride to one of the nearby restaurants one morning due to the volume of customers checking out. It wasn't a bad walk, but I was not familiar with the area and needed assistance getting to where I needed to go. The concierge was able to help me with directions. The food in the lobby lounge was good but a bit overpriced. Though I believe all prices in Phoenix are higher than other areas of the country. Room service food was also very good and timely delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeanutsOrPretzels
Reviews.Content: Just got back home tonight from a long weekend here. The first appeal is its proximity to the airport. The second is the stunningly beautiful entrance. The third is that we never encountered an unpleasant employee. We booked a villa for $239/night and were fortunate enough to get a third story room on the 1st tee box. Beautiful! Had a corner room and the view was gorgeous (villa V302). Had a light supper at the bar that was very good. I ordered a red wine that clearly was opened a day or so earlier. I brought it to the attention of our server and she couldn't have been nicer. She immediately told the bartender who opened a new bottle. In short, I'm not sure how our stay would have been if we didn't have a room with such a great view. However, rating our stay, it was a remarkable bargain for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisjc11
Reviews.Content: Had a very good suite. The resort is so convenient for travellers into Sky Harbour as it is an easy 15 minutes drive. The staff are all excellent - very friendly and helpful. We ate at both Aunt Chiladas and the Rustlers Rooste. The food was very good and the bonus was that whilst they are in the resort, they are separate so it is more like eating in a local restaurant rather than a large hotel. The golf course was a good test and fun to play, and we wished our schedule allowed us to play it more than once. Would thoroughly recommend it and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good value but beware of add on fees”
Reviews.Author: PNWtraveler1
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Arizona Grand. As another reviewer said, it is nice but not of the caliber of some of the other hotels in the Preferred Group. We had a package which included a $100 resort credit. The room rate was quite reasonable and we used the $100 for meals. Beware that there is a $30 resort fee which does not include Internet. Internet is approximately $15 per day and there is no free wi-Fi anywhere on site. (Most places at least have it in the lobby if you don't want to pay to have it in your room). The $100 per night credit is use it or lose it per day, i.e. you don't get to carry it over to the next day if you don't use it up on the preceding day. If you can get a good room rate, this is a convenient location. The Oasis water park is very nice but not open at this time of year (which we knew ahead of time). Other pools were open. The resort was uncrowded when we were there and the restaurant was understaffed at times.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: goohiostate
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Arizona Grand Resort with my wife who had a conference there. We arrived at the resort a few hours ahead of the check-in time, but we were able to get a room upon our arrival. That room had some issues and we were immediately upgraded to a villa room, which was greatly appreciated! I would have been disappointed if we weren't provided with an upgrade given the issues -- the upgrade shows that the resort cares about the guests. Our villa room had an amazing view of the golf course and waterfall area (slept with our balcony door open every night to hear the water) -- it was also very nicely decorated, had a refrigerator and microwave, and a very comfortable bed. I recommend buying some groceries at the Fry's less than .5 miles away on Baseline (not the one across from the resort as that is a Fry's Electronic store). We heard about some issues others had with "standard" rooms, but again, the villa room was exceptional! We liked the villa room so much that I researched the cost of purchasing one -- about 70% of them are already sold including, unfortunately, the one we stayed at. The early check-in provided us with an opportunity to use the waterpark -- we certainly enjoyed it!! It was only open for that day (Saturday) during our stay. I don't understand why it couldn't have been opened on Sunday too, but we weren't expecting it to be opened at all so at least we had a few nice hours there. The water park was a very nice amenity for the resort guests -- we are already thinking about returning when it is open more. I like the fact that it is only open for resort guests! The other amazing aspect of this resort was the fitness facility -- the best I have ever seen at a resort. It easily compares to any private workout facility out there. Shooting baskets was a nice break. I wanted to use other aspects, but decided to be lazy instead. We didn't use the spa so I cannot comment on that area. We also enjoyed the fire pit areas outside of the main lobby -- very nice section to relax at. We have stayed at some other resorts in the Phoenix area (e.g., Camelback Inn) and the Arizona Grand Resort, with a villa room, certainly compares favorably to the others. The only area of improvement would be to have some floats available to use at the pool areas. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice restaurants, comfortable room, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JanRae22
Reviews.Content: We were in Phoenix for a family wedding and had stayed at the resort twice before so decided to return because we had a good experience during previous stays. Unfortunately the water park was closed but we still enjoyed our stay: the swimming pool, the Arizona Mills mall a mile away, and the three on-site restaurants we went to. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Overall it was a wonderful fall get-away.

Reviews.Title: “More than happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: kc-bug
Reviews.Content: We were here as part of a large conference. The hotel staff went out of their way to be fast, efficient, and friendly. They could break down a room faster than any group I've seen. Their food service group needs a little work, though. Big groups were a problem and they had trouble keeping buffet lines filled, etc. The resort is beautiful. The water park is fun, and there are multiple pools on the property. Things are a little spread out, but the walk is easy and the layout makes sense once you've been here a day or so. There are plenty of conference breakout areas. We were originally scheduled to be in the Moutainside Villas, but requested a change to Sedona as it was closer to the conference center. They made the change quickly and were very friendly about doing so. When we signed up for the conference, we thought the price was a little high, but we were pleased with where we stayed. Housekeeping staff were great and also friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel; nice facilities and great service”
Reviews.Author: Miusa
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my three night stay at this hotel very much. I visited here as part of business meeting but I enjoyed the facilities, food and service. It is located less than 15 minutes from the airport and about 20 minutes from downtown Phoenix. Public facilities are terrific, loved the main lobby, the grounds, and the pool areas. The waterpark was not open on the days I stayed to my disappointment. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. The bed was terrific and wifi worked very well. The TV's are a little dated but overall I loved the room. The staff was friendly and helpful. My only complaint is that when you check in instead of giving you a map to your room they make you go to the bellhop to get directions and a map. I was driving, didn't need help with my bad but felt obligated to give the bell captain a tip for directions and a map that would have been more conveniently provided by the front-desk.

Reviews.Title: “Still worn out after all these years”
Reviews.Author: Consultant2468
Reviews.Content: This is the former Hilton and then Pointe South Mountain, etc. They have made some renovations but they are primarily surface. The rooms are still worn and although suites, dark and in need of upgrade. Interestingly, they are now part of Preferred Hotels which has many fine properties throughout the world. I will be surprised if Preferred allows them to stay part of their program for long. For the details: 1. Banquet food - lunch food average, very plentiful, service good; dinner food below average, service good, atmosphere poor 2. Access - very good - close to airport, easy in and out. Resort lobby and registration not convenient to the rooms - true hassle to have to travel there to get your morning bill when checking out. 3. Room service - food, below average; service poor; no ice brought with soft drinks - server said, "oh, I guess I could go to the ice machine for you." Room service is comparable to a cut-rate Holiday Inn, not the type of hotel this place wants to be. 4. Price and value - OK if you are with a group; overpriced as an individual - you can do much better elsewhere in the valley. Their group fare includes gratuity for housekeeping but NOT for the bell service -- and this resort is spread out all over so you end up calling for golf cart service many times because it is too far to walk Restaurants - only two - one is mediocre Mexican and the other over-priced steak and ribs All in all, I would not come here again unless I had to because of a meeting. There are so many many better choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the whole family.”
Reviews.Author: Koko7474
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. The water park is great if you have kids. Worth the money. Lots of places to eat near by.

Reviews.Title: “A real hidden gem so close to ASU campus access to freeways”
Reviews.Author: unclebambi
Reviews.Content: We went over for our daughters graduation and decided to look for a 4 or 5 star resort closer to campus and where she is living. We were offered to upgrade to a new Villa and after taking a look, we did. It was amazing. Facing the golf course, ponds and waterfalls, and yet close to the water park. It was right next to the freeway and baseline road but you couldn't hear a sound due to the surrounding hills and golf course. We had been staying up at Camelback area the last few visits at great resorts but this was a fraction of the cost and the Villa's are as good as any other 5 star we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “**Great Weekend**”
Reviews.Author: bearx3
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room at the AZ Grand Resort Oct 2-3 for my daughters 13th Bday, it was the last weekend the waterpark was opened. We had her cousins come join us at the waterpark Sat & Sun, the resort gave us 2 complimentary passes to the park, I'm still sore from the slides, we played pool bball/volleyball, wave pool, lazy river, had a super time. The waterpark was the highlight. Staff was great & attentive. The carpet in the rooms were dirty & the pull out sofa bed was so uncomfortable, small patios. Took the 2 bartenders forever to take our order when the sports bar was practically empty. We were disappointed the bfast buffet the resort promised was not going that weekend in the Lobby Grill instead they had their regular breakfast menu which was pretty good & reasonable kids prices nice size portions. RUSTLER'S ROOSE is a must, we all had a blast, great food their ribs rock! Awesome view of the valley, we had the best waiter "Bobby" the kids loved him. Overall my daughter had a great & memorable 13th Bday!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: kathleen040nj
Reviews.Content: Absolutely LOVED the Arizona Grand! The room was beautiful and clean. The only things I noticed was that the safe was not left open and there was no remote for the tv in the bedroom. That didn't bother us at all......we never even turned the tv on! The grounds are beautiful and the balcony off the bedroom was great! We too were disappointed that the waterpark closed at 4pm. We did enjoy the adult pool but again noticed there was no one to make sure that kids weren't in it. The location of theArizona Grand is so convenient. I have a tough time with directions but the resort made sure I had good ones. The check in was easy and pleasant. It was our first trip to Arizona and I hope to make it back there someday!!! I hope to go at a different time of year....September in AZ is HOTTTTT! All in all a great experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun get away with lots to do for the kids”
Reviews.Author: lwmtucson
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a fun weekend getaway (we live in Tucson) and friends suggested the Arizona Grand Resort. What a great place. Outstanding water park, golf, spa, comfortable and clean rooms, great service, delicious food! We will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: chocobot
Reviews.Content: My husband and 6 year old daughter went August 18 - 22, 2010. Ahead of time, we received an email from the hotel that had some information for us, including how to order a car from the airport. It was $25, which we paid in cash to the driver. The grounds were beautiful. Check-in was smooth and efficient and they golf-carted us over to our building in Camelback. If you're interested in the waterpark, stay in Camelback. It's much closer. Our room was clean and spacious and overlooked the waterpark. The one problem that we had in the room was that the drain in the bathtub was slow. We called guest services about it then went to dinner; it was fixed by the time we got back. If you have small kids, I would recommend going during the week. We arrived on a Wednesday and the waterpark was relatively empty and tame. Friday and Saturday were a completely different story! It was still fun but with a lot more young adults running around doing the things that young adults do. Not a prude at all but it was a little bit of a task to keep my first grader from gawking at the random folks making out in bathing suits. Just something for the parents to keep in mind if you're going over a weekend. Also, if you go during the summer off-season, keep in mind that not all of the attractions are open all the time. Because of the limited number of lifeguards, they alternate when the slides and the lazy river are open during the week. On the weekends, they had both open. The food was decent. Aunt Chilada's was above average Mexican food. Rustler's Roost was fun! Do take the shuttle up there, though. It's at the top of the hill and kind of a hike in the heat. For the trips on the property, the carts/shuttles work on tips. Room service was actually reasonable and pretty delicious. We ordered a pizza dinner the first night and it was very, very good and very reasonbly priced. Overall, we had a great time and will be going back again for another 4 days next summer!

Reviews.Title: “I've never had such a woderful nights rest in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sharpei70
Reviews.Content: This mini vacation for my family from 3 states, was just wonderful. Staff treated us like royality and I've never slept in a more comfortable bed. I wasted half the day sleeping until 9:45 Sunday morning!! Our dining experience was great. Super buffet. Resturant personel were delightful. Desk staff and bell boys were great also. The views were niceas well as the waterpark was a blast. Grounds were very well kept and so quiet. The only issue that was a sour note; the SUV driver had very high rates for a 6 mile ride. I would love to stay again. Thank you for a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtdb2010
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. We were treated like VIP threw our whole stay! When I arrived I was pleasantly surprised when I saw this hotel. The room was so clean and had obviously been newly modeled. The breakfast was great. We loved the food and the view was so nice. I went to the spa and it was so relaxing. We then went to the water park and had a blast with our kids. I really loved this hotel the staff was so accommodating. I would definitely recommend this place to my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the fees!”
Reviews.Author: vertresd
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this resort over Labor Day weekend. While the rooms and the resort itself were great, albeit a bit crowded, we will not be returning due to the excessive fees. If you require a $30/night resort fee, internet usage should not cost an additional $14.99 per day. That is easily one of the biggest ripoffs that I have ever encountered in all of my years of travel. Ridiculous. On a more positive note, I can't recommend Rustler's Rooste restaurant enough. The food was great, and the views of the entire valley can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very memorable 13th Birthday for my daugher”
Reviews.Author: FionnD
Reviews.Content: We booked the great summer rates of $99 for my daughter and her friends to stay at the Resort. At that rate I could book two suites and let her have her own with her friends to feel more grown up. We visited the SPA and the waterpark. She felt like a princess and weather mid September was simply beautifull. The staff were wonderful, professional and friendly. She will never forget her 13th birthday thank you Arizona Grand. The suites are huge very comfortable although I feel sorry for the poor cleaner who had to clean my daugher's room after she and her friends were done...!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingAndCheep
Reviews.Content: A bit crowded for me on Labor Day Great Room, Size, Cleanliness, accomodations and staff (cleaning) (front desk) etc. Waterpark was too over populated for me but the pool closer to my room was a good concelation prize but Im easy! Had a great get together with friends a small party in my room and I was as happy as a pig in mud. We also made alot of noise in my opinion but no one complained the neighbors or security it was awsome! Thanks alot everyone and thank you for the extra bracelet passes to the water park we didnt use them all but it was great not to haggle or beg for more of them. Thanks Arizona Grand Resort we will be back again! Oh and the only thing I would suggest if you can cater is too work on making the Resort fee of $30 or so dollars even less. Great job you all and Happy Holidays if I dont make it back this year!

Reviews.Title: “The Arizona Grand Resort is FANTASTIC for both business and pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: jschulte
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Arizona Grand Resort in Phoenix, AZ with my family. We spent the "very busy" Labor Day weekend in one of their new Villa rooms - which was like staying in a small home with the full kitchen, granite countertops, big screen Televisions, oversize bathrooms with showers and large tubs - we were in heaven! The grounds were lush and green even though the weather was a tad warm - at 105 degrees! We spent many fabulous hours at the Oasis Water Park enjoying the water slides or floating in the wave pool! Saturday night we thoroughly enjoyed a GREAT Theme'd Restaurant on the property - but managed separately called RUSTLER'S ROOSTE! It's a country western Restaurant with a slide into the restaurant, hay on the ground, roving magicians, balloon art folks and a live Country Western Band! On Sunday we even enjoyed The DIVE IN Movie at Oasis Waterpark and floated in the pool while enjoying "Monters vs. Aliens" - much to my children's enjoyment!! Service levels and room accomodations both exceeded our expectations! I looked at their meeting and function space and would recommend both leisure and business travel to this great resort! Steve and Jean Schulte and family Corona, CA

Reviews.Title: “This place was amazing for our family of 3 (son is 18 months).”
Reviews.Author: jhills3
Reviews.Content: We love Arizona Grand. The location is great, and there is lots to keep you busy with the multiple pools, places to eat, and waterpark all right on site. Then if you want to go off site, there is a great mall only blocks away, with many more restaurants in the area as well. We have stayed there twice, and had great service both times. We LOVE the Rustlers Roost, it has a great view, and wonderful food, with a very fun atmosphere. We also are a family of allergies, and the restaurants were very accomodating. We will for sure be back for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Expereince on a Holiday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Phxgrl
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay here Sept. 5, 2010. Yes, we expected it to be busy with the Labor Day weekend but it was completely crazy. 30 minute wait to check in at 3:30 pm. Room wasn't ready until 7:00 pm. We went for the Oasis Water Park but my husband summed it up best that is was so crowded it was like being at a public pool. Tubes were hard to get for the lazy river (which was the only way you could go on it). River and slide shut down for 30 minutes to chlorinate because there was clearly an overload of people. Wave pool very tame. We thought the Island Buffet sounded like a good value for $15/adults, $9 kid. Not a good value when you can only go through the line once and you're trying to decide what to fit on your plate not knowing what will taste good and what won't. Our room ended up being in the mountainside cluster and was right next to the freeway and had no view of anything. The pool for that cluster was tinier than our play pool at home and again, way too crowded even at 9 pm at night. This resort was a huge disappointment.
