Very kid friendly--nice for families, although the "adult pool" was never monitored and there were tons of kids there, but it was spring break. My only reason for not giving 5 stars would be that the hot water seemed to take forever to make it to our room (sonoma 311). About 10 minutes into a lukewarm shower the water did finally get hot. Other than that it was a great stay. I would definitely go back. I wouldn't recommend Rustler's Roost--it was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip to AZ”
Reviews.Author: mpkoby
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from AZ where we stayed at the AZ Grand. My parents meet us there and stayed a few rooms down. Overall I thought the resort was very nice and we all enjoyed ourselves. I probably don't have much new to add but will provide my two cents. The resort is big and spread out but I didn't consider it a big deal. The weather is great and I personally enjoyed walking around and what's wrong with a little exercise. The resort is right in the middle of town but I never noticed it while in the resort and when we ventered out is was nice to be close to things. The resturant situation on the resort is very limited. We had a car so we didn't eat at the resort for any meals. If you didn't have a car and had to eat here every meal I could see that being an issue. The waterpark was great. We would spend most of the day there then go back to the quite pool by our room. This is definetly a great place for kids. My dad an I played golf at the resort twice and finished in 3 1/2 hours both times. We found the course to be challenging with great views. A hint on this. You can book your tee times online at one of the discount golf sites for half what they will charge you if you book through the pro shop. I think it was like $100 a round through the pro shop and we paid $59. Construction was going on right outside our room which was pretty annoying but it looked to be about done so it shouldn't be an issue much longer. They waived our $30 facility fee due to being woken up early each morning. The resort was pretty empty so I'm not sure why they didn't just put us somewhere else. Anyway, it wasn't that big a deal. The new Villas looked really nice and when we go back we will probably look to book one of those. The access to South Mountain park was very cool and we went hiking each morning. One other suggestion. You can rent a car from Enteprise (I think it may have been National) at the resort and its much cheaper this way as you don't pay all the airport fees. They will bring it to you and you drop it off there so you never have to leave the resort to get it. All said I would stay here again if we go back to AZ which we likely will until we move back to the States from Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good Value, Fun Golf Course, Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: latertk
Reviews.Content: The place is great but for the lack of a decent, reasonable place to eat on site. You will need a rent car to get off the property to go eat. The golf is fun but don't plan on renting clubs to play. Their best set is 10 years old and looks like they have been dragged behind the cart. Fun place for the kids, rooms are very nice, staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “You Will NEVER Want To LEAVE!”
Reviews.Author: sunandfun2
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this destination! The staff is very friendly and the service is excellent. The grounds are impeccable. The rooms are kept neat and very clean. Extremely well maintained. Great fitness center, spa, food and wonderful golf course! Several pools to choose from in addition to a water park! Minutes from downtown Phoenix and Scottsdale for shopping and nightlife. Looking forward to our return stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, but manage your expectations”
Reviews.Author: bayberrie
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews on this hotel - both positve and negative - I got a little nervous. I was familiar with the property when it was the Pointe at South Mountain, although my memory was very dated and vague (15+ years). We tried to get our pre-paid money back but were unsuccessful. My husband spoke with the Manager, several times, who assured us he would look out for us. When we arrived we were cheerfully greeted by everyone- the bell hops/car valets, the front desk and the Manager on Duty. We were given a room that was in the recently completed Villas. It was marvelous (and my standards are high). Brand new, spacious, beautiful kitchen, HUGE bathroom, lovely bedroom, patio overlooking the water park, and living area with sleeping couch for my son. Everything was in mint condition. Even new flat screen TVs. The water park is marvelous and our 11 year old son was happy to be there most of the day. Adults can get aways from the craziness at the water park (I mean, people running for pool chairs? Come on!) by hanging out at the Spa pool and I saw another Adults Only pool in a seperate location. The location right next to South Mountain park made me happy because I was able to get my morning hikes in on a very different terrain. The Gym/Spa were large and had plenty of equipment. Only ate breakfast on property twice - both times the food was only adequate. Otherwise we did not eat on property. The golf seemed OK - the golf staff was marvelous. There were no tennis courts which was disappointing because the website listed 10 tennis courts. I had a massage which was done quite well and reasonably priced. I agree with other reviewers that the property is large - if you are staying away from the water park entrance or the Phantom Horse Grill and Gym/Spa area then you do have a walk. We were conveniently and centrally located in front of the park and beside the gym. In terms of managing expectations - the overall property location is lousy (except for aforementioned South Mountain Park). It is right on the I-10 highway, and in the middle of strip mall heaven. Its about a 20+ minute drive to Scottsdale. On the upside, it's 2 miles from Tempe Diablo Stadium, and we did have Angels Spring Training tix!. Also, there is not much "plush" or luxurious about the property. The spa is adequate but not luxurious. What little spa amenities there are, are cheesy (e.g., generic brand baby powder, no shower gel in the showers, no lotion....). The food we had was sub-average, the landscaping is so-so, and the overall ambience is very "mall-like". But, again, we had a great room at a good value. Having the kitchen helped a lot with saving money on breakfast and snacks. There was construction still going on. It looked like they were putting the finishing touches on the new lobby/restaurant/golf club. It should be very nice when completed. It looked close to being done when we were there in late March 2009. Finally, the staff was very cheerful and friendly. Every last one of the people I interacted with was helpful and seemed to be pleased to be serving the Guests. I even saw the maid inside the shower stall spraying it to make sure it was totally clean. I highly recommend the Villas!

Reviews.Title: “Vast Resort Complex with plenty of Activities for the Family”
Reviews.Author: monyman
Reviews.Content: Went with my 2 teenage kids and wife for 4 nights during Spring Break. I've used Trip Advisor in the past and want to give back so I hope you find this review helpful. This course is pretty tough - bring a lot of balls if you're anything more than a 20 handicap. The greens were ridiculously slow and really took away from our enjoyment of the course. I paid $200 for my 13 year old and myself which is steep. The course offers good variety and blends between links and desert style. It's also very close to the freeway on a few holes which is a bit distracting and noisy. We started our round and did not see a single beverage cart until the 17th hole which was a real bummer. Go figure! Prices are standard for Resorts where you are pretty captive. You really need a car to get to anything off resort unless you want to dare the 6 lane higways and massive intersections to get to 'Claim Jumper' or 'Joes Crab Shack' down Baseline. The service was very spotty. Most servers were fairly content just doing what they were told and nothing more. The rooms were very clean and spacious with balconies. One drawback for us was proximity to construction of the new lobby which is 'supposed' to be complete on 4/9/2009. We never tried to change rooms because it wasn't really a distraction except when going to the main lobby through some of the construction area which was a bit of a hassle and not something you want to endure on vacation at a resort. The construction workers were exceptionally cordial as you passed by which made the inconvenience less unpleasant. The gym was outstanding - probably the best part was the many classes offered throughout the day. There's also a great lap pool at the gym. Each complex also has its own pool and jacuzzi which gives you the chance to really get away if you want some quiet. The Oasis Water Park was great and offers all sorts of activities from the lazy river to basketball/volleyball to dive in movies during the evening. 'The biggest drawback here was the service (it was just about impossible to get anyone to help us and worked best to just get it yourself) and most of the 'lifeguards' who are predominantly Asian transplants and exceptionally subdued. At one point, I went down one of the waterslides and lost my magnetic bracelet (a personal item). I asked the lifeguard if he saw a bracelet come down - he said 'there's nothing check the front desk'. It was bizarre to say the least. When I tried to engage him, it was clear he had little grasp of english and even less interest in helping me so I gave up. The lifeguards appear to be on duty to police the activity in the lazy river making sure everyone has an inner tube as required by lazy river law. This seemed to be their mission and they were quite dour with a few exceptions. Blech! I would say the service at the Oasis water park was the worst part of the trip but the water park itself was exceptional! We stayed 4 nights. Per night we paid $239 + $30 taxes + $30 'Resort Fee' which is for the wi-fi cloud hanging over the resort (very very slow and sometimes hard to use), the USA Today paper, the water park and minor amenities. Late breaking news... We requested late check-out due to a late flight and were refused. Very tacky!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: MurpAZ
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Grand is a great affordable resort for locals to go to getaway when they don't necessarily want to leave the valley. You can bounce from the pool, wave pool, water slides, lounge in the lazy river, or have a server bring you a drink while you lounge in your chair. If you enjoy golf I have heard the golf course is great. You can even work out at the health club. We even floated in the pool at night and watched a movie. They called it a "dive in movie". My kids loved it. We ordered food, watched the movie and ate. They were so tired by the end of the night, we went back to the room and they went to sleep to start over the next day!! We will definitely be back to enjoy a long weekend again!!If you haven't stayed here try it out!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot complain one iota about this wonderful place!!”
Reviews.Author: gostanford19
Reviews.Content: We are actually still at the resort right now, but I felt compelled to write a review after reading some of the negative ones before we came. We are a family of four with two teenage boys and have had the BEST experience at the Arizona Grand. From the minute we arrived, the service has been nothing less than outstanding, the rooms are perfect for a family of four, and the pool and grounds are beautiful! We have pretty high standards, having traveled around the world, and the Arizona Grand seems to have something for everyone. Golf, hiking, swimming, exercise, etc. The Spa is outstanding, and the hiking on the South Mountain is wonderful. The only thing even remotely not outstanding would be the restaurants nearby, but they are 'fine'. It is NOT a far walk from one end of the resort to the other, despite what some other reviewers might think. We will DEFINITELY come here again!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time in a great place”
Reviews.Author: 4adventuregirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our 11 year old daughter and another couple with a daughter the same age and we all agree...it was a wonderful place to stay. We thought our adjoining suites worked out great and loved the fact that the pool was right outside our door. We spent alot of time at the Oasis and our girls thought the park offered plenty for them to do. We hiked, rode horses, and did some activities outside the resort as well. We would have appreciated the following things: a fridge that wasn't filled with mini-bar items so we could easily store our own things, a microwave, and windows that opened so we could enjoy the beautiful weather. We ate at Phantom Horse, Aunt Chiladas, Rustlers Rooste, the Oasis, the lobby food, and room service. I would have liked more afordable, better variety kid food (they get tired of chicken fingers, corn dogs etc.) The concierge, Martha, was very helpful and we found it was easy to connect with activities. Loved the dive-in movies and magic show!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service - Mgmt was better as The Pointe”
Reviews.Author: TAC121972
Reviews.Content: This resort used to be dedicated to luxury at a reasonable price with great service. Since their change to "Arizona Grand" the quality overall has deteriorated, the service is terrible and the management is pathetic.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort & water park.”
Reviews.Author: kblank12
Reviews.Content: My husband & 18-month old son & I spent 5 nights at the Grand the first week of March 2009. I would definitely recommend the resort and I think it deserves 4 stars. ATMOSPHERE: The grounds are beautiful with lots of flowers, greenery and fountains everywhere, also outdoor fireplaces & chimineas (sp?). The buildings are laid out nicely around courtyards and each area has its own smaller pool & hot tub in addition to the water park (we stayed in the "Camelback" rooms which are right by the water park, which makes it easy if you have small children). OUR ROOM: The room was very nicely decorated (they have graciously resisted the ubiquitous turquoise & mauve "desert southwest/pueblo" decor in favor of soft beiges, golds & whites). All the furnishings, finishes & fixtures (paint, wallpaper, carpet, plumbing, etc.) looked new and fresh and updated. The bed was very comfortable and the towels were nice and thick. There was a nice patio on the back with french doors where my son could run around and play. The soundproofing seems good, we did not ever hear our neighbors. You park fairly close to your room which is convenient. All rooms open to the outside, but don't let that make you think it is not a nice place, it is. WATER PARK: Good-sized with a large wade-in wave pool, volleyball/basketball pool, kiddie pool with fountain play area, very large hot tub, lazy river and 3 water slides. STAFF: In every encounter we had w/staff , they were friendly and helpful, from the bellhops to the concierge to the wait staff and housekeeping. FOOD: A little overpriced, but that is expected at a resort property. The water park food I would say was "OK", as was Aunt Chilada's (but I live in Dallas where there is an abundance of outstanding tex-mex). The Phantom Horse Grill was excellent every time with a very nice atmosphere inside and out, including a nice roomy deck with torches & firepits. Rustler's Rooste had probably the best steak we've ever had and fabulous sunset views of the mountains surrounding Phoenix. There is a small coffee bar in the lobby which has muffins, cold cereal, and sometimes salads & sandwiches for lunch, but it is only open until 1:00 p.m. They should expand this into a more full-service cafe to provide families with a better option for quick take-away food vs. a sit-down restaurant and also a place to get hot chocolate or maybe an ice cream in the evenings. The resort is right in the City of Phoenix, so it is possible to go off-property for food fairly easily if you have a car. FOR FAMILIES: I think it's a good resort for families, even w/very young children. It would be nice if there were some kind of playground onsite, however there is a nice city park w/playground a couple of miles down the road, but we were not told about it when we called to ask if the resort had a playground. In lieu of a playground, there is lots of space on the grounds for leisurely strolls with toddlers. They do have a nanny/babysitting service for a fee, but we did not try it. GOLF: my husband played and said it was a beautiful course.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great Golf Course, Great New Villas”
Reviews.Author: grsully
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited in February, it was our third stay in the last two years. We stayed in the new villas that overlook the 1st Fairway of the golf course. The Villas are beautiful, Kitchen, Living Room, Master Bedroom, with a huge bathroom, marble throughout. There was a waterfall right outside our master bedroom, the sound of water at night was very relaxing. The Golf course was in great shape, unbelieveable views, was fun to play, wish I could say the same about my score. We ate at the restaurant only once as we were spending time with friends in Scottsdale; the food was very good and fairly priced. The new lobby / Restaurant / Pro Shop were almost complete, which will add another level of quality of the Resort. We didn't spend time at the Water Park but everyone there looked to be having a good time. All in all we had a wonderful time and will be back again. I would recommend this highly.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Sarah555
Reviews.Content: At first glance this hotel seems to be quite luxurious, but actually the suites are quite average in terms of amenities and the fact that they are all suites, rather than ordinary hotel rooms, means that they are unneccesarily expensive. I terms of in-suite amenities it seemed to be lacking to me, for example, no shower gel, no bathrobes, cotton wool or shower cap, all things one would expect from a 4-star hotel, or even from a run-of-the-mill B&B. For a single traveller or a couple it is really not necessary to have a suite, though I can see the appeal if you have kids. All this serves to do is make all the rooms very expensive for the sake of a sofa, coffee table and extra TV that I didn't use at all. I am British, and I found the service levels a bit OTT. I do not require a golf cart to transport me to the bar, when it is all of a 3 minute walk away. I resent being forced to use a high-end sedan car rather than a regular cab, and then pay through the nose for it because the bellman takes a cut of the fare. I would advise against travelling to DownTown Phoenix for a night out, it is miles away and costs a fortune in taxi fares, and there is really nothing there. According to the taxi driver on the way home, it is better in Tempe (which is also a bit closer) but we didn't try this. The hotel restaurant is pleasant, but overpriced. Aunt Chilada's is pretty good, and cheaper. We also went to the Rustler's Rooste which is the only other place within walking distance of the hotel, but I don't think it is part of the resort itself. It is worth a visit - tacky, but in a good way! The pools are nice, and we also enjoyed the spa and the Oasis Water Park (though the latter is only open Sat & Sun at this time of year). The location of the resort on the egde of South Mountain Park is good for outdoor activities - we did some hiking and horseriding, which was very nice, and there is also a golf course (though note this is not as nice as the photos on the website would have you believe). Everything here is expensive. I know the exchange rate between the pound and the dollar is not favourable right now, but even when it was, I would say this place is on the pricey side and I can only assume this is because it is a resort and people tend to stay put so they have a captive market. If you don't have a car, it is really too expensive to get out and about by taxi. We would have liked to have gone to the botanical gardens but it would have cost us around £50 in taxis! I travelled here on business and thus this hotel was not my choice. I would like to visit this part of the US again some time in the future, but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli A
Reviews.Content: I was there on a pleasure trip and my boyfriend was there as a business trip. It is a beautiful resort but not laid out the best. Everything requires a 5-10 minute walk. Not that that's far but when you want to simply grab a quick drink or bite to eat its kind of inconvenient. They are remodeling the front lobby and adding a sports bar and grill and a pro golf shop so that will make things much nicer! We stayed in the Camelback Suites and the rooms were very nice. Very comfortable beds!!! I had the pleasure of getting a facial and LOVED it! They were very accomodating when trying to schedule my appointment. Also the ladies at the consciere (spelling?) desk were extremely friendly and helpful! Since we stayed here in January it wasn't quite warm enough for the waterpark or swimming but looked like it would be fun. We ate at Rustlers Rouste restaurant and this is a must try!!!!! Great atmosphere, good food! Try the Sunset Mountain Punch (or something like that). They actually light this drink on fire. Also you must slide down the slide! Not going to say anymore you just need to experience it yourself. Overall, I would recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: FunWATravelers
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at the Arizona Grand Resort in Phoenix. The name says it all--it is GRAND! This is a beautiful property and we wished we could have stayed longer than just the one night that we were able to before flying out. I would definitely suggest to plan on extending your stay by at least one night or more if you can so that you can really relax and unwind. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warm smiles and hospitable hellos from the front desk staff as well as the bellmen. We were always asked if we needed assistance wherever we went, which is a nice change from some larger chain hotel companies that we have stayed at-this felt like a friends home that we were visiting-we didn't get lost in the shuffle. Our room was clean and as the hotel just went through a rennovation, we were very pleased with our accomodations. Since this is an all suite resort, each room has a living room and a separate master bedroom- a great layout. We had a great nights sleep. We had time to visit the fitness center and was amazed that such a large fitness center was at a hotel-this is not your normal "after thought" of a fitness center-it could be your local gym, but of course, much more upgraded. We didn't have time to visit the spa, although while we were relaxing in the spa, we did chat with two other guests who had a treatment that day and had rave reviews. The restaurants on property were exceptional and again, the service was warm and friendly the entire time. We used the check out service through the guest services menu in the morning, which was nice as it allowed us to be on the road and to the airport in no time... and the airport is only 5 minutes away, so very convenient to get there quickly. I would recommend a stay at the Arizona Grand Resort. You really feel like you are in an Oasis...its hard to believe this jewel is right in the city! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Arizona Grand Resort is Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: NCErinMc
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful stay at the Arizona Grand Resort! I was there to coordinate a corporate event for our company and clients. In a word - WOW! The resort itself is absolutely beautiful (I wish I could have stayed longer to enjoy all the fabulous amenities)! The staff was super – professional, accommodating, extremely helpful and full of wonderful suggestions to make our event a huge success. The food especially was a big hit - I think everyone went back for seconds (and even thirds)! I hope this was the first of many more trips to the Arizona Grand Resort! I definitely recommend checking them out – whether for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “My Family LOVES THIS PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixTravelerMom
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. I can't believe anyone else that had a negative review of this resort! We travel to many resorts throughout the U.S. and this was one of the TOPS! The rooms were so clean and nice. Very updated and modern decor. The staff was extremely friendly. The waterpark is the best. My family had a ball, well worth every dime we spent. Great service in the waterpark. Check-in and check-out was easy and professional. Great restaurants on and around the property! The staff has definitely been trained well on Great Service! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort!”
Reviews.Author: travelwith2kids_8
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 4 relaxing days at the Arizona Grand Resort. I was looking for a hotel that was family friendly and had a little adult fun too for my husbands birthday weekend. Having booked the resort online through Expedia I wasn't sure what to expect, but all the reviews sounded pretty good. What a surprise to find a beautiful well maintianed resort with a professional and very accomodating staff. We arrived before check in time, with no problem they gave us our room. A valet drove us to our room and helped us with our bags. We then went to the Oasis Water Park which was a fantstic attraction for both my 3 year old and my 11 month old. We spent both Saturday and Sunday at the waterpark. The lazy river was the hi-light for both children. With Seasonal hours the Oasis was closed the rest of the week so my husband golfed the resorts' course on Monday. He is a pretty avid golfer, golfing at least 3 times a month, and he was pleasantly surprised with this challenging course. It had recently been reseeded so the entire course was flawless. Very impressive course! We were at the resort during their off season, so there were very little crowds anywhere we ventured in the resort. The restaurants were great as well. The Rustlers Roost was a hit with my 3 year old since it is decked out with cowboys, a live bull in the front of the restaurant, and a tin slide in which you can enter the dining area. The Rainforest Cafe is down the street from the Resort, and the Resorts Aunt Chiladas Mexican restaurant had wonderful service and great Mexican food. The workout facility was well equiped and readily available to work out in most parts of the day. We did not have a chance to use the spa facilities. Overall, we were pleasantly surprised with the entire resorts', impeccable grounds and efficient staff. We are looking forward to our next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave your bags at the Bell Desk!”
Reviews.Author: adomatic
Reviews.Content: Just a heads up for anyone who might stay at this hotel. My ipod was stole from my bag which was left with the Bell Desk. Since I had to check out before I actually had to leave the hotel, I left my bags with the bell desk at the front of the hotel. A suitcase and a backpack. A thief went into my backpack and took my ipod. Thinking back, I realize that their bag room is not secure at all. Not only do all the bell men go in and out, but anyone could walk in there. It's not secure at all. I do have to say that the security department at the hotel has been helpful (short of replacing my stolen property).

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: kk1152
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AZ Grand after a few very busy days touring through northern AZ so we really wanted a relaxing time. We liked the idea of the golf carts taking you everywhere and they were there right away - of course this was considered "off season" but we were happy with the response. First nite just did the pool - not heated as they had said - and then room service - VERY expensive, don't know if families could afford it. We had a spa day the next day which was heaven - again expensive but we had one of the packages and I knew in advance the price - it was our treat to ourselves. Went to dinner at Elements - a place the concierge had suggested - beautiful and delicious. My daughter went horseback riding the following day - again they picked her up - and she was impressed with the "wrangler" an the stables. All in all we enjoyed it and would go back - but would NOT get room service due to the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, this will be thre worst honeymoon ever”
Reviews.Author: NattyAK
Reviews.Content: 1st the waterpark was closed even though the website said it was open, the #1 reason we went. It was 103 degrees and it was closed? 2nd after swimming at the small pool that was open, while in the process of changing an employee walked into our room to fill the mini-bar even though we had the "do not disturb" sign on. We told him to leave. 3rd after our second swim and placing the "do not distrub" sign on the door, my husbands wallet had a $100 bill stolen out of his wallet. We were 2 flights of stairs down and they had the nerve to do it while we were walking down the stairs, as that was the only time our room wasn't in site. We knew it was missing as I had just placed all the dollars in his wallet. 4th the bill was slide under the door and reflected a price $50 more than the agreed upon price from cheaprooms.com, plus we were charged the resort fee, when the waterpark wasn't even open. Um...yeah...wanting a getaway honeymoon and traveling from Alaska? Don't go here. Parks limited hours, no privacy, robbed, and then they tried to rob me again with the bill. No thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away it cost to much and it not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Dallas0990
Reviews.Content: This place look old , if you just want something to fill the weekend then its your place. Beware is doesn't have continental breakfast and no free internet. I will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Trip”
Reviews.Author: OrangeTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business convention. The service was great, the resort has many things to do, and it is located near the airport. You can bring a family and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: geekgirl53
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and was immediately taken by golf cart to a nice room with a view. It faced the road but there was very little noise. There were 2 conferences at the resort but they did a fabulous job of keeping them separate. I was in the Sedona building, easy access to everything. There was a waterpark but it was closed. There were pools in the courtyards of all the buildings that were open during my stay. The mandatory "resort fee" was a little excessive since I didn't use any of the facilities except internet. I let them keep the mini-bar key so there would be no surprise charges. The room was comfortable with a separate bedroom and very tiny bathroom. There were 2 TVs but only one remote - not good if 2 people want to watch TV at the same time. Bathroom was tiny but seemed very clean, lots of fluffy towels. Bed was comfy but the pillows were vary small. One was not enough, two was too many. Overall, a very nice resort and I'd absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sydtayscott
Reviews.Content: Well first of all, we had a wonderful time. The resort was beautiful and the kids loved it. The waterpark was great and kept the children busy for hours. The rooms were spacious due to the living room area. The children loved having two televisions. We booked our vacation through US Airways Vacations. It was the best deal around but more importantly we did not have to pay the resort fee. They did charge us the daily $25 resort fee. However my friend inquired about the fee and another worker told us we should not have been charged because we booked with US Airways and stayed more than 3 nights. They did try to hold $600 on my friends credit card despite the trip being paid in full in advance. Therefore they AGREED to only hold $300. Other than those incidences we had a good time. We did go on the Hummer ride in the desert. We went on a tour of the Grand Canyon and to the western themed town of Raw Hide. The kids loved it all. It was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families - Sacrifice on Service”
Reviews.Author: catrick14
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this resort during Labor Day weekend. This is one of those megaresorts that has everything: wave pool, water slides, lazy river, movie by pool side at night, etc. They also offer kids tattoos, animal balloons, and caricature drawings during the day. This resort is ideal for families who want activity, over service. Service was lacking for us. For example, the balloonist at the pool was extremely unfriendly and decided to cut the line in front of my daughter, twenty minutes before the time he said they were closed! This happened to us two days in a row. Hmmm... The bell desk also kept giving away our transportation to someone else, despite the fact that we called each time and made reservations for specific pick up times. The guests who were given our rides told us that they did not. One time, we had to wait 20 minutes for the next car and almost missed our reservations. For the price, this resort was a good deal (our toddler loved it) but I guess for those who want better service, smaller boutique-styled resorts that are more service-oriented are the way to go. If you do give this resort a try, stay in the Camelot or Sedona buildings since they are closest to the water park. Camelot is closer to the spa and Phantom Horse Grill (best restaurant on site, IMO, with a view of the city). Each building has its own adult-only pool and family pool. This was especially nice during those times when the water park was so packed, we couldn’t find any empty chairs. The food at the Phantom Horse Grill was better than the other restaurants we tried -- nice way to end the evening by enjoying a meal by the firepit with city views. We also tried Aunt Chilada’s, which was pretty good, especially the tacos and chips/salsa. The food at the pool side Oasis was horrible (philly steak sandwich, hotdogs with dried out hard buns, and wings), but I didn’t expect much since it was convenient and quick. Ruslter’s Roose offers cowboy-style fare, like fried chicken, ribs, steaks, etc. The food was pretty good there and the dining experience great for families (indoor slide and balloonist, who was extremely friendly and attentive, who made balloons for the kids while you ate). We also ordered room service for breakfast. It was average and really pricey but service was quick. I just wish they offered more options for breakfast at this resort. Also, the resort offers horseback riding if your children are 6 yrs old and up. If not, you can take an 8 mile drive to the Ponderosa Stable where they allow toddlers to ride with parents -- which is what we did. Service at the Ponderosa Stable was spectacular and their rates are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “great for everyone”
Reviews.Author: mkk1
Reviews.Content: What a great resort! I was a bit nervous about the "waterpark" because of past experience with gigantic waterparks where I spend the entire time trying to keep an eye on my kids. It was the perfect size. Big enough for the kids to have fun yet small and calm enough for me to relax! Our room in the Camelback section was lovely with nice sheets (my pet peeve!). Only ate in the Mexican restaurant which was really bad and the snack bar at the pool which was good for that type of food. Ordered room service one night and that was average but scored big for quick accurate delivery. With the variety of pools and things to do I think this is a good resort to please most everyone for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: dmredsox
Reviews.Content: What a great resort for a family. The rooms have been renovated and are as nice as any of the five star resorts in greater phoenix, the service was superb and the water park is so much fun... A great value...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Arizona Grand”
Reviews.Author: StavrosVancouver
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a top notch hotel in Phoenix for the whole family try the Arizona Grand. It is an all suite hotel with lots of great updates. They have a water park called Oasis that the kids will love. It includes giant water slides, a lazy river and wave pool. On the weekends they show movies at night which you can watch from the water which is a good thing as it tends to get pretty hot in Phoenix in the summer. They have numerous great places to eat along with a great health club. To top it off when you have had enough of the water park there are pools throughout the resort that you can enjoy with the onslaught of kids. Good location with a golf course on site. 15 minutes to the airport, 20 minutes from downtown and 20 minutes from Scotsdale. Will for sure go again. S.Young Vancouver, British Columbia

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beware of the 1 RUDE lifeguard though.”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagainTucson
Reviews.Content: So I took the familt to the Az grand resort on August 8th, because of the waterpark mostly. Kind of overpriced for the Splash package, was 300 overall after all the charges, but got a 50 rest. credit. Used it at Aunt Chiladas, great food and service. We get there and check in, no problems. We go to the waterpark, and the kids were having a blast, they are 6 and 11. They ride the two big tubes and the "serpentine tube" lots of times. Anyway, at 2pm they switched lifeguards at the top, and this young,short sandy haired, slightly chubby man about 19 comes on. See...they have a height restriction of 48 inches that the other guards are pretty cool about if you are within a few inches. my daughter is 3'101/2. Anyway, we are in line, and this guy copes a major attitude, jumps out of his chair, very confrontational, and makes my daughter line up to the "measuring stick" and she is just shy. He says she cant go, and when I try to talk to him about it, he says "do you want me to kick you and the kids out of the park"? I said..."what"? and he instructed us to get down that instant! Very unprofessional. Anyway, before I blew my stack and went off on the guy, I decided it wasn't worth it, and took my kids down. My daughter was bawling her eyes out. ..he left at 235 pm., and we rolled right back up and started riding again. Anyway...overall a good time...nice room, very nice beds, a little crowded but hey its the summer. All I would suggest is to get that guy out of working with the public in any capacity...hopefully your kids wont encounter him, he was the only bad one in the whole group of lifeguards...a REALLY bad one. Its a shame how one horrible experience could mess up a trip, but that put a dent on if I will ever go there again, or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family resort”
Reviews.Author: Betweet
Reviews.Content: Great resort for the money. Paid around 90 dollars through expedia. The staff was nice. But I do have a warning for future travelors. I was aware of the 25 dollar resort charge but no one has ever mentioned the 600 dollar hold they put on your credit card when you check in. Yes I'm not kidding, I've heard of a 200 dollar hold at previous hotels I've stayed at but never this much. Since I was checking in with my visa check card this would have wiped out all the money I had in my account. This wasn't mentioned to me when I checked in and If I hadn't heard another employee telling a customer I would have never known. I did discuss this with the lady a the desk and she talked to her manager and they released 300 dollars off my account. I wish this was mentioned when you checked in and mentioned when you reserve a room online. Overall we loved the resort, great place for family with kids. They did monitor anyone coming in the water park and no one was let in without a arm band. You must eat at the Rustlers Rooste restraunt behind the hotel, great food for a great price.!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Mini Vacation for a Family”
Reviews.Author: Family12345
Reviews.Content: We were there Sun. through Tues. It was a mini family vacation for us and it was perfect. We utilized all pools and the cactus kids club. We had a room in the camelback suites that overlooked the oasis waterpark. It was perfect. We took the kids to the Rustler's Rooste which they loved! All the reviews prior to this were helpful! We were also able to get a little shopping in at the Arizona Mills outlet mall. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: trojansb
Reviews.Content: Third stay at this resort was the best ever. Newly renovated rooms are great, water park a blast as usual, and food excellent with lots of choices. The staff was very friendly. Highly recommend if you have kids that like water parks. Mine are 10 and 13 and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Nanek
Reviews.Content: We expected to have great weekend but we are very disappointed. We stayed at Mountainside. Room was dirty and stinky, very dark, carpet was wet, “coffee table” and “night stands” painted few times and cracked. Rest of furniture same. Blanket on the bed didn’t look clean and was ugliest I’ve ever seen. We didn’t even stay there overnight. Thanks God we live in Phoenix only 30 minutes from there. Water park was ok. Very crowded. Staff was friendly. Don’t get tempted buy their website. Everything looks great there with taste of luxury, but its only a good pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: travelinfoolUSA
Reviews.Content: We took the kids because we thought they'd enjoy the water park and a nice getaway weekend in nice surroundings, with a great mall across the street. The water park is really the big draw for kids but other than that, this place is really nothing special. It is SO crowded. Parking is almost impossible. We parked on the street (which is still on the grounds) and our vehicle was saturated by the sprinklers. The congestion around the "resort" and mall, as well as on the grounds was a constant hassle. As for the restaurants, Rustler's Rooste is overcrowded, overpriced, and the service was lousy. Room is "OK". Since they cater to families, you'd think they'd have a microwave and fridge, but they don't. Bathroom is very small. Place is noisy, crowded, and a pain to get around. The maid stopped by to clean the room and we were getting ready to leave. She said she'd be back in 1/2 hour. We called housekeeping 8 hours later when we returned to see if we could get the room cleaned. Staff are overwhelmed. The $25 per day resort fee is a joke if you don't use the water park. This place is no resort-- trust me. It's just a massive Embassy Suites without the space, fridge or microwave. Recommended? Only if you get a smokin' deal and are specifically going for the water park. Also, if you don't mind crowds and lots of noise and traffic.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful vacation !”
Reviews.Author: jwooley
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from the arizona grand . We were an extended family of 23, ages 4 to 82. The rooms in Camelback were spacious, clean and the beds were spotless and comfortable.We liked the food in all the venues and the staff was always polite and friendly. When I plan a vacation , I prefer the name brand quality I can count on. But when I saw the all suite rooms, the water park, and the south pointe mt that provided hiking trails and the horses we wanted to ride , I took a leap of faith and was so glad I did !

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: RufinoAndres
Reviews.Content: Great Resort, Great Prices, Friendly Staff and Fun for the whole family. Just got back from the Arizona Grand Resort with the family (2 yr old & 4 yr old) and we had a wonderfull time. We can assure you that we will return to this Resort. Food prices at the Oasis Water Park are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Local Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JennFredAZ
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend at the Arizona Grand Resort. We were looking for a local hotel with gas prices being so high we didn't want to travel too much. We stayed in the Camelback building which just underwent room re-designs. They were very comfortable, clean and spacious two room suites. The water park is the biggest draw and it was fun for the afternoon. Lots of kids. Overall it was a great way to unwind though. They even had steel drum music before lunch which I love. Reminds me of the Carribbean. The restaurants were varied. Breakfast was just your standard. Chips and salsa were great at the Mexican place and I was actually suprised at how tasty my steak was at the steakhouse. I figured it would be on par with Outback or something because of the whole cowboy theme but was pleasantly suprised. It is a big place so there is some walking involved but you could always call the front desk for a ride. Great gym and spa facilities. And we really enjoyed the horseback riding. Overall the staff was very friendly and helpful. Other people wrote about the construction and we saw that they were building something but never heard construction noises.

Reviews.Title: “Warning, surprise at end of stay”
Reviews.Author: rymes52
Reviews.Content: Beware, you will be charged a $25 per day resort fee on top of your room rate wherever you booked it.

Reviews.Title: “Anything but Grand”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Mellow_Man
Reviews.Content: We came up from Tucson with the two kids to play at the water park, which is the only thing this place has going for it. You are definitely just another tourist in this place and there is very little feeling that you are in a resort. We picked this one because we heard they had a great water park, but I have no desire to return. The water park just isn't that great. On top of that, this is one of those places where you think you are getting a great deal until you actually get here and find out they nickel and dime you for everything and it is all 3 times as expensive as it ought to be. Drinks at the pool are $8. I got the bill today and found I have a $25 "resort fee" which I never knew I would be paying. This on top of the $20 "upgrade" they convinced us we must have when we checked in. This was so we could have the new furnishings and wireless. Apparently we would have been in a real dump without the upgrade, next to the freeway and FAR from the water park with old furnishings and no internet. Add to this the fact that the whole place is under construction and you wake up to jack hammers every morning. The staff act as if you are in their way. I shared a guest, not service, elevator with a cart full of what smelled like rotting brocolli yesterday morning at 7:30am. That killed my breakfast appetite. Next time I'll book a hotel near a real water park and skip the attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Kids loved it.”
Reviews.Author: NashTraveler24
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days after our trip to the Grand Canyon. It was a great place to finish out the trip. We had a nice suite facing the Oasis pool area. It's a big place, but easy to get around. Bell hops are glad to take you by golf cart to any of the places you don't want to walk, e.g., Spa or restaurants. Oasis pool area was really nice - not crowded at all when we were there mid-week. Water park closes at 8pm, but two other regular pools/hot tubs stay open until midnight. Phanton Horse Grille was nice place to eat, and kids had a great time at Rustlers Rooste, a western-themed restaurant just up the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Great waterpark....great time but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: Nora_AZ
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel as a special Summer rate of $139 per night (plus a $25 resort fee per day) First of all this is a great resort to stay at if you have kids who like water parks. My 15 year old had a blast here. Once he saw the water park I didn't hardly see him for the rest of the stay. I stayed in the newly remodeled Camelback Suites. I have stayed in 4* hotels before and whereas this suite was nice, there were parts to it that I didn't find 4*. First of all why a newly remodeled suite would have a 25" outdated tube tv is beyond me. The couch was a bit uncomfortable to watch tv in the evenings. It was ok to sit there for an hour but anything beyond an hour was uncomfortable. The other thing was the size of the bathroom. It is tiny. My powder room at home is probably bigger than this bathroom. I had read about people complaining about the noise. Actually once in our suite, we didn't hear a thing. Our suite was so convenient to the water park we couldn't have had a better location. The hotel staff were very friendly and responsive to our needs. The best part of the whole stay and definitely worth the stay was the water park. Being able to relax poolside with a few drinks and know your kid is having a blast made this weekend getaway great. We will definitely be going back despite the negative things I listed. The things listed didn't make me not want to be there or make me not go back. They were just things that a 4* hotel would have.

Reviews.Title: “Some issues,yes. But the staff...FANTASTIC.”
Reviews.Author: kwesson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort from April 25th-27th. First, the good... The room was very clean and had all the items you would want. The actual mattress...extremely comfortable!!! Aunt Chilada's Mexican Restaurant....Muy Bueno! Everything we had there was great and our waiter, Thomas, was fantastic. The Oasis Water Park is clean, well staffed and a fun way to spend the day. There are flags on the back of the lounge chairs that when you want something to drink or eat...you just raise the flag and they'll come running. They were very quick to arrive and very polite. Bring some $$$ though, It can get pricey quick. Think movie concession prices. Caring and helpful staff. I had several complaints, and they addressed them the best they could and were always professional and sympathetic. Now the bad...(in my opinion) There are a lot of kids at this resort. A lot. Noise is a HUGE factor. This may sound weird...but they have the worlds most crunchiest sheets I've ever felt. It was like sleeping under a newspaper. Thank goodness, the bed itself was so comfortable. the pillows are down and they look so nice and fluffy on the bed, but after a minute, its like wearing feather ear-muffs, with the feathers disbursed to each side of your head and your neck on a pancake thin layer of feathers. If you can...bring your pillow from home. The Phantom Horse breakfast buffet...runny eggs and barely cooked sausage...however, in fairness, you can order alacart off the menu and the people who I saw did that, their food looked pretty good. The restuarant has nice atmosphere and great views. The patio would be a great place to eat at sunset. Did i mention how many kids there are at his resort? How they like to run up and down the corridors? Oh, i did? Ok...sorry. Needless to say, my initial stay at the resort was anything but peaceful and restful. It would be nice if the resort had at least one of their buildings designated as "adults only" for those who are looking for a more relaxed atmosphere. I contacted the General Manager, Paul Gray after my stay to discuss my disappointing weekend at the Grand. He not only listened to my concerns and disappointments. He was very quick to offer a solution and sincerely sounded like he wanted to make right anything that didn't go right the first time. I think that type of personal customer service is rare and because of his follow-up, I'd even give the Grand another chance to impress. Anyone who cares enough to follow-up and try to make things better, is probably someone who cares that you were there in the first place! So, my first stay...not so good, but I'm encouraged, the next time will be better. I'll keep you posted. :O) KW

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Member008
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry the last reviewer had a horrible time, but my experience was the complete opposite. We picked the A.G.R. because of the great price ($159 a night) and the waterpark. My husband and I wanted someplace that would keep our 6 year old busy. The waterpark was very clean, the staff extremely friendly and the food & drink were reasonably priced. My only complaint about the waterpark is the waterslides were only for people 48" and taller. While my daughter is a good swimmer, she wasn't tall enough to use the slide and was upset about that. It would've been nice if they had a slide that catered to the smaller children and maybe a playground on the grounds. We stayed in the Camelback building and the suite was completely renovated. There were two heated pools in the courtyard of the Camelback along with a ping pong table. My only complaint about the room is the bathroom was very, very small. It was difficult to close the door unless you were practically standing in the tub and I'm average sized. I can only imagine what a large person has to do. The grounds were beautiful and well tended with flowers, trees, fireplaces and fountains. My daughter and I went to the spa where I had a massage and she had the Pretty Princess package; manicure, pedicure and hairstyling. The staff was professional, courteous and made us feel very comfortable. We had dinner at Rustler's Roost and Aunt Chilada's. Both were good, not spectacular but I didn't expect either of them to be a Michelin rated. I would highly recommend this extremely family friendly resort to just about everyone. However, if you choose this hotel, ask for either the Camelback or Sedona buildings because the Mountainview building isn't going to start being renovated until August.

Reviews.Title: “Kid friendly, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jcjohns91107
Reviews.Content: We took a spring break mini-vacation in late March, 2008. The resort is kid friendly, with a large water park with slides, river pool and wave pool. As a result, expect a lot of families with kids. The room was a suite as I think all the rooms are. Bathroom is a little small. We were in the Sedona Building, room 433. Had a view of an interior courtyard even though I requested a pool view. Room was in good condition, but maid service was sketchy. The maid finally showed uo the second day at almost 5pm, so we opted for clean towels only as we had just come back from the pool and wanted to get cleaned up. For some reason the hotel doesn't supply "do not disturb" signs for the doors. There is construction going on at the property to add buildings. It didn't really bother us. Most room had balconies which are basically un-usable because there is no furniture on them and they are small. Over all, the resort was ok. I don't know that I would call it 4 diamond and I didn't feel it was worth the $300 plus per night I paid.

HotelInfo.Name: Arizona Grand Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 8000 S. Arizona Grand Parkway, Phoenix, AZ 85044
